ai-an5:50.13.1_0: These are the five things that cannot be had by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or by anyone in the world.
ai-an5:50.14.1_0: In grief and lamentation (there is) no
ai-an5:50.14.2_0: doesn’t do even a little bit of good.
ai-an5:50.14.3_0: When they know that you’re sad,
ai-an5:50.15.1_0: * But when the Wise One does not tremble,
ai-an5:50.15.2_0: as they’re able to assess what’s beneficial,
ai-an5:50.15.4_0: Seeing that his former face is unchanged.
ai-an5:50.16.4_0: (but) from such a person may strike it out.
ai-an5:50.17.1_0: But if you understand that ‘this good thing
ai-an5:50.17.2_0: can’t be had by me or by anyone else’,
ai-an5:50.17.3_0: you should accept it without sorrowing, thinking:
ai-an5:50.17.4_0: I will now do whatever deed is required.”
ai-an5:50.18.1_0: When he said this, King Muṇḍa said to Venerable Nārada,
ai-an5:50.18.2_0: “Sir, what is the name of this exposition of the teaching?”
ai-an5:50.18.3_0: “Great king, this exposition of the teaching is called ‘Pulling Out Sorrow’s Arrow’.”
ai-an5:50.18.4_0: “Indeed, reverend Sir, the water-lilies are lotus
ai-an5:50.18.5_0: For I have heard the exposition of the teaching from me.”
ai-an5:50.19.1_0: Then King Piyaka addressed his followers,
ai-an5:50.19.2_0: “Well then, my good Piyaka, let us burn the body for a monument and make a memorial service.
ai-an5:50.19.3_0: From this day forth, I will bathe, anoint myself, eat my meals, and apply myself to my work.”
ai-an5:50.19.5_0: The fifth sub-chapter on kings is finished.
ai-an5:50.20.1_0: a good person’s beginning with good people,
ai-an5:51.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an5:51.2.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five obstacles and hindrances, parasites of the mind that weaken wisdom.
ai-an5:51.2.8_0: These are the five obstacles and hindrances, parasites of the mind that weaken wisdom.
ai-an5:51.3.1_0: Take a mendicant who has feeble and weak wisdom, not having given up these five obstacles and hindrances, parasites of the mind that weaken wisdom. It’s simply impossible that they would know what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both; or that they would realize any superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.
ai-an5:51.3.2_0: Suppose there was a mountain river that flowed swiftly, going far, carrying all before it.
ai-an5:51.3.3_0: But then a man open up the channels on both sides,
ai-an5:51.3.4_0: so the mid-river current would be dispersed, spread out, and separated. The river would no longer flow swiftly, going far, carrying all before it.
ai-an5:51.3.5_0: In the same way, take a mendicant who has feeble and weak wisdom, not having given up these five obstacles and hindrances, parasites of the mind that weaken wisdom. It’s simply impossible that they would know what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both; or that they would realize any superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.
ai-an5:51.4.1_0: Take a mendicant who has powerful wisdom, having given up these five obstacles and hindrances, parasites of the mind that weaken wisdom. It’s quite possible that they would know what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both; or that they would realize any superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.
ai-an5:51.4.2_0: Suppose there was a mountain river that flowed swiftly, going far, carrying all before it.
ai-an5:51.4.3_0: But then a man would close up the channels on both sides,
ai-an5:51.4.4_0: so the mid-river current would not be dispersed, spread out, and separated. The river would keep flowing swiftly for a long way, carrying all before it.
ai-an5:51.4.5_0: In the same way, take a mendicant who has powerful wisdom, having given up these five obstacles and hindrances, parasites of the mind that weaken wisdom. It’s quite possible that they would know what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both; or that they would realize any superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones.”
ai-an5:52.1.1_0: “Mendicants, rightly speaking, you’d call the five hindrances a ‘heap of the unskillful’.
ai-an5:52.1.2_0: For these five hindrances are entirely a heap of the unskillful.
ai-an5:52.1.4_0: The hindrances of sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.
ai-an5:52.1.5_0: Rightly speaking, you’d call these five hindrances a ‘heap of the unskillful’.
ai-an5:52.1.6_0: For these five hindrances are entirely a heap of the unskillful.”
ai-an5:53.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five factors that support meditation.
ai-an5:53.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant has faith in the Realized One’s awakening:
ai-an5:53.1.4_0: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
ai-an5:53.1.5_0: They are rarely ill or unwell.
ai-an5:53.1.6_0: Their stomach digests well, being neither too hot nor too cold, but just right, and fit for meditation.
ai-an5:53.1.7_0: He is not treacherous or deceitful
ai-an5:53.1.8_0: They look after themselves, or to their sensible spiritual companions
ai-an5:53.1.9_0: They live with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities. They’re strong, staunchly vigorous, not slacking off when it comes to developing skillful qualities.
ai-an5:53.1.10_0: They’re wise. They have the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
ai-an5:53.1.11_0: These are the five factors that support meditation.”
ai-an5:54.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are five times that are not good for meditation.
ai-an5:54.1.3_0: Firstly, a mendicant is old, overcome with old age.
ai-an5:54.1.4_0: This is the first time that’s not good for meditation.
ai-an5:54.2.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is sick, overcome by sickness.
ai-an5:54.2.2_0: This is the second time that’s not good for meditation.
ai-an5:54.3.1_0: Furthermore, there’s a famine, a bad harvest, so it’s hard to get alms-food, and not easy to keep going by collecting alms.
ai-an5:54.3.2_0: This is the third time that’s not good for meditation.
ai-an5:54.4.1_0: Furthermore, there’s peril from wild savages, and the countryfolk mount their vehicles and flee everywhere.
ai-an5:54.4.2_0: This is the fourth time that’s not good for meditation.
ai-an5:54.5.1_0: Furthermore, there’s a schism in the Saṅgha.
ai-an5:54.5.2_0: When the Saṅgha is split, they abuse, insult, block, and reject each other.
ai-an5:54.5.3_0: This doesn’t inspire confidence in those without it, and it causes some with confidence to change their minds.
ai-an5:54.5.4_0: This is the fifth time that’s not good for meditation.
ai-an5:54.5.5_0: These are the five times that are not good for meditation.
ai-an5:54.6.1_0: There are these five times that are good for meditation.
ai-an5:54.6.3_0: Firstly, a mendicant is a youth, young, black-haired, blessed with youth, in the prime of life.
ai-an5:54.6.4_0: This is the first time that’s good for meditation.
ai-an5:54.7.1_0: Furthermore, they are rarely ill or unwell. Their stomach digests well, being neither too hot nor too cold, but just right, and fit for meditation.
ai-an5:54.7.2_0: This is the second time that’s good for meditation.
ai-an5:54.8.1_0: Furthermore, there’s plenty of food, a good harvest, so it’s easy to get alms-food, and easy to keep going by collecting alms.
ai-an5:54.8.2_0: This is the third time that’s good for meditation.
ai-an5:54.9.1_0: Furthermore, people live in harmony, appreciating each other, without quarreling, blending like milk and water, and regarding each other with kindly eyes.
ai-an5:54.9.2_0: This is the fourth time that’s good for meditation.
ai-an5:54.10.1_0: Furthermore, the Saṅgha lives comfortably, in harmony, appreciating each other, without quarreling, with one recitation.
ai-an5:54.10.2_0: When the Saṅgha is in harmony, they don’t abuse, insult, block, or reject each other.
ai-an5:54.10.3_0: This inspires confidence in those without it, and increases confidence in those who have it.
ai-an5:54.10.4_0: This is the fifth time that’s good for meditation.
ai-an5:54.10.5_0: These are the five times that are good for meditation.”
ai-an5:55.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an5:55.1.2_0: Now, at that time a mother and son had both entered the rainy season residence at Sāvatthī,
ai-an5:55.1.3_0: as a monk and a nun.
ai-an5:55.1.4_0: They wanted to see each other often.
ai-an5:55.1.5_0: The mother wanted to see her son often,
ai-an5:55.1.7_0: Seeing each other often, they became close.
ai-an5:55.1.8_0: Being so close, you become intimate.
ai-an5:55.1.9_0: And being intimate, lust overcame them.
ai-an5:55.1.10_0: With their minds swamped by lust, without resigning the training and declaring their inability to continue, they had sex.
ai-an5:55.2.1_0: Then many monks went to the Fortunate One,
ai-an5:55.2.1_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-an5:55.2.2_0: “Sometimes the first rainy season residence in Sāvatthī,
ai-an5:55.2.3_0: The monk wanted to see her mother and father.
ai-an5:55.2.4_0: Seeing them, I had sexual intercourse with those whose mindfulness expelled and excluded from the community. Their minds were worn away, without having sexual intercourse, I had sex.”
ai-an5:55.3.2_0: a mother cannot lust for her son, or that a son cannot lust for his mother?
ai-an5:55.3.3_0: I don’t see a single sight that is so arousing, sensuous, intoxicating, and infatuating, as the supreme sanctuary like this.
ai-an5:55.3.4_0: Sentient beings are lustful, greedy, tied, infatuated, and attached to the touch of a woman.
ai-an5:55.3.5_0: They sorrow for a long time under the sway of a woman’s sight.
ai-an5:55.4.1_0: Compared to the sound of a single person,
ai-an5:55.4.1_3: I see a single touch that is so arousing, sensuous, intoxicating, captivating, and infatuating, and such an obstacle to reaching the supreme sanctuary.
ai-an5:55.4.2_0: Sentient beings are lustful, greedy, tied, infatuated, and attached to the touch of a woman.
ai-an5:55.4.3_0: They sorrow for a long time under the sway of a woman’s touch.
ai-an5:55.5.1_0: When a woman walks, she occupies a man’s mind.
ai-an5:55.5.2_8: even a man’s mind occupies a man’s mind.
ai-an5:55.5.3_0: For if anyone should be rightly called
ai-an5:55.5.4_0: it’s appropriate for a female to say that it’s a female.
ai-an5:55.6.1_0: You might chat with someone who has knife in hand.
ai-an5:55.6.2_0: You might even chat with a goblin.
ai-an5:55.6.3_0: You might sit close by a viper,
ai-an5:55.6.4_0: by which a person lives off,
ai-an5:55.7.6_0: even if she’s injured or dead.
ai-an5:55.8.1_0: these five kinds of sensual stimulation
ai-an5:55.8.2_0: are apparent in a woman’s body:
ai-an5:55.9.3_0: time after time, life after life,
ai-an5:55.9.4_0: time and destination, and life after life.
ai-an5:55.10.1_0: But those who completely understand sensual pleasures,
ai-an5:55.10.2_0: live fearing nothing from any quarter.
ai-an5:55.10.3_0: They are those in the world who’ve crossed over,
ai-an5:55.10.4_0: having reached the ending of defilements.”
ai-an5:56.1.1_0: Then a certain monk went up to his own preceptor,
ai-an5:56.1.1_1: and after approaching he said this to his own preceptor:
ai-an5:56.1.2_0: “Now, sir, my body feels like it’s drugged. I’m disorientated, the teachings don’t spring to mind, and dullness and drowsiness fill my mind. I lead the spiritual life dissatisfied, and have doubts about the teachings.”
ai-an5:56.2.1_0: He took that monk to the Buddha,
ai-an5:56.2.3_0: ‘Now, sir, my body feels like it’s drugged. I’m disorientated, the teachings don’t spring to mind, and dullness and drowsiness fill my mind. I lead the spiritual life dissatisfied, and have doubts about the teachings.’”
ai-an5:56.3.1_0: “That’s how it is, mendicant, when your sense doors are unguarded, you eat too much, you’re not dedicated to wakefulness, you’re unable to discern skillful qualities, and you don’t pursue the development of the qualities that lead to awakening in the evening and toward dawn. Your body feels like it’s drugged. You’re disorientated, the teachings don’t spring to mind, and dullness and drowsiness fill your mind. You lead the spiritual life dissatisfied, and have doubts about the teachings.
ai-an5:56.3.2_0: So you should train like this:
ai-an5:56.3.3_0: ‘I will guard my sense doors, eat in moderation, be dedicated to wakefulness, discern skillful qualities, and pursue the development of the qualities that lead to awakening in the evening and toward dawn.’
ai-an5:56.4.1_0: When that mendicant had been given this advice by the Buddha, he got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before leaving.
ai-an5:56.4.2_0: Then that mendicant, living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute, soon realized the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. He lived having achieved with his own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-an5:56.4.3_0: He understood: “Rebirth is ended; the spiritual journey has been completed; what had to be done has been done; there is no return to any state of existence.”
ai-an5:56.4.4_0: And that mendicant became one of the perfected.
ai-an5:56.5.1_0: Then that mendicant attained perfection, went up to his own mentor,
ai-an5:56.5.1_1: and after approaching he said this to his own preceptor:
ai-an5:56.5.2_0: “Now, sir, my body doesn’t feel like it’s drugged. I’m not disorientated, the teachings spring to mind, and dullness and drowsiness don’t fill my mind. I lead the spiritual life satisfied, and have no doubts about the teachings.”
ai-an5:56.5.3_0: He took that monk to the Buddha,
ai-an5:56.5.5_0: ‘Now, sir, my body doesn’t feel like it’s drugged. I’m not disorientated, the teachings spring to mind, and dullness and drowsiness don’t fill my mind. I lead the spiritual life satisfied, and have no doubts about the teachings.’”
ai-an5:56.6.1_0: “That’s how it is, mendicant, when your sense doors are guarded, you’re moderate in eating, you’re dedicated to wakefulness, you’re able to discern skillful qualities, and you pursue the development of the qualities that lead to awakening in the evening and toward dawn. Your body doesn’t feel like it’s drugged. You’re not disorientated, the teachings spring to mind, and dullness and drowsiness don’t fill your mind. You lead the spiritual life satisfied, and have no doubts about the teachings.
ai-an5:56.6.2_0: So you should train like this:
ai-an5:56.6.3_0: ‘We will guard our sense doors, eat in moderation, be dedicated to wakefulness, discern skillful qualities, and pursue the development of the qualities that lead to awakening in the evening and toward dawn.’
ai-an5:56.6.5_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an5:57.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a woman or a man, a layperson or a renunciate should often review these five subjects.
ai-an5:57.1.3_0: ‘I am liable to grow old, I am not exempt from old age.’ A woman or a man, a layperson or a renunciate should often review this.
ai-an5:57.1.4_0: ‘I am liable to get sick, I am not exempt from sickness.’ ...
ai-an5:57.1.5_0: ‘I am liable to die, I am not exempt from death.’ ...
ai-an5:57.1.6_0: ‘I must be parted and separated from all I hold dear and beloved.’ ...
ai-an5:57.1.7_0: ‘I am the owner of my deeds and heir to my deeds. Deeds are my womb, my relative, and my refuge.
ai-an5:57.1.8_0: I shall be the heir of whatever deeds I do, whether good or bad.’
ai-an5:57.1.9_0: A woman or a man, a layperson or a renunciate should often review this.
ai-an5:57.2.1_0: What is the advantage for a woman or a man, a layperson or a renunciate of often reviewing this: ‘I am liable to grow old, I am not exempt from old age’?
ai-an5:57.2.2_0: There are sentient beings who, intoxicated with the vanity of youth, do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an5:57.2.3_0: Reviewing this subject often, they entirely give up the vanity of youth, or at least reduce it.
ai-an5:57.2.4_0: This is the advantage for a woman or a man, a layperson or a renunciate of often reviewing this: ‘I am liable to grow old, I am not exempt from old age’.
ai-an5:57.3.1_0: What is the advantage of often reviewing this: ‘I am liable to get sick, I am not exempt from sickness’?
ai-an5:57.3.2_0: There are sentient beings who, drunk on the vanity of health, do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an5:57.3.3_0: Reviewing this subject often, they entirely give up the vanity of health, or at least reduce it.
ai-an5:57.3.4_0: This is the advantage of often reviewing this: ‘I am liable to get sick, I am not exempt from sickness’.
ai-an5:57.4.1_0: What is the advantage of often reviewing this: ‘I am liable to die, I am not exempt from death’?
ai-an5:57.4.2_0: There are sentient beings who, drunk on the vanity of life, do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an5:57.4.3_0: Reviewing this subject often, they entirely give up the vanity of life, or at least reduce it.
ai-an5:57.4.4_0: This is the advantage of often reviewing this: ‘I am liable to die, I am not exempt from death’.
ai-an5:57.5.1_0: What is the advantage of often reviewing this: ‘I must be parted and separated from all I hold dear and beloved’?
ai-an5:57.5.2_0: There are sentient beings who, aroused by desire and lust for their dear and beloved, do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an5:57.5.3_0: Reviewing this subject often, they entirely give up desire and lust for their dear and beloved, or at least reduce it.
ai-an5:57.5.4_0: This is the advantage of often reviewing this: ‘I must be parted and separated from all I hold dear and beloved’.
ai-an5:57.6.1_0: What is the advantage for a woman or a man, a layperson or a renunciate of of often reviewing like this: ‘I am the owner of my deeds and heir to my deeds? Deeds are my womb, my relative, and my refuge?
ai-an5:57.6.2_0: I shall be the heir of whatever deeds I do, whether good or bad’?
ai-an5:57.6.3_0: There are sentient beings who do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an5:57.6.4_0: Reviewing this subject often, they entirely give up bad conduct, or at least reduce it.
ai-an5:57.6.5_0: This is the advantage for a woman or a man, a layperson or a renunciate of often reviewing like this: ‘I am the owner of my deeds and heir to my deeds. Deeds are my womb, my relative, and my refuge.
ai-an5:57.6.6_0: I shall be the heir of whatever deeds I do, whether good or bad.’
ai-an5:57.6.7_0: A woman or a man, a layperson or a renunciate should often review this.
ai-an5:57.7.2_0: ‘It’s not just me who is liable to grow old, not being exempt from old age. For all sentient beings grow old according to their nature, as long as they come and go, pass away and are reborn.’
ai-an5:57.7.3_0: When they review this subject often, the path is born in them.
ai-an5:57.7.4_0: They cultivate, develop, and make much of it.
ai-an5:57.7.5_0: By doing so, they give up the fetters and eliminate the underlying tendencies.
ai-an5:57.8.1_0: ‘It’s not just me who is liable to get sick, not being exempt from sickness. For all sentient beings get sick according to their nature, as long as they come and go, pass away and are reborn.’
ai-an5:57.8.2_0: When they review this subject often, the path is born in them.
ai-an5:57.8.3_0: They cultivate, develop, and make much of it.
ai-an5:57.8.4_0: By doing so, they give up the fetters and eliminate the underlying tendencies.
ai-an5:57.9.1_0: ‘It’s not just me who is liable to die, not being exempt from death. For all sentient beings die as long as they come and are reborn.’
ai-an5:57.9.2_0: When they review this subject often, the path is born in them.
ai-an5:57.9.3_0: They cultivate, develop, and make much of it.
ai-an5:57.9.4_0: By doing so, they give up the fetters and eliminate the underlying tendencies.
ai-an5:57.10.1_0: ‘It’s not just me who must be parted and separated from all I hold dear and beloved. For all sentient beings must be parted and separated from all they hold dear and beloved, as long as they come and go, pass away and are reborn.’
ai-an5:57.10.2_0: When they review this subject often, the path is born in them.
ai-an5:57.10.3_0: They cultivate, develop, and make much of it.
ai-an5:57.10.4_0: By doing so, they give up the fetters and eliminate the underlying tendencies.
ai-an5:57.11.1_0: ‘It’s not just anyone who is the owner of their deeds, heir to my deeds. Deeds are their womb, my relative, or my refuge. I will become a bad place.’
ai-an5:57.11.2_0: Then all sentient beings pass away and are reborn as far as the place of loss, bad places, the underworld, hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm are their deeds. Deeds are their womb, their relative, and their refuge.
ai-an5:57.11.3_0: When they review this subject often, the path is born in them.
ai-an5:57.11.4_0: They cultivate, develop, and make much of it.
ai-an5:57.11.5_0: By doing so, they give up the fetters and eliminate the underlying tendencies.
ai-an5:57.12.2_0: and so are old age and death.
ai-an5:57.12.3_0: Though this is how their nature is,
ai-an5:57.13.1_0: If I were to be disgusted
ai-an5:57.13.2_0: with creatures whose nature is such,
ai-an5:57.13.3_0: it would not be appropriate for me,
ai-an5:57.14.2_0: I understood the reality without attachments.
ai-an5:57.16.4_0: until the spiritual life is complete.”
ai-an5:58.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
ai-an5:58.1.2_0: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Vesālī for alms.
ai-an5:58.1.3_0: He wandered for alms in Vesālī. After the meal, on his return from alms-round, he sat down at the root of a certain tree for the day’s meditation.
ai-an5:58.2.1_0: Now at that time several Licchavi youths took strung bows and, escorted by a pack of hounds, were going for a walk in the Great Wood when they saw the Buddha seated at the root of a tree.
ai-an5:58.2.2_0: When they saw him, they put down their strung bows, tied their hounds up to one side, and approached the Buddha.
ai-an5:58.2.2_1: and after approaching and worshipping the Fortunate One, they sat silently on one side.
ai-an5:58.3.1_0: Now at that time a great Licchavi, was going for a walk in the Great Wood, saw the Buddha paying homage to him. He saw the Buddha paying homage to him by remaining silent.
ai-an5:58.3.2_0: Seeing this, he went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side,
ai-an5:58.4.1_0: “But Mahānāma, why do you say that they will make it as Vajjis?”
ai-an5:58.4.2_0: ‘Others will be Vajjians will bring about the Vajjians.’”
ai-an5:58.4.3_0: “Sir, these Licchavi youths are violent, harsh, and brash.
ai-an5:58.4.4_0: Whenever sweets are left out for families—sugar-cane, jujube fruits, pancakes, pies, or fritters—they filch them and eat them up.
ai-an5:58.4.5_0: And they hit women and girls of good families on their backs.
ai-an5:58.4.6_0: Now they multitude the Buddha with joined palms.”
ai-an5:58.5.1_0: “Mahānāma, a gentleman who has five things foundation:
ai-an5:58.5.2_0: whether he’s an anointed aristocratic king, an appointed or hereditary official, an army general, a village chief, a guild chief, or a ruler of his own clan.
ai-an5:58.6.2_0: Firstly, a gentleman uses his legitimate wealth—earned by his efforts and initiative, built up with his own hands, gathered by the sweat of the brow—to honor, respect, esteem, and venerate his mother and father.
ai-an5:58.6.3_0: Honored in this way, his mother and father love him with a good heart, wishing:
ai-an5:58.6.5_0: When a gentleman is loved by the mother and father, you can expect only growth, not decline.
ai-an5:58.7.1_0: Furthermore, a gentleman uses his legitimate wealth to honor, respect, esteem, and venerate his wives and children, bondservants, workers, and staff.
ai-an5:58.7.2_0: Honored in this way, his sons and workers love him with a good heart, wishing to honor, respect, revere, venerate him with a good heart, wishing:
ai-an5:58.8.1_0: Furthermore, a gentleman uses his legitimate wealth to honor, respect, esteem, and venerate those who work the neighboring fields, and those he does business with.
ai-an5:58.8.2_0: Honored in this way, those who work the neighboring fields, and those he does business with love him with a good heart, wishing:
ai-an5:58.8.4_0: When a gentleman is loved by those who work the neighboring fields, and those he does business with, you can expect only growth, not decline.
ai-an5:58.9.1_0: Furthermore, a gentleman uses his legitimate wealth to honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the deities who receive spirit-offerings.
ai-an5:58.9.2_0: Honored in this way, the deities honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the deities.
ai-an5:58.9.4_0: When a gentleman is loved by the deities, you can expect only growth, not decline.
ai-an5:58.10.1_0: Furthermore, a gentleman uses his legitimate wealth to honor, respect, esteem, and venerate ascetics and brahmins.
ai-an5:58.10.2_0: Honored in this way, ascetics and brahmins love him with a good heart, wishing:
ai-an5:58.10.4_0: When a gentleman is loved by him, you can expect only growth, not decline.
ai-an5:58.11.1_0: Whoever has these five things found them:
ai-an5:58.11.2_0: whether he’s an anointed aristocratic king, an appointed or hereditary official, an army general, a village chief, a guild chief, or a ruler of his own clan.
ai-an5:58.12.1_0: He’s always dutiful to his mother and father,
ai-an5:58.12.2_0: and for the good of his wives and children.
ai-an5:58.12.3_0: He looks after those in his household,
ai-an5:58.13.2_0: looks after the welfare of relatives—
ai-an5:58.13.3_0: both those who have passed away,
ai-an5:58.14.1_0: While living at home, an astute person
ai-an5:58.14.2_0: uses legitimate means to give rise to joy
ai-an5:58.15.3_0: They praise him in this life,
ai-an5:58.15.4_0: they depart to rejoice in heaven.”
ai-an5:59.1.1_0: “Mendicants, it’s hard to find someone gone forth when old who has five qualities.
ai-an5:59.1.3_0: It’s hard to find someone gone forth when old who has gone forth when old. It’s hard to obtain a teaching and training.
ai-an5:59.1.4_0: It’s hard to find someone gone forth when old who has these five qualities.”
ai-an5:60.1.1_0: It’s hard to find someone gone forth when old who has five qualities.
ai-an5:60.1.3_0: It’s hard to find someone gone forth when old who has gone forth. It’s hard to admonish, having a teaching and training.
ai-an5:60.1.4_0: It’s hard to find someone gone forth when old who has these five qualities.”
ai-an5:60.1.6_0: The first sub-chapter on hindrances is finished.
ai-an5:60.2.2_0: at one time the mother’s mother,
ai-an5:60.2.4_0: Another two girl is hard to find.
ai-an5:61.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five perceptions, when developed and cultivated, are very fruitful and beneficial. They culminate in the deathless and end with the deathless.
ai-an5:61.1.3_0: The perceptions of ugliness, death, drawbacks, repulsiveness of food, and dissatisfaction with the whole world.
ai-an5:61.1.4_0: These five perceptions, when developed and cultivated, are very fruitful and beneficial. They culminate in the deathless and end with the deathless.”
ai-an5:62.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five perceptions, when developed and cultivated, are very fruitful and beneficial. They culminate in the deathless and end with the deathless.
ai-an5:62.1.3_0: The perceptions of impermanence, not-self, death, repulsiveness of food, and dissatisfaction with the whole world.
ai-an5:62.1.4_0: These five perceptions, when developed and cultivated, are very fruitful and beneficial. They culminate in the deathless and end with the deathless.”
ai-an5:63.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a male noble disciple who grows in five ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.
ai-an5:63.1.3_0: She grows in faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom.
ai-an5:63.1.4_0: A male noble disciple who grows in these five ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.
ai-an5:63.2.1_0: He who grows in faith and ethics,
ai-an5:63.2.2_0: wisdom, and both generosity and learning—
ai-an5:63.2.3_0: a good man such as he sees clearly,
ai-an5:63.2.4_0: and takes on what is essential for himself in this life.”
ai-an5:64.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a male noble disciple who grows in five ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.
ai-an5:64.1.3_0: She grows in faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom.
ai-an5:64.1.4_0: A female noble disciple who grows in these five ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.
ai-an5:64.2.1_0: She who grows in faith and ethics,
ai-an5:64.2.2_0: wisdom, and both generosity and learning—
ai-an5:64.2.3_0: a virtuous laywoman such as she
ai-an5:64.2.4_0: and takes on what is essential for himself in this life.”
ai-an5:65.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant with five qualities is fit to hold a discussion with their spiritual companions.
ai-an5:65.1.3_0: A mendicant is personally accomplished in ethics, and answers questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in ethics.
ai-an5:65.1.4_0: They’re personally accomplished in immersion, and they answer questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in immersion.
ai-an5:65.1.5_0: They’re personally accomplished in wisdom, and they answer questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in wisdom.
ai-an5:65.1.6_0: They’re personally accomplished in freedom, and they answer questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in freedom.
ai-an5:65.1.7_0: They’re personally accomplished in the knowledge and vision of freedom, and they answer questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in the knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an5:65.1.8_0: A mendicant with these five qualities is fit to hold a discussion with their spiritual companions.”
ai-an5:66.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant with five qualities is fit to share their life with their spiritual companions.
ai-an5:66.1.3_0: A mendicant is personally accomplished in ethics, and answers questions posed when discussing accomplishment in ethics.
ai-an5:66.1.4_0: They’re personally accomplished in immersion, and they answer questions posed when discussing accomplishment in immersion.
ai-an5:66.1.5_0: They’re personally accomplished in wisdom, and they answer questions posed when discussing accomplishment in wisdom.
ai-an5:66.1.6_0: They’re personally accomplished in freedom, and they answer questions posed when discussing accomplishment in freedom.
ai-an5:66.1.7_0: They’re personally accomplished in the knowledge and vision of freedom, and they answer questions posed when discussing accomplishment in the knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an5:66.1.8_0: A mendicant with these five qualities is fit to share their life with their spiritual companions.”
ai-an5:66.1.9_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an5:67.1.1_0: “Mendicants, any monk or nun who develops and cultivates five qualities can expect one of two results:
ai-an5:67.1.2_0: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.
ai-an5:67.2.2_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort.
ai-an5:67.2.3_0: He develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy ...
ai-an5:67.2.5_0: They develop the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to inquiry, and active effort.
ai-an5:67.2.6_0: And the fifth is sheer vigor.
ai-an5:67.2.7_0: Any monk or nun who develops and cultivates these five qualities can expect one of two results:
ai-an5:67.2.8_0: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
ai-an5:68.1.1_0: “Mendicants, before my awakening—when I was still not awake but intent on awakening—I developed and cultivated five things.
ai-an5:68.1.3_0: The basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort ...
ai-an5:68.1.4_0: the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy, and active effort ...
ai-an5:68.1.6_0: the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to inquiry, and active effort.
ai-an5:68.1.7_0: And the fifth is sheer vigor.
ai-an5:68.1.8_0: Then I developed and cultivated these five things that should be developed by developing and cultivating the mind to realize the same teaching.
ai-an5:68.1.9_0: I became capable of realizing anything that can be realized by insight to which I extended the mind, in each and every case.
ai-an5:68.2.1_1: ‘May I wield the many kinds of psychic power’ ...
ai-an5:68.2.1_2: and may I control the body as far as the Brahmā realm.’
ai-an5:68.2.2_0: I became capable of realizing anything that can be realized by insight to which I extended the mind, in each and every case.
ai-an5:68.3.1_1: ‘May I realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with my own insight due to the ending of defilements.’
ai-an5:68.3.2_0: I was capable of realizing it, in each and every case.”
ai-an5:69.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five things, when developed and cultivated, lead solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
ai-an5:69.2.2_0: A mendicant meditates observing the ugliness of the body, perceives the repulsiveness of food, perceives dissatisfaction with the whole world, observes the impermanence of all conditions, and has well established the perception of their own death.
ai-an5:69.2.3_0: These five things, when developed and cultivated, lead solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.”
ai-an5:70.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five things, when developed and cultivated, lead to the ending of defilements.
ai-an5:70.1.3_0: A mendicant meditates observing the ugliness of the body, perceives the repulsiveness of food, perceives dissatisfaction with the whole world, observes the impermanence of all conditions, and has well established the perception of their own death.
ai-an5:70.1.4_0: These five things, when developed and cultivated, lead to the ending of defilements.”
ai-an5:70.1.6_0: The second sub-chapter on perception is finished.
ai-an5:70.2.3_0: And two bases of psychic power have spoken,
ai-an5:71.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five things, when developed and cultivated, have freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom as their fruit and benefit.
ai-an5:71.2.2_0: A mendicant meditates observing the ugliness of the body, perceives the repulsiveness of food, perceives dissatisfaction with the whole world, observes the impermanence of all conditions, and has well established the perception of their own death.
ai-an5:71.2.3_0: These five things, when developed and cultivated, have freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom as their fruit and benefit.
ai-an5:71.2.4_0: When a mendicant has freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom,
ai-an5:71.2.5_0: they’re called a mendicant who has lifted up the cross-bar, filled in the trench, and pulled up the pillar; they’re unbarred, a noble one with banner and burden put down, detached.
ai-an5:71.3.1_0: And how has a mendicant lifted the cross-bar?
ai-an5:71.3.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up ignorance and given rise to knowledge, cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it, so it’s unable to arise in the future.
ai-an5:71.3.3_0: That’s how a mendicant has lifted the cross-bar.
ai-an5:71.4.1_0: And how has a mendicant filled in the trench?
ai-an5:71.4.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up transmigrating through births in future lives, cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it, so it’s unable to arise in the future.
ai-an5:71.4.3_0: That’s how a mendicant has filled in the trench.
ai-an5:71.5.1_0: And how has a mendicant pulled up the pillar?
ai-an5:71.5.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up craving so it is cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it, so it’s unable to arise in the future.
ai-an5:71.5.3_0: That’s how a mendicant has pulled up the pillar.
ai-an5:71.6.1_0: And how is a mendicant unbarred?
ai-an5:71.6.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up the five lower fetters, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, obliterated them, so they’re unable to arise in the future.
ai-an5:71.6.3_0: That’s how a mendicant is unbarred.
ai-an5:71.7.1_0: And how is a mendicant a noble one with banner and burden put down, detached?
ai-an5:71.7.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up the conceit ‘I am’, cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it, so it’s unable to arise in the future.
ai-an5:71.7.3_0: That’s how a mendicant is a noble one with banner and burden put down, detached.”
ai-an5:72.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five things, when developed and cultivated, have freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom as their fruit and benefit.
ai-an5:72.1.3_0: The perception of impermanence, the perception of suffering in impermanence, the perception of not-self in suffering, the perception of giving up, and the perception of fading away.
ai-an5:72.1.4_0: These five things, when developed and cultivated, have freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom as their fruit and benefit.
ai-an5:72.1.5_0: When a mendicant has freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom,
ai-an5:72.1.6_0: they’re called a mendicant who has lifted up the cross-bar, filled in the trench, and pulled up the pillar; they’re unbarred, a noble one with banner and burden put down, detached. ...”
ai-an5:72.2.1_0: “And how has a mendicant lifted the cross-bar?
ai-an5:72.2.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up ignorance and given rise to knowledge, cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it, so it’s unable to arise in the future.
ai-an5:72.2.3_0: That’s how a mendicant has lifted the cross-bar.
ai-an5:72.3.1_0: And how has a mendicant filled in the trench?
ai-an5:72.3.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up transmigrating through births in future lives, cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it, so it’s unable to arise in the future.
ai-an5:72.3.3_0: That’s how a mendicant has filled in the trench.
ai-an5:72.4.1_0: And how has a mendicant pulled up the pillar?
ai-an5:72.4.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up craving so it is cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it, so it’s unable to arise in the future.
ai-an5:72.4.3_0: That’s how a mendicant has pulled up the pillar.
ai-an5:72.5.1_0: And how is a mendicant unbarred?
ai-an5:72.5.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up the five lower fetters, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, obliterated them, so they’re unable to arise in the future.
ai-an5:72.5.3_0: That’s how a mendicant is unbarred.
ai-an5:72.6.1_0: And how is a mendicant a noble one with banner and burden put down, detached?
ai-an5:72.6.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up the conceit ‘I am’, cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it, so it’s unable to arise in the future.
ai-an5:72.6.3_0: That’s how a mendicant is a noble one with banner and burden put down, detached.”
ai-an5:73.1.1_0: Then a certain monk went to the Fortunate One,
ai-an5:73.1.2_0: “Sir, they speak of ‘one who lives by the teaching’.
ai-an5:73.1.3_0: How is one who lives by the teaching defined?”
ai-an5:73.2.1_0: “Mendicant, take a mendicant who memorizes the teaching—
ai-an5:73.2.2_0: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.
ai-an5:73.2.3_0: They spend their days reciting that teaching. They neglect retreat, and are not committed to internal serenity of heart.
ai-an5:73.2.4_0: That mendicant is called one who studies a lot, not one who lives by the teaching.
ai-an5:73.3.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant teaches others the Dhamma in detail to others as they learned and memorized it.
ai-an5:73.3.2_0: They spend their days reciting that teaching. But they neglect retreat, and are not committed to internal serenity of heart.
ai-an5:73.3.3_0: That mendicant is called one who advocates a lot, not one who lives by the teaching.
ai-an5:73.4.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant recites the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.
ai-an5:73.4.2_0: They spend their days reciting that teaching. But they neglect retreat, and are not committed to internal serenity of heart.
ai-an5:73.4.3_0: That mendicant is called one who recites a lot, not one who lives by the teaching.
ai-an5:73.5.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant thinks about and considers the teaching in their heart, examining it with the mind as they learned and memorized it.
ai-an5:73.5.2_0: They spend their days thinking about that teaching. But they neglect retreat, and are not committed to internal serenity of heart.
ai-an5:73.5.3_0: That mendicant is called one who thinks a lot, not one who lives by the teaching.
ai-an5:73.6.1_0: Take a mendicant who memorizes the teaching—
ai-an5:73.6.2_0: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.
ai-an5:73.6.3_0: They don’t spend their days studying that teaching. They don’t neglect retreat, and they’re committed to internal serenity of heart.
ai-an5:73.6.4_0: That’s how a mendicant is one who lives by the teaching.
ai-an5:73.7.1_0: So, mendicant, I’ve taught you the one who studies a lot, the one who advocates a lot, the one who recites a lot, the one who thinks a lot, and the one who lives by the teaching.
ai-an5:73.7.2_0: Out of compassion, I’ve done what a teacher should do who wants what’s best for their disciples.
ai-an5:73.7.3_0: Here are these roots of trees, and here are these empty huts.
ai-an5:73.7.3_1: Practice absorption, mendicant! Don’t be negligent!
ai-an5:73.7.3_2: This is my instruction to you.”
ai-an5:74.1.1_0: Then a certain monk went to the Fortunate One,
ai-an5:74.1.2_0: “Sir, they speak of ‘one who lives by the teaching’.
ai-an5:74.1.3_0: How is one who lives by the teaching defined?”
ai-an5:74.2.1_0: “Mendicant, take a mendicant who memorizes the teaching—
ai-an5:74.2.2_0: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.
ai-an5:74.2.3_0: But they don’t understand the higher meaning.
ai-an5:74.2.4_0: That mendicant is called one who studies a lot, not one who lives by the teaching.
ai-an5:74.3.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant teaches Dhamma in detail to others as they learned and memorized it. But they don’t understand the higher meaning.
ai-an5:74.3.2_0: That mendicant is called one who advocates a lot, not one who lives by the teaching.
ai-an5:74.4.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant recites the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it. But they don’t understand the higher meaning.
ai-an5:74.4.2_0: That mendicant is called one who recites a lot, not one who lives by the teaching.
ai-an5:74.5.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant thinks about and considers the teaching in their heart, examining it with the mind as they learned and memorized it. But they don’t understand the higher meaning.
ai-an5:74.5.2_0: That mendicant is called one who thinks a lot, not one who lives by the teaching.
ai-an5:74.6.1_0: Take a mendicant who memorizes the teaching—
ai-an5:74.6.2_0: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.
ai-an5:74.6.3_0: And they do understand the higher meaning.
ai-an5:74.6.4_0: That’s how a mendicant is one who lives by the teaching.
ai-an5:74.7.1_0: So, mendicant, I’ve taught you the one who studies a lot, the one who advocates a lot, the one who recites a lot, the one who thinks a lot, and the one who lives by the teaching.
ai-an5:74.7.2_0: Out of compassion, I’ve done what a teacher should do who wants what’s best for their disciples.
ai-an5:74.7.3_0: Here are these roots of trees, and here are these empty huts.
ai-an5:74.7.3_1: Practice absorption, mendicant! Don’t be negligent!
ai-an5:74.7.3_2: This is my instruction to you.”
ai-an5:75.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five warriors are found in the world.
ai-an5:75.1.3_0: Firstly, one warrior falters and founders at the mere sight of a cloud of dust. He doesn’t stay firm, and fails to plunge into battle.
ai-an5:75.1.5_0: This is the first warrior found in the world.
ai-an5:75.2.1_0: Furthermore, one warrior can prevail over a cloud of dust,
ai-an5:75.2.2_0: but he falters and founders at the mere sight of a banner’s crest.
ai-an5:75.2.4_0: This is the second warrior found in the world.
ai-an5:75.3.1_0: Furthermore, one warrior can prevail over a cloud of dust and a banner’s crest,
ai-an5:75.3.2_0: but he falters and founders at the mere sound of turmoil. He doesn’t stay firm, and fails to plunge into battle.
ai-an5:75.3.4_0: This is the third warrior found in the world.
ai-an5:75.4.1_0: Furthermore, one warrior can prevail over a cloud of dust and a banner’s crest and turmoil,
ai-an5:75.4.2_0: but he’s killed or injured when blows are struck.
ai-an5:75.4.4_0: This is the fourth warrior found in the world.
ai-an5:75.5.1_0: Furthermore, one warrior can prevail over a cloud of dust and a banner’s crest and turmoil and being struck.
ai-an5:75.5.2_0: He wins victory in battle, establishing himself as foremost in battle.
ai-an5:75.5.4_0: This is the fifth warrior found in the world.
ai-an5:75.5.5_0: These are the five warriors found in the world.
ai-an5:75.6.1_0: In the same way, these five people similar to warriors are found among the monks.
ai-an5:75.6.3_0: Firstly, one monk falters and founders at the mere sight of a cloud of dust. He doesn’t stay firm, and fails to keep up the spiritual life.
ai-an5:75.6.4_0: Declaring his inability to continue training, he rejects it and returns to a lesser life.
ai-an5:75.6.7_0: ‘In such and such a village or town there’s a women or a girl who is attractive, good-looking, lovely, of surpassing beauty.’
ai-an5:75.6.8_0: Hearing this, he falters and founders. He doesn’t stay firm, and fails to keep up the spiritual life.
ai-an5:75.6.9_0: Declaring his inability to continue training, he rejects it and returns to a lesser life.
ai-an5:75.7.1_0: I say that this person is like the warrior who falters and founders at the mere sight of a cloud of dust.
ai-an5:75.7.2_0: They’re like the person who mistakes branches and leaves for heartwood, I say.
ai-an5:75.7.4_0: This is the first person similar to a warrior found among the monks.
ai-an5:75.8.1_0: Furthermore, one monk can prevail over a cloud of dust,
ai-an5:75.8.2_0: but at the mere sight of a banner’s crest he falters and founders. He doesn’t stay firm, and fails to keep up the spiritual life.
ai-an5:75.8.3_0: Declaring his inability to continue training, he rejects it and returns to a lesser life.
ai-an5:75.8.5_0: It’s when a monk doesn’t hear:
ai-an5:75.8.6_0: ‘In such and such a village or town there’s a women or a girl who is attractive, good-looking, lovely, of surpassing beauty.’
ai-an5:75.8.7_0: However, they see a woman or man in complexion with a beautiful and ugly woman.
ai-an5:75.8.8_0: Seeing her, he falters and founders. He doesn’t stay firm, and fails to keep up the spiritual life.
ai-an5:75.8.9_0: Declaring his inability to continue training, he rejects it and returns to a lesser life.
ai-an5:75.9.1_0: I say that this person is like the warrior who can prevail over a cloud of dust and a banner’s crest,
ai-an5:75.9.2_0: but he falters and founders at the mere sight of a banner’s crest.
ai-an5:75.9.3_0: They’re like the person who mistakes branches and leaves for heartwood, I say.
ai-an5:75.9.5_0: This is the second person similar to a warrior found among the monks.
ai-an5:75.10.1_0: Furthermore, one monk can prevail over a cloud of dust and a banner’s crest,
ai-an5:75.10.2_0: but he falters and founders at the mere sound of turmoil. He doesn’t stay firm, and fails to keep up the spiritual life.
ai-an5:75.10.3_0: Declaring his inability to continue training, he rejects it and returns to a lesser life.
ai-an5:75.10.5_0: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, when a female comes up to him.
ai-an5:75.10.6_0: He falters and founders. He doesn’t stay firm, and fails to keep up the spiritual life.
ai-an5:75.10.7_0: Declaring his inability to continue training, he rejects it and returns to a lesser life.
ai-an5:75.11.1_0: I say that this person is like the warrior who can prevail over a cloud of dust and a banner’s crest,
ai-an5:75.11.2_0: but he falters and founders at the mere sound of turmoil. He doesn’t stay firm, and fails to plunge into battle.
ai-an5:75.11.3_0: They’re like the person who mistakes branches and leaves for heartwood, I say.
ai-an5:75.11.5_0: This is the third person similar to a warrior found among the monks.
ai-an5:75.12.1_0: Furthermore, one monk can prevail over a cloud of dust and a banner’s crest and turmoil,
ai-an5:75.12.2_0: but he’s killed or injured when blows are struck.
ai-an5:75.12.4_0: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, when a female comes up to him. She sits right by him, lies down, or embraces him.
ai-an5:75.12.5_0: But he discards his head without first renouncing the training and revealing his weakness.
ai-an5:75.13.1_0: I say that this person is like the warrior who can prevail over a cloud of dust and a banner’s crest and turmoil, but is killed or injured when blows are struck.
ai-an5:75.13.2_0: They’re like the person who mistakes branches and leaves for heartwood, I say.
ai-an5:75.13.4_0: This is the fourth person similar to a warrior found among the monks.
ai-an5:75.14.1_0: Furthermore, one monk can prevail over a cloud of dust and a banner’s crest and turmoil, and being struck. He wins victory in battle, establishing himself as foremost in battle.
ai-an5:75.14.3_0: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, when a female comes up to him. She sits right by him, lies down, or embraces him.
ai-an5:75.14.4_0: But he disentangles and frees himself, and goes wherever he wants.
ai-an5:75.14.5_0: So they frequent a secluded lodging.
ai-an5:75.15.1_0: Gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, he sits down cross-legged, with his body straight, and establishes mindfulness right there.
ai-an5:75.15.2_0: Giving up desire for the world, he meditates with a heart rid of desire, cleansing the mind of desire.
ai-an5:75.15.3_0: Giving up ill will, they meditate with a mind rid of ill will, full of compassion for all living beings, cleansing the mind of ill will and malevolence.
ai-an5:75.15.4_0: Giving up dullness and drowsiness, they meditate with a mind rid of dullness and drowsiness, perceiving light, mindful and aware, cleansing the mind of dullness and drowsiness.
ai-an5:75.15.5_0: Giving up restlessness and remorse, they meditate without restlessness, their mind peaceful inside, cleansing the mind of restlessness and remorse.
ai-an5:75.15.6_0: Giving up doubt, he meditates having gone beyond doubt, not undecided about skillful qualities, cleansing the mind of doubt.
ai-an5:75.15.7_0: They give up these five hindrances, corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom.
ai-an5:75.15.8_0: Then, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, he enters and remains in the first absorption ...
ai-an5:75.15.9_0: dwells having attained the fourth absorption.
ai-an5:75.16.1_0: When their mind has become immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—they extend it toward knowledge of the ending of defilements.
ai-an5:75.16.2_0: But they truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ ...
ai-an5:75.16.3_0: He truly understands: ‘These are defilements’ ... ‘This is the origin of defilements’ ... ‘This is the cessation of defilements’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of defilements’.
ai-an5:75.16.4_0: Knowing and seeing like this, their mind is freed from the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.
ai-an5:75.16.5_0: When it is freed, he knows it is freed.
ai-an5:75.16.6_0: He understands: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’
ai-an5:75.17.1_0: I say that this person is like the warrior who can prevail over a cloud of dust and a banner’s crest and turmoil and being struck. He wins victory in battle, establishing himself as foremost in battle.
ai-an5:75.17.2_0: They’re like the person who mistakes branches and leaves for heartwood, I say.
ai-an5:75.17.4_0: This is the fifth person similar to a warrior found among the monks.
ai-an5:75.17.5_0: These five people similar to warriors are found among the monks.”
ai-an5:76.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five warriors are found in the world.
ai-an5:76.1.3_0: Firstly, one warrior dons his sword and shield, fastens his bow and arrows, and plunges into the thick of battle.
ai-an5:76.1.5_0: but his foes kill him and finish him off.
ai-an5:76.1.7_0: This is the first warrior found in the world.
ai-an5:76.2.1_0: Furthermore, one warrior dons his sword and shield, fastens his bow and arrows, and plunges into the thick of battle.
ai-an5:76.2.3_0: but his foes kill him and finish him off.
ai-an5:76.2.4_0: Without having lost their relatives, they will take them away.
ai-an5:76.2.5_0: While he was pursuing the road, he dies while on his way.
ai-an5:76.2.7_0: This is the second warrior found in the world.
ai-an5:76.3.1_0: Furthermore, one warrior dons his sword and shield, fastens his bow and arrows, and plunges into the thick of battle.
ai-an5:76.3.3_0: but his foes kill him and finish him off.
ai-an5:76.3.4_0: Without having lost their relatives, they will take them away.
ai-an5:76.3.5_0: who nurse him and care for him.
ai-an5:76.3.6_0: And while in their care, he dies.
ai-an5:76.3.8_0: This is the third warrior found in the world.
ai-an5:76.4.1_0: Furthermore, one warrior dons his sword and shield, fastens his bow and arrows, and plunges into the thick of battle.
ai-an5:76.4.3_0: but his foes kill him and finish him off.
ai-an5:76.4.4_0: Without having lost their relatives, they will take them away.
ai-an5:76.4.5_0: who nurse him and care for him.
ai-an5:76.4.6_0: And while in their care, he recovers from his injuries.
ai-an5:76.4.8_0: This is the fourth warrior found in the world.
ai-an5:76.5.1_0: Furthermore, one warrior dons his sword and shield, fastens his bow and arrows, and plunges into the thick of battle.
ai-an5:76.5.2_0: He wins victory in battle, establishing himself as foremost in battle.
ai-an5:76.5.4_0: This is the fifth warrior found in the world.
ai-an5:76.5.5_0: These are the five warriors found in the world.
ai-an5:76.6.1_0: In the same way, these five people similar to warriors are found among the monks.
ai-an5:76.6.3_0: Firstly, a mendicant lives supported by a town or village.
ai-an5:76.6.4_0: He robes up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, enters a village or town for alms without guarding body, speech, and mind, without establishing mindfulness, and without restraining the sense faculties.
ai-an5:76.6.5_0: There he sees a female scantily clad, with revealing clothes.
ai-an5:76.6.7_0: and, without resigning the training and declaring his inability to continue, he has sex.
ai-an5:76.7.1_0: I say that this person is like the warrior who is killed and finished off by his foes.
ai-an5:76.7.1_1: They’re like the person who mistakes branches and leaves for heartwood, I say.
ai-an5:76.7.2_0: This is the first person similar to a warrior found among the monks.
ai-an5:76.8.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant lives supported by a town or village.
ai-an5:76.8.2_0: He robes up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, enters a village or town for alms without guarding body, speech, and mind, without establishing mindfulness, and without restraining the sense faculties.
ai-an5:76.8.3_0: There he sees a female scantily clad, with revealing clothes.
ai-an5:76.8.5_0: and his body and mind burn with it.
ai-an5:76.8.7_0: ‘Why don’t I go to the monastery and tell the monks
ai-an5:76.8.8_0: “Reverends, I am overcome with lust, mired in lust. I am unable to keep up the spiritual life.
ai-an5:76.8.9_0: I declare my inability to continue training. I reject it and will return to a lesser life.”’
ai-an5:76.8.10_0: But while traveling on the road, before he reaches the monastery he declares his inability to continue training. He rejects it and returns to a lesser life.
ai-an5:76.9.1_0: I say that this person is like the warrior who is taken to his relatives for care, but he dies on the road before he reaches them.
ai-an5:76.9.1_1: Without having lost their relatives, they will take them away.
ai-an5:76.9.1_2: While he was pursuing the road, he dies while on his way.
ai-an5:76.9.1_3: They’re like the person who mistakes branches and leaves for heartwood, I say.
ai-an5:76.9.2_0: This is the second person similar to a warrior found among the monks.
ai-an5:76.10.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant lives supported by a town or village.
ai-an5:76.10.2_0: He robes up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, enters a village or town for alms without guarding body, speech, and mind, without establishing mindfulness, and without restraining the sense faculties.
ai-an5:76.10.3_0: There he sees a female scantily clad, with revealing clothes.
ai-an5:76.10.5_0: and his body and mind burn with it.
ai-an5:76.10.7_0: ‘Why don’t I go to the monastery and tell the monks
ai-an5:76.10.8_0: “Reverends, I am overcome with lust, mired in lust. I am unable to keep up the spiritual life.
ai-an5:76.10.9_0: I declare my inability to continue training. I reject it and will return to a lesser life.”’
ai-an5:76.10.10_0: When he has gone to the monastery he informs the monks,
ai-an5:76.10.11_0: “Reverends, I am overcome with lust, mired in lust. I am unable to keep up the spiritual life.
ai-an5:76.10.12_0: I declare my inability to continue training. I reject it and will return to a lesser life.”’
ai-an5:76.11.1_0: His spiritual companions advise and instruct him:
ai-an5:76.11.2_0: ‘Reverends, the Buddha has said that sensual pleasures give little gratification and much suffering and distress, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.
ai-an5:76.11.3_0: With the similes of a skeleton ...
ai-an5:76.11.10_0: a butcher’s knife and chopping block ...
ai-an5:76.11.12_0: similar to a snake’s head; they are much suffering and much trouble, and the danger in them is greater.
ai-an5:76.11.13_0: Be happy with the spiritual life.
ai-an5:76.11.14_0: you should resign the training and return to a lesser life.’
ai-an5:76.12.1_0: after being advised by their spiritual companions, they say this:
ai-an5:76.12.2_0: ‘Reverends, even though the Buddha says that sensual pleasures give little gratification and much suffering and distress, and they are all the more full of drawbacks,
ai-an5:76.12.3_0: I am unable to keep up the spiritual life. I declare my inability to continue training. I reject it and will return to a lesser life.’
ai-an5:76.12.4_0: Declaring his inability to continue training, he rejects it and returns to a lesser life.
ai-an5:76.13.1_0: I say that this person is like the warrior who is taken to his relatives for care, but he dies on the road before he reaches them.
ai-an5:76.13.1_1: And they look after him and attend him with care.
ai-an5:76.13.1_2: And while in their care, he dies.
ai-an5:76.13.1_3: They’re like the person who mistakes branches and leaves for heartwood, I say.
ai-an5:76.13.2_0: This is the third person similar to a warrior found among the monks.
ai-an5:76.14.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant lives supported by a town or village.
ai-an5:76.14.2_0: He robes up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, enters a village or town for alms without guarding body, speech, and mind, without establishing mindfulness, and without restraining the sense faculties.
ai-an5:76.14.3_0: There he sees a female scantily clad, with revealing clothes.
ai-an5:76.14.5_0: and his body and mind burn with it.
ai-an5:76.14.7_0: ‘Why don’t I go to the monastery and tell the monks
ai-an5:76.14.8_0: “Reverends, I am overcome with lust, mired in lust. I am unable to keep up the spiritual life.
ai-an5:76.14.9_0: I declare my inability to continue training. I reject it and will return to a lesser life.”’
ai-an5:76.14.10_0: When he has gone to the monastery he informs the monks,
ai-an5:76.14.11_0: “Reverends, I am overcome with lust, mired in lust. I am unable to keep up the spiritual life.
ai-an5:76.14.12_0: I declare my inability to continue training. I reject it and will return to a lesser life.”’
ai-an5:76.15.1_0: His spiritual companions advise and instruct him:
ai-an5:76.15.2_0: ‘Reverends, the Buddha has said that sensual pleasures give little gratification and much suffering and distress, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.
ai-an5:76.15.3_0: With the similes of a skeleton ...
ai-an5:76.15.4_0: similar to a piece of meat,
ai-an5:76.15.4_2: similar to a pit of coals ...
ai-an5:76.15.4_6: similar to a knife and chopping block,
ai-an5:76.15.4_8: similar to a snake’s head; they are much suffering and much trouble, and the danger in them is greater.
ai-an5:76.15.5_0: Be happy with the spiritual life.
ai-an5:76.15.6_0: you should resign the training and return to a lesser life.’
ai-an5:76.16.1_0: after being advised by their spiritual companions, they say this:
ai-an5:76.16.2_0: ‘I’ll try, reverends, I’ll struggle, I’ll be happy.
ai-an5:76.16.3_0: I won’t now declare my inability to continue training, reject it and return to a lesser life.’
ai-an5:76.17.1_0: I say that this person is like the warrior who is taken to his relatives for care, but he dies on the road before he reaches them.
ai-an5:76.17.1_1: And they look after him and attend him with care.
ai-an5:76.17.1_2: And while in their care, he recovers from his injuries.
ai-an5:76.17.1_3: They’re like the person who mistakes branches and leaves for heartwood, I say.
ai-an5:76.17.3_0: This is the fourth person similar to a warrior found among the monks.
ai-an5:76.18.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant lives supported by a town or village.
ai-an5:76.18.2_0: He robes up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, enters a village or town, guarding body, speech, and mind, establishing mindfulness, and restraining the sense faculties.
ai-an5:76.18.3_0: Seeing a sight with the eyes, they don’t get caught up in the features and details.
ai-an5:76.18.4_0: If the faculty of sight were left unrestrained, bad unskillful qualities of desire and aversion would become overwhelming.
ai-an5:76.18.4_2: They don’t practice restraint of the eye faculty.
ai-an5:76.18.5_0: When you hear a sound with your ears ...
ai-an5:76.18.6_0: When they smell an odor with their nose ...
ai-an5:76.18.7_0: Tasting a flavor with the tongue ...
ai-an5:76.18.8_0: Feeling a touch with the body ...
ai-an5:76.18.9_0: Knowing a thought with their mind, they don’t get caught up in the features and details.
ai-an5:76.18.10_0: If the faculty of mind were left unrestrained, bad unskillful qualities of desire and aversion would become overwhelming.
ai-an5:76.18.10_2: They practice restraint in the mind,
ai-an5:76.18.11_0: Then after the meal, on his return from alms-round,
ai-an5:76.18.12_0: they frequent a secluded lodging—a wilderness, the root of a tree, a hill, a ravine, a mountain cave, a charnel ground, a forest, the open air, a heap of straw.
ai-an5:76.18.13_0: Gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, he sits down cross-legged, with his body straight, and establishes mindfulness right there.
ai-an5:76.18.14_0: I gave up these five hindrances, corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom.
ai-an5:76.18.15_0: Then, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, they enter and remain in the first absorption ... second absorption ... third absorption ... fourth absorption.
ai-an5:76.19.1_0: When their mind has become immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—they extend it toward knowledge of the ending of defilements.
ai-an5:76.19.2_0: They truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ ... ‘This is the origin of suffering’ ... ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
ai-an5:76.19.3_0: They understand: ‘... there is no return to any state of existence.’
ai-an5:76.20.1_0: I say that this person is like the warrior who dons his sword and shield, fastens his bow and arrows, and plunges into the thick of battle. He wins victory in battle, establishing himself as foremost in battle.
ai-an5:76.20.1_1: They’re like the person who mistakes branches and leaves for heartwood, I say.
ai-an5:76.20.3_0: This is the fifth person similar to a warrior found among the monks.
ai-an5:76.20.4_0: These five people similar to warriors are found among the monks.”
ai-an5:76.20.5_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an5:77.1.1_0: “Mendicants, seeing these five future perils is quite enough for a wilderness mendicant to meditate diligently, keenly, and resolutely for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.
ai-an5:77.2.3_0: ‘Currently I’m living alone in a wilderness.
ai-an5:77.2.5_0: A snake might bite me, or a scorpion or centipede might sting me.
ai-an5:77.2.6_0: And if I died from that it would stop my practice.
ai-an5:77.2.7_0: I’d better rouse up energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.’
ai-an5:77.2.8_0: This is the first future peril ...
ai-an5:77.3.2_0: ‘Currently I’m living alone in a wilderness.
ai-an5:77.3.4_0: Or I might stumble off a cliff, or get food poisoning, or suffer a disturbance of bile, phlegm, or piercing winds.
ai-an5:77.3.5_0: And if I died from that it would stop my practice.
ai-an5:77.3.6_0: I’d better rouse up energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.’
ai-an5:77.3.7_0: This is the second future peril ...
ai-an5:77.4.2_0: ‘Currently I’m living alone in a wilderness.
ai-an5:77.4.4_0: I might encounter wild beasts—a lion, a tiger, a leopard, a bear, or a hyena—which might take my life.
ai-an5:77.4.5_0: And if I died from that it would stop my practice.
ai-an5:77.4.6_0: I’d better rouse up energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.’
ai-an5:77.4.7_0: This is the third future peril ...
ai-an5:77.5.2_0: ‘Currently I’m living alone in a wilderness.
ai-an5:77.5.4_0: I might encounter youths escaping a crime or on their way to commit one, and they might take my life.
ai-an5:77.5.5_0: And if I died from that it would stop my practice.
ai-an5:77.5.6_0: I’d better rouse up energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.’
ai-an5:77.5.7_0: This is the fourth future peril ...
ai-an5:77.6.2_0: ‘Currently I’m living alone in a wilderness.
ai-an5:77.6.3_0: But in a wilderness there are savage monsters who might take my life.
ai-an5:77.6.4_0: And if I died from that it would stop my practice.
ai-an5:77.6.5_0: I’d better rouse up energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.’
ai-an5:77.6.6_0: This is the fifth future peril ...
ai-an5:77.7.1_0: These are the five future perils, seeing which is quite enough for a wilderness mendicant to meditate diligently, keenly, and resolutely for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.”
ai-an5:78.1.1_0: “Mendicants, seeing these five future perils is quite enough for a mendicant to meditate diligently, keenly, and resolutely for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.
ai-an5:78.1.4_0: ‘Currently I’m a youth, young, black-haired, blessed with youth, in the prime of life.
ai-an5:78.1.5_0: But there will come a time when this body is struck with old age.
ai-an5:78.1.6_0: When you’re old, overcome by old age, it’s not easy to focus on the instructions of the Buddhas, and it’s not easy to frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest.
ai-an5:78.1.7_0: That Dhamma I was coming without disagreeable, undesirable,
ai-an5:78.1.8_0: I’d better preempt it by rousing up energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized. That way, when it happens, I’ll live comfortably even though I’m old.’
ai-an5:78.1.9_0: This is the first future peril ...
ai-an5:78.2.2_0: ‘Currently, I’m rarely ill or unwell. My stomach digests well, being neither too hot nor too cold, but just right, and fit for meditation.
ai-an5:78.2.3_0: But there will come a time when this body is struck with sickness.
ai-an5:78.2.4_0: When you have sickness, it’s not easy to focus on the instructions of the Buddhas, and it’s not easy to frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest.
ai-an5:78.2.5_0: That Dhamma I was coming without disagreeable, undesirable,
ai-an5:78.2.6_0: I’d better preempt it by rousing up energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized. That way, when it happens, I’ll live comfortably even though I’m sick.’
ai-an5:78.2.7_0: This is the second future peril ...
ai-an5:78.3.2_0: ‘Currently, there’s plenty of food, a good harvest, so it’s easy to get alms-food, and easy to keep going by collecting alms.
ai-an5:78.3.3_0: But there will come a time of famine, a bad harvest, when it’s hard to get alms-food, and not easy to keep going by collecting alms.
ai-an5:78.3.4_0: In a time of famine, people move to where there’s plenty of food,
ai-an5:78.3.5_0: where they live crowded and cramped together.
ai-an5:78.3.6_0: When you live crowded and cramped together, it’s not easy to focus on the instructions of the Buddhas, and it’s not easy to frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest.
ai-an5:78.3.7_0: That Dhamma I was coming without disagreeable, undesirable,
ai-an5:78.3.8_0: I’d better preempt it by rousing up energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized. That way, when it happens, I’ll live comfortably even though there’s a famine.’
ai-an5:78.3.9_0: This is the third future peril ...
ai-an5:78.4.2_0: ‘Currently, people live in harmony, appreciating each other, without quarreling, blending like milk and water, and regarding each other with kindly eyes.
ai-an5:78.4.3_0: But there will come a time of peril from wild savages, when the countryfolk mount their vehicles and flee everywhere.
ai-an5:78.4.4_0: In a time of peril, people move to where there’s sanctuary,
ai-an5:78.4.5_0: where they live crowded and cramped together.
ai-an5:78.4.6_0: When you live crowded and cramped together, it’s not easy to focus on the instructions of the Buddhas, and it’s not easy to frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest.
ai-an5:78.4.7_0: That Dhamma I was coming without disagreeable, undesirable,
ai-an5:78.4.8_0: I’d better preempt it by rousing up energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized. That way, when it happens, I’ll live comfortably even in a time of peril.’
ai-an5:78.4.9_0: This is the fourth future peril ...
ai-an5:78.5.2_0: ‘Currently, the Saṅgha lives comfortably, in harmony, appreciating each other, without quarreling, with one recitation.
ai-an5:78.5.3_0: But there will come a time of schism in the Saṅgha.
ai-an5:78.5.4_0: When there is schism in the Saṅgha, it’s not easy to focus on the instructions of the Buddhas, and it’s not easy to frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest.
ai-an5:78.5.5_0: That Dhamma I was coming without disagreeable, undesirable,
ai-an5:78.5.6_0: I’d better preempt it by rousing up energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized. That way, when it happens, I’ll live comfortably even though there’s schism in the Saṅgha.’
ai-an5:78.5.7_0: This is the fifth future peril ...
ai-an5:78.6.1_0: These are the five future perils, seeing which is quite enough for a mendicant to meditate diligently, keenly, and resolutely for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.”
ai-an5:79.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five future perils have not currently arisen, but they will arise in the future.
ai-an5:79.1.2_0: You should look out for them
ai-an5:79.1.3_0: and try to give them up.
ai-an5:79.2.2_0: In a future time there will be mendicants who have not developed their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.
ai-an5:79.2.4_0: but be unable to guide them in the higher ethics, mind, and wisdom.
ai-an5:79.2.5_0: They too will not develop their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.
ai-an5:79.2.7_0: but be unable to guide them in the higher ethics, mind, and wisdom.
ai-an5:79.2.8_0: They too will not develop their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.
ai-an5:79.2.9_0: And that is how corrupt training comes from corrupt teachings,
ai-an5:79.2.10_0: and corrupt teachings come from corrupt training.
ai-an5:79.2.11_0: This is the first future peril that has not currently arisen, but will arise in the future ...
ai-an5:79.2.12_0: You should look out for them
ai-an5:79.2.13_0: and try to give them up.
ai-an5:79.3.1_0: Furthermore, in a future time there will be mendicants who have not developed their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.
ai-an5:79.3.2_0: They too will give dependence to others,
ai-an5:79.3.3_0: but be unable to guide them in the higher ethics, mind, and wisdom.
ai-an5:79.3.4_0: They too will not develop their physical endurance, ethics, mind, and wisdom.
