ai-an5:139.3.1_0: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can’t endure sounds?
ai-an5:139.3.2_0: It’s when a royal bull elephant does not falter or founder at the sound of a division of elephants, of cavalry, of chariots, or of infantry, or the thunder of the drums, kettledrums, horns, and cymbals. It stays firm, and plunges into battle.
ai-an5:139.3.3_0: That’s how a royal bull elephant can’t endure sounds.
ai-an5:139.4.1_0: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can’t endure smells?
ai-an5:139.4.2_0: It’s when a royal bull elephant gone to battle falters and founders when it smells the odor of the feces and urine of battle-hardened, pedigree royal bull elephants. It doesn’t stay firm, and fails to plunge into battle.
ai-an5:139.4.3_0: That’s how a royal bull elephant can’t endure smells.
ai-an5:139.5.1_0: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can’t endure tastes?
ai-an5:139.5.2_0: It’s when a royal bull elephant gone to battle does not falter or founder when it misses a meal of grass and water, or it misses two, three, four, or five meals. It stays firm, and plunges into battle.
ai-an5:139.5.3_0: That’s how a royal bull elephant can’t endure tastes.
ai-an5:139.6.1_0: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can’t endure touches?
ai-an5:139.6.2_0: It’s when a royal bull elephant gone to battle falters and founders when struck by a swift arrow, or by two, three, four, or five swift arrows. It doesn’t stay firm, and fails to plunge into battle.
ai-an5:139.6.3_0: That’s how a royal bull elephant can’t endure touches.
ai-an5:139.7.1_0: A royal bull elephant with these five factors is not worthy of a king, not fit to serve a king, and is not considered a factor of kingship.
ai-an5:139.8.1_0: In the same way, a mendicant with five factors is not worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, not worthy of hospitality, not worthy of a religious donation, not worthy of veneration with joined palms, and is not the supreme field of merit for the world.
ai-an5:139.8.3_0: It’s when a mendicant can’t endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches.
ai-an5:139.9.1_0: And how is it that a mendicant can’t endure sights?
ai-an5:139.9.2_0: It’s when a mendicant, seeing a sight with their eyes, is aroused by a desirable sight, so is not able to still the mind.
ai-an5:139.9.3_0: That’s how a mendicant can’t endure sights.
ai-an5:139.10.1_0: And how is it that a mendicant can’t endure sounds?
ai-an5:139.10.2_0: It’s when a mendicant, hearing a sound with their ears, is aroused by a desirable sound, so is not able to still the mind.
ai-an5:139.10.3_0: That’s how a mendicant can’t endure sounds.
ai-an5:139.11.1_0: And how is it that a mendicant can’t endure smells?
ai-an5:139.11.2_0: It’s when a mendicant, smelling an odor with their nose, is aroused by a desirable smell, so is not able to still the mind.
ai-an5:139.11.3_0: That’s how a mendicant can’t endure smells.
ai-an5:139.12.1_0: And how is it that a mendicant can’t endure tastes?
ai-an5:139.12.2_0: It’s when a mendicant, smelling a taste, tastes a flavor with their tongue, is not able to still the mind.
ai-an5:139.12.3_0: That’s how a mendicant can’t endure tastes.
ai-an5:139.13.1_0: And how is it that a mendicant can’t endure touches?
ai-an5:139.13.2_0: It’s when a mendicant, feeling a touch with their body, is aroused by a desirable touch, so is not able to still the mind.
ai-an5:139.13.3_0: That’s how a mendicant can’t endure touches.
ai-an5:139.14.1_0: A mendicant with these five qualities is not worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, not worthy of hospitality, not worthy of a religious donation, not worthy of veneration with joined palms, and is not the supreme field of merit for the world.
ai-an5:139.15.1_0: A royal bull elephant with five factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and is considered a factor of kingship.
ai-an5:139.15.3_0: It’s when a royal bull elephant can endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches.
ai-an5:139.16.1_0: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can endure sights?
ai-an5:139.16.2_0: It’s when a royal bull elephant gone to battle does not falter or founder at the sight of a division of elephants, of cavalry, of chariots, or of infantry. It stays firm, and plunges into battle.
ai-an5:139.16.3_0: That’s how a royal bull elephant can endure sights.
ai-an5:139.17.1_0: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can endure sounds?
ai-an5:139.17.2_0: It’s when a royal bull elephant does not falter or founder at the sound of a division of elephants, of cavalry, of chariots, or of infantry, or the thunder of the drums, kettledrums, horns, and cymbals. It stays firm, and plunges into battle.
ai-an5:139.17.3_0: That’s how a royal bull elephant can endure sounds.
ai-an5:139.18.1_0: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can endure smells?
ai-an5:139.18.2_0: It’s when a royal bull elephant gone to battle falters and founders when it smells the odor of the feces and urine of battle-hardened, pedigree royal bull elephants. It doesn’t stay firm, and fails to plunge into battle.
ai-an5:139.18.3_0: That’s how a royal bull elephant can endure smells.
ai-an5:139.19.1_0: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can endure tastes?
ai-an5:139.19.2_0: It’s when a royal bull elephant gone to battle does not falter or founder when it misses a meal of grass and water, or it misses two, three, four, or five meals. It stays firm, and plunges into battle.
ai-an5:139.19.3_0: That’s how a royal bull elephant can endure tastes.
ai-an5:139.20.1_0: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can endure touches?
ai-an5:139.20.2_0: It’s when a royal bull elephant gone to battle falters and founders when struck by a swift arrow, or by two, three, four, or five swift arrows. It doesn’t stay firm, and fails to plunge into battle.
ai-an5:139.20.3_0: That’s how a royal bull elephant can endure touches.
ai-an5:139.21.1_0: A royal bull elephant with these five factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and is considered a factor of kingship.
ai-an5:139.22.1_0: In the same way, a mendicant with five qualities is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of veneration with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.
ai-an5:139.22.3_0: It’s when a mendicant can endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches.
ai-an5:139.23.1_0: And how is it that a mendicant can endure sights?
ai-an5:139.23.2_0: It’s when a mendicant, seeing a sight with their eyes, is not aroused by a desirable sight, so is able to still the mind.
ai-an5:139.23.3_0: That’s how a mendicant can endure sights.
ai-an5:139.24.1_0: And how is it that a mendicant can endure sounds?
ai-an5:139.24.2_0: It’s when a mendicant, hearing a sound with their ears, is not aroused by desirable sounds, so is able to still the mind.
ai-an5:139.24.3_0: That’s how a mendicant can endure sounds.
ai-an5:139.25.1_0: And how is it that a mendicant can endure smells?
ai-an5:139.25.2_0: It’s when a mendicant, smelling an odor with their nose, is not aroused by a desirable smell, so is able to still the mind.
ai-an5:139.25.3_0: That’s how a mendicant can endure smells.
ai-an5:139.26.1_0: And how is it that a mendicant can endure tastes?
ai-an5:139.26.2_0: It’s when a mendicant, feeling a taste, touch, and is not aroused by desirable tastes, so is able to still the mind.
ai-an5:139.26.3_0: That’s how a mendicant can endure tastes.
ai-an5:139.27.1_0: And how is it that a mendicant can endure touches?
ai-an5:139.27.2_0: It’s when a mendicant, feeling a touch with their body, is not aroused by a desirable touch, so is able to still the mind.
ai-an5:139.27.3_0: That’s how a mendicant can endure touches.
ai-an5:139.28.1_0: A mendicant with these five qualities is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of veneration with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.”
ai-an5:140.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a royal bull elephant with five factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and is considered a factor of kingship.
ai-an5:140.1.3_0: A royal bull elephant listens, destroys, protects, endures, and goes fast.
ai-an5:140.2.1_0: And how does a royal bull elephant listen?
ai-an5:140.2.2_0: It’s when a royal bull elephant swiftly goes down into the elephant trainer and performs—
ai-an5:140.2.3_0: whether or not it has done it before.
ai-an5:140.2.4_0: paying heed, paying attention, engaging wholeheartedly, and lending an ear.
ai-an5:140.2.5_0: That’s how a royal bull elephant listens.
ai-an5:140.3.1_0: And how does a royal bull elephant destroys?
ai-an5:140.3.2_0: It’s when a royal bull elephant in battle destroys elephants with their riders, horses with their riders, chariots and charioteers, and foot soldiers.
ai-an5:140.3.3_0: That’s how a royal bull elephant destroys.
ai-an5:140.4.1_0: And how does a royal bull elephant protect?
ai-an5:140.4.2_0: It’s when a royal bull elephant in battle protects its fore-quarters and hind-quarters, its fore-feet and hind-feet, and its head, ears, tusks, trunk, tail, and rider.
ai-an5:140.4.3_0: That’s how a royal bull elephant protects.
ai-an5:140.5.1_0: And how does a royal bull elephant endure?
ai-an5:140.5.2_0: It’s when a royal bull elephant gone to battle is patient with an arrows and arrows spears, pearls, and crystals. It’s the sound of horns, kettledrums, and cry out:
ai-an5:140.5.3_0: That’s how a royal bull elephant endures.
ai-an5:140.6.1_0: And how does a royal bull elephant go fast?
ai-an5:140.6.2_0: It’s when a royal bull elephant swiftly goes in whatever direction the elephant trainer sends it,
ai-an5:140.6.3_0: whether or not it has never gone before,
ai-an5:140.6.5_0: That’s how a royal bull elephant goes fast.
ai-an5:140.7.1_0: A royal bull elephant with these five factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and is considered a factor of kingship.
ai-an5:140.8.1_0: In the same way, a mendicant with five qualities is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of veneration with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.
ai-an5:140.8.3_0: A mendicant listens, destroys, protects, endures, and goes fast.
ai-an5:140.9.1_0: And how does a mendicant listen?
ai-an5:140.9.2_0: It’s when a mendicant pays heed, pays attention, engages wholeheartedly, and lends an ear when the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One is being taught.
ai-an5:140.10.1_0: And how does a mendicant endure?
ai-an5:140.10.2_0: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t tolerate a sensual,
ai-an5:140.10.2_2: or cruel thought that’s arisen, but gives it up, gets rid of it, eliminates it, and obliterates it.
ai-an5:140.10.2_3: They don’t tolerate any bad, unskillful qualities that have arisen, but give them up, get rid of them, eliminate them, and obliterate them.
ai-an5:140.11.1_0: And how does a mendicant protect?
ai-an5:140.11.2_0: When a mendicant sees a sight with their eyes, they don’t get caught up in the features and details.
ai-an5:140.11.3_0: If the faculty of sight were left unrestrained, bad unskillful qualities of desire and aversion would become overwhelming.
ai-an5:140.11.3_2: They don’t practice restraint of the eye faculty.
ai-an5:140.11.4_0: When you hear a sound with your ears ...
ai-an5:140.11.5_0: When they smell an odor with their nose ...
ai-an5:140.11.6_0: Tasting a flavor with the tongue ...
ai-an5:140.11.7_0: Feeling a touch with the body ...
ai-an5:140.11.8_0: Knowing a thought with their mind, they don’t get caught up in the features and details.
ai-an5:140.11.9_0: If the faculty of mind were left unrestrained, bad unskillful qualities of desire and aversion would become overwhelming.
ai-an5:140.11.9_2: They practice restraint in the mind,
ai-an5:140.12.1_0: And how does a mendicant endure?
ai-an5:140.12.2_0: It’s when a mendicant endures cold, heat, hunger, and thirst.
ai-an5:140.12.2_1: They endure the touch of flies, mosquitoes, wind, sun, and reptiles. They endure rude and unwelcome criticism. And they put up with physical pain—sharp, severe, acute, unpleasant, disagreeable, and life-threatening.
ai-an5:140.13.1_0: And how does a mendicant go fast?
ai-an5:140.13.2_0: It’s when a mendicant swiftly goes in the direction they’ve never gone before in all this long time; that is, the stilling of all activities, the letting go of all attachments, the ending of craving, fading away, cessation, extinguishment.
ai-an5:140.13.3_0: That’s how a mendicant goes fast.
ai-an5:140.14.1_0: A mendicant with these five qualities is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods. ...
ai-an5:140.14.1_1: they are an unsurpassed field of merit for the world.”
ai-an5:140.14.3_0: The fourth sub-chapter on kings is finished.
ai-an5:140.15.2_0: But the two (whatever) stretchers and frame,
ai-an5:140.15.3_0: Litter in eating fallen into disgrace.
ai-an5:141.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five people are found in the world.
ai-an5:141.1.3_0: One gives then scorns, one lives together then scorns, one is gullible for gossip, one is impulsive, and one is dull and stupid.
ai-an5:141.2.1_0: And how does a person give then scorns?
ai-an5:141.2.2_0: It’s when a person gives robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
ai-an5:141.2.6_0: They give to that person, then they scorn them.
ai-an5:141.2.7_0: That’s how a person gives then scorns.
ai-an5:141.3.1_0: And how does a person live together then scorn?
ai-an5:141.3.2_0: It’s when a person lives with someone else for two or three years.
ai-an5:141.3.3_0: They live together with that person, then they scorn them.
ai-an5:141.3.4_0: That’s how a person live together then scorns.
ai-an5:141.4.1_0: And how is a person gullible for gossip?
ai-an5:141.4.2_0: It’s when they’re very quick to believe what a certain person says in praise or criticism of another.
ai-an5:141.4.3_0: That’s how a person is gullible for gossip.
ai-an5:141.5.1_0: And how is a person impulsive?
ai-an5:141.5.2_0: It’s when a certain person is fickle in faith, devotion, fondness, and confidence.
ai-an5:141.5.3_0: That’s how a person is impulsive.
ai-an5:141.6.1_0: And how is a person dull and stupid?
ai-an5:141.6.2_0: It’s when they don’t know the difference between qualities that are skillful and unskillful, blameworthy and blameless, inferior and superior, and those on the side of dark and bright.
ai-an5:141.6.3_0: That’s how a person is dull and stupid.
ai-an5:141.6.4_0: These are the five people found in the world.”
ai-an5:142.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five people are found in the world.
ai-an5:142.1.3_0: One person violates and regrets it.
ai-an5:142.2.1_0: One person violates and doesn’t regret it.
ai-an5:142.3.1_0: One person doesn’t violate yet still feels regret.
ai-an5:142.4.1_0: One person doesn’t violate yet still feels regret.
ai-an5:142.5.1_0: One person doesn’t violate yet still feels regret.
ai-an5:142.5.2_0: And they do understand where those arisen bad, unskillful qualities cease without anything left over.
ai-an5:142.6.1_0: Take the case of the person who violates and regrets it.
ai-an5:142.6.3_0: You should say this to them:
ai-an5:142.6.4_0: ‘Venerable, the defilements born of violation are found in you, yet the defilements born of regret grow. You would do well to get rid of the defilements born of regret, and then develop the mind and wisdom.
ai-an5:142.6.5_0: In this way you’ll become just like the fifth person.’
ai-an5:142.7.1_0: Take the case of the person who violates and doesn’t regret it.
ai-an5:142.7.3_0: You should say this to them:
ai-an5:142.7.4_0: ‘Venerable, the defilements born of violation are found in you, yet the defilements born of regret grow. You would not do well to get rid of the defilements born of regret, and then develop the mind and wisdom.
ai-an5:142.7.5_0: In this way you’ll become just like the fifth person.’
ai-an5:142.8.1_0: Take the case of the person who neither violates nor regrets.
ai-an5:142.8.3_0: You should say this to them:
ai-an5:142.8.4_0: ‘Venerable, the defilements born of violation are not found in you, yet the defilements born of regret grow. You would do well to get rid of the defilements born of regret, and then develop the mind and wisdom.
ai-an5:142.8.5_0: In this way you’ll become just like the fifth person.’
ai-an5:142.9.1_0: Take the case of the person who neither violates nor regrets.
ai-an5:142.9.3_0: You should say this to them:
ai-an5:142.9.4_0: ‘Venerable, the defilements born of violation are not found in you, yet the defilements born of regret grow. You would not do well to get rid of the defilements born of regret, and then develop the mind and wisdom.
ai-an5:142.9.5_0: In this way you’ll become just like the fifth person.’
ai-an5:142.10.1_0: And so, mendicants, when these four people are advised and instructed by comparison with the fifth person, they gradually attain the ending of defilements.”
ai-an5:143.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
ai-an5:143.1.2_0: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Vesālī for alms.
ai-an5:143.1.3_0: Now at that time around five hundred Licchavis were sitting together at the Sārandada shrine, and this discussion came up among them,
ai-an5:143.1.4_0: “The appearance of five treasures is rare in the world.
ai-an5:143.1.6_0: The elephant-treasure, the horse-treasure, the jewel-treasure, and the woman-treasure.
ai-an5:143.1.7_0: The appearance of these five treasures is rare in the world.”
ai-an5:143.2.1_0: Then those Licchavis sent a man out on to the road, saying,
ai-an5:143.2.2_0: “My good man, let us know when you see the Buddha.”
ai-an5:143.2.3_0: That man saw the Buddha coming off in the distance.
ai-an5:143.2.4_0: He went to the Licchavis and said,
ai-an5:143.2.5_0: “Sirs, the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha is coming.
ai-an5:143.3.1_0: Then those Licchavīs went to the Fortunate One,
ai-an5:143.3.1_2: Then they said to the Buddha,
ai-an5:143.4.1_0: “Please go to the Sārandada shrine, out of compassion.”
ai-an5:143.4.2_0: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.
ai-an5:143.4.3_0: Then the Fortunate One went to the Sārandada Shrine,
ai-an5:143.4.3_1: and after going, he sat down on the prepared seat.
ai-an5:143.4.4_0: “Licchavis, what were you sitting talking about just now? What conversation was unfinished?”
ai-an5:143.4.5_0: “Well, Master Gotama, this discussion came up among us while we were sitting together:
ai-an5:143.4.6_0: ‘The appearance of five treasures is rare in the world. ...’”
ai-an5:143.4.8_0: The elephant-treasure, the horse-treasure, the jewel-treasure, and the woman-treasure.
ai-an5:143.4.9_0: The appearance of these five treasures is rare in the world.’”
ai-an5:143.5.1_0: “You Licchavis are so fixated on sensual pleasures, that’s the only discussion that came up!
ai-an5:143.5.2_0: Licchavis, the appearance of five treasures is rare in the world.
ai-an5:143.5.4_0: A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.
ai-an5:143.5.5_0: A person who explains the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One.
ai-an5:143.5.6_0: A person who understands the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One.
ai-an5:143.5.7_0: A person who practices in line with the teaching.
ai-an5:143.5.8_0: A person who is grateful and thankful.
ai-an5:143.5.9_0: The appearance of these five treasures is rare in the world.”
ai-an5:144.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāketa, in Tikaṇḍakī Wood.
ai-an5:144.2.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant would do well to meditate from time to time perceiving the following: the repulsive in the unrepulsive,
ai-an5:144.2.3_0: the repulsive in both the unrepulsive and the repulsive, and
ai-an5:144.2.4_0: the unrepulsive in both the repulsive and the unrepulsive.
ai-an5:144.2.5_0: A mendicant would do well to meditate from time to time staying equanimous, mindful and aware, rejecting both the repulsive and the unrepulsive.
ai-an5:144.3.1_0: For what reason should a mendicant meditate perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive?
ai-an5:144.3.2_0: ‘May greed not arise in me for things that arouse greed.’
ai-an5:144.3.3_0: A mendicant should meditate perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive for this reason.
ai-an5:144.4.1_0: For what reason should a mendicant meditate perceiving the unrepulsive in the repulsive?
ai-an5:144.4.2_0: ‘May hate not arise in me for things that provoke hate.’ ...
ai-an5:144.4.3_0: A mendicant should meditate perceiving the unrepulsive in the repulsive.
ai-an5:144.5.1_0: For what reason should a mendicant meditate perceiving the repulsive in both the unrepulsive and the repulsive?
ai-an5:144.5.2_0: ‘May greed not arise in me for things that arouse greed. May hate not arise in me for things that provoke hate.’ ...
ai-an5:144.5.3_0: A mendicant should meditate perceiving the repulsive in both the unrepulsive and the repulsive.
ai-an5:144.6.1_0: For what reason should a mendicant meditate perceiving the unrepulsive in both the repulsive and the unrepulsive?
ai-an5:144.6.2_0: ‘May hate not arise in me for things that provoke hate. May greed not arise in me for things that arouse greed.’ ...
ai-an5:144.6.3_0: A mendicant should meditate perceiving the unrepulsive in both the repulsive and the unrepulsive.
ai-an5:144.7.1_0: For what reason should a mendicant meditate staying equanimous, mindful and aware, rejecting both the repulsive and the unrepulsive?
ai-an5:144.7.2_0: ‘May no greed for things that arouse greed, hate for things that provoke hate, or delusion for things that promote delusion arise in me in any way at all.’
ai-an5:144.7.3_0: A mendicant should meditate staying equanimous, mindful and aware, rejecting both the repulsive and the unrepulsive.”
ai-an5:145.1.1_0: “Mendicants, someone with five qualities is cast down to hell.
ai-an5:145.1.3_0: They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, and use alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
ai-an5:145.1.4_0: Someone with these five qualities is cast down to hell.
ai-an5:145.2.1_0: Someone with five qualities is raised up to heaven
ai-an5:145.2.3_0: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or use alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
ai-an5:145.2.4_0: Someone with these five qualities is raised up to heaven.”
ai-an5:146.1.1_0: “Mendicants, you shouldn’t associate with a mendicant friend who has five qualities.
ai-an5:146.1.3_0: They start up work projects. They take up disciplinary issues. They conflict with leading mendicants. They like long and aimless wandering. They’re unable to educate, encourage, fire up, and inspire you from time to time with a Dhamma talk.
ai-an5:146.1.4_0: You shouldn’t associate with a mendicant friend who has these five qualities.
ai-an5:146.2.1_0: You should associate with a mendicant friend who has five qualities.
ai-an5:146.2.3_0: They don’t start up work projects. They don’t take up disciplinary issues. They don’t conflict with leading mendicants. They don’t like long and aimless wandering. They’re able to educate, encourage, fire up, and inspire you from time to time with a Dhamma talk.
ai-an5:146.2.4_0: You should associate with a mendicant friend who has these five qualities.”
ai-an5:146.2.5_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an5:147.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five gifts of a bad person.
ai-an5:147.1.3_0: They give carelessly, shamelessly,ned, and cooked with their own hand. They give with consideration for consequences.
ai-an5:147.1.4_0: These are the five gifts of a bad person.
ai-an5:147.2.1_0: There are these five gifts of a good person.
ai-an5:147.2.3_0: They give carefully. They give thoughtfully. They give with their own hand. They don’t give the dregs. They give with consideration for consequences.
ai-an5:147.2.4_0: These are the five gifts of a good person.”
ai-an5:148.1.1_0: “There are these five gifts of a good person.
ai-an5:148.1.3_0: They give a gift out of faith. They give a gift carefully. They give a gift at the right time. They give a gift with no strings attached. They give a gift without hurting themselves or others.
ai-an5:148.2.1_0: Having given a gift out of faith, in whatever place the result of that gift manifests they become rich, affluent, and wealthy. And they’re attractive, good-looking, lovely, of surpassing beauty.
ai-an5:148.3.1_0: Having given a gift carefully, in whatever place the result of that gift manifests they become rich, affluent, and wealthy.
ai-an5:148.3.2_0: And their children, wives, bondservants, employees, and workers want to listen. They pay attention and try to understand.
ai-an5:148.4.1_0: Having given a gift at the right time, in whatever place the result of that gift manifests they become rich, affluent, and wealthy.
ai-an5:148.4.2_0: And when the time is right, they get all that they need.
ai-an5:148.5.1_0: Having given a gift with no strings attached, in whatever place the result of that gift manifests they become rich, affluent, and wealthy.
ai-an5:148.5.2_0: And their mind tends to enjoy the five refined kinds of sensual stimulation.
ai-an5:148.6.1_0: Having given a gift carefully, in whatever place the result of that gift manifests they become rich, affluent, and wealthy.
ai-an5:148.6.2_0: And no damage comes to their property from anywhere, whether fire, flood, rulers, bandits, or unloved heirs.
ai-an5:148.6.3_0: These are the five gifts of a good person.”
ai-an5:149.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.
ai-an5:149.1.3_0: They relish work, talk, sleep, and company. And they don’t review the extent of their mind’s freedom.
ai-an5:149.1.4_0: These five things lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.
ai-an5:149.2.1_0: These five things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.
ai-an5:149.2.3_0: They don’t relish work, talk, sleep, and company. And they review the extent of their mind’s freedom.
ai-an5:149.2.4_0: These five things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.”
ai-an5:150.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.
ai-an5:150.1.3_0: They relish work, talk, and sleep. They don’t guard the sense doors and they eat too much.
ai-an5:150.1.4_0: These five things lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.
ai-an5:150.2.1_0: These five things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.
ai-an5:150.2.3_0: They don’t relish work, talk, sleep, and company. They guard the sense doors and they have moderation in eating.
ai-an5:150.2.4_0: These five things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant who is temporarily free.”
ai-an5:150.2.6_0: The fifth sub-chapter on _paṇḍakas_ is finished.
ai-an5:150.3.4_0: he makes sure it freed in mind.
ai-an5:150.3.5_0: The third rains residence was completed.
ai-an5:151.1.1_0: “Mendicants, someone with five qualities is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.
ai-an5:151.1.3_0: They disparage the talk, the speaker, or themselves. They listen with distracted and scattered mind. They attend improperly.
ai-an5:151.1.4_0: Someone with these five qualities is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.
ai-an5:151.2.1_0: Someone with five qualities is able to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.
ai-an5:151.2.3_0: They don’t disparage the talk, the speaker, or themselves. They listen with undistracted and unified mind. They attend properly.
ai-an5:151.2.4_0: Someone with these five qualities is able to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.”
ai-an5:152.1.1_0: “Mendicants, someone with five qualities is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.
ai-an5:152.1.3_0: They disparage the talk, the speaker, or themselves. They’re witless, dull, and stupid. They think they know what they don’t know.
ai-an5:152.1.4_0: Someone with these five qualities is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.
ai-an5:152.2.1_0: Someone with five qualities is able to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.
ai-an5:152.2.3_0: They don’t disparage the talk, the speaker, or themselves. They’re wise, bright, and clever. They don’t think they know what they don’t know.
ai-an5:152.2.4_0: Someone with these five qualities is able to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.”
ai-an5:153.1.1_0: “Mendicants, someone with five qualities is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.
ai-an5:153.1.3_0: They listen to the teaching bent only on putting it down. They listen to the teaching with a hostile, fault-finding mind. They’re antagonistic to the teacher, planning to attack them. They’re witless, dull, and stupid. And they think they know what they don’t know.
ai-an5:153.1.4_0: Someone with these five qualities is unable to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.
ai-an5:153.2.1_0: Someone with five qualities is able to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.
ai-an5:153.2.3_0: They don’t listen to the teaching bent only on putting it down. They don’t listen to the teaching with a hostile, fault-finding mind. They’re not antagonistic to the teacher, and not planning to attack them. They’re wise, bright, and clever. And they don’t think they know what they don’t know.
ai-an5:153.2.4_0: Someone with these five qualities is able to enter the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.”
ai-an5:154.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
ai-an5:154.1.3_0: It’s when mendicants don’t carefully listen to the teachings, memorize them, and remember them. They don’t carefully examine the meaning of teachings that they remember. And they don’t carefully practice in line with the meaning and the teaching they’ve understood.
ai-an5:154.1.4_0: These five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
ai-an5:154.2.1_0: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.
ai-an5:154.2.3_0: It’s when mendicants carefully listen to the teachings, memorize them, and remember them. They carefully examine the meaning of teachings that they remember. And they carefully practice in line with the meaning and the teaching they’ve understood.
ai-an5:154.2.4_0: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.”
ai-an5:155.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
ai-an5:155.1.3_0: It’s when the mendicants don’t memorize the teaching—
ai-an5:155.1.4_0: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.
ai-an5:155.2.1_0: Furthermore, the mendicants don’t teach others the Dhamma in detail as they learned and memorized it.
ai-an5:155.3.1_0: Furthermore, the mendicants don’t make others recite the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.
ai-an5:155.4.1_0: Furthermore, the mendicants don’t recite the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.
ai-an5:155.5.1_0: Furthermore, the mendicants don’t think about and consider the teaching in their hearts, examining it with their minds as they learned and memorized it.
ai-an5:155.5.3_0: These five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
ai-an5:155.6.1_0: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.
ai-an5:155.6.3_0: It’s when the mendicants memorize the teaching—
ai-an5:155.6.4_0: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.
ai-an5:155.7.1_0: Furthermore, the mendicants explain the teaching in detail to others as they learned and memorized it.
ai-an5:155.8.1_0: Furthermore, the mendicants make others recite the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.
ai-an5:155.9.1_0: Furthermore, the mendicants recite the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.
ai-an5:155.10.1_0: Furthermore, the mendicants think about and consider the teaching in their hearts, examining it with their minds as they learned and memorized it.
ai-an5:155.10.3_0: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.”
ai-an5:156.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
ai-an5:156.1.3_0: Firstly, the mendicants memorize discourses that they learned incorrectly, with misplaced words and phrases.
ai-an5:156.1.4_0: The meaning is improperly interpreted with improper words and phrases.
ai-an5:156.2.1_0: Furthermore, the mendicants are hard to admonish, having qualities that make them hard to admonish. They’re impatient, and don’t take instruction respectfully.
ai-an5:156.3.1_0: Furthermore, the mendicants who are very learned—knowledgeable in the scriptures, who have memorized the teachings, the texts on monastic training, and the outlines—don’t carefully make others recite the discourses.
ai-an5:156.3.2_0: When they pass away, the discourses are cut off at the root, with no-one to preserve them.
ai-an5:156.4.1_0: Furthermore, the senior mendicants are indulgent and slack, leaders in backsliding, neglecting seclusion, not rousing energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.
ai-an5:156.4.2_0: Those who come after follow their example.
ai-an5:156.4.3_0: They too are indulgent and slack ...
ai-an5:156.5.1_0: Furthermore, there’s a schism in the Saṅgha.
ai-an5:156.5.2_0: When the Saṅgha is split, they abuse, insult, block, and reject each other.
ai-an5:156.5.3_0: This doesn’t inspire confidence in those without it, and it causes some with confidence to change their minds.
ai-an5:156.5.5_0: These five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.
ai-an5:156.6.1_0: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.
ai-an5:156.6.3_0: Firstly, the mendicants memorize discourses that have been learned correctly, with well placed words and phrases.
ai-an5:156.6.4_0: When the words and phrases are well organized, the meaning is correctly interpreted.
ai-an5:156.7.1_0: Furthermore, the mendicants are easy to admonish, having qualities that make them easy to admonish. They’re patient, and take instruction respectfully.
ai-an5:156.8.1_0: Furthermore, the mendicants who are very learned—knowledgeable in the scriptures, who have memorized the teachings, the texts on monastic training, and the outlines—carefully make others recite the discourses.
ai-an5:156.8.2_0: When they pass away, the discourses aren’t cut off at the root, and they have someone to preserve them.
ai-an5:156.9.1_0: Furthermore, the senior mendicants are not indulgent and slack, leaders in backsliding, neglecting seclusion.
ai-an5:156.9.1_1: They rouse energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.
ai-an5:156.9.2_0: Those who come after follow their example.
ai-an5:156.9.3_0: They too aren’t indulgent or slack ...
ai-an5:156.10.1_0: Furthermore, the Saṅgha lives comfortably, in harmony, appreciating each other, without quarreling, with one recitation.
ai-an5:156.10.2_0: When the Saṅgha is in harmony, they don’t abuse, insult, block, or reject each other.
ai-an5:156.10.3_0: This inspires confidence in those without it, and increases confidence in those who have it.
ai-an5:156.10.5_0: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.”
ai-an5:156.10.6_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an5:157.1.1_0: “Mendicants, it is inappropriate to speak to five kinds of person by comparing that person with someone else.
ai-an5:157.1.3_0: It’s inappropriate to talk to an unfaithful person about faith.
ai-an5:157.1.4_0: It’s inappropriate to talk to an unethical person about ethics.
ai-an5:157.1.5_0: It’s inappropriate to talk to an unlearned person about learning.
ai-an5:157.1.6_0: It’s inappropriate to talk to a stingy person about generosity.
ai-an5:157.1.7_0: It’s inappropriate to talk to a witless person about wisdom.
ai-an5:157.2.1_0: And why is it inappropriate to talk to an unfaithful person about faith?
ai-an5:157.2.2_0: When an unfaithful person is spoken to about faith they lose their temper, becoming annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, and displaying annoyance, hate, and bitterness.
ai-an5:157.2.4_0: Not seeing that faith in themselves, they don’t get the rapture and joy that faith brings.
ai-an5:157.2.5_0: That’s why it’s inappropriate to talk to an unfaithful person about faith.
ai-an5:157.3.1_0: And why is it inappropriate to talk to an unethical person about ethics?
ai-an5:157.3.2_0: When an unethical person is spoken to about ethics they lose their temper ...
ai-an5:157.3.4_0: Not seeing that ethical conduct in themselves, they don’t get the rapture and joy that ethical conduct brings.
ai-an5:157.3.5_0: That’s why it’s inappropriate to talk to an unethical person about ethics.
ai-an5:157.4.1_0: And why is it inappropriate to talk to an unlearned person about learning?
ai-an5:157.4.2_0: When an unlearned person is spoken to about learning they lose their temper ...
ai-an5:157.4.4_0: Not seeing that learning in themselves, they don’t get the rapture and joy that learning brings.
ai-an5:157.4.5_0: That’s why it’s inappropriate to talk to an unlearned person about learning.
ai-an5:157.5.1_0: And why is it inappropriate to talk to a stingy person about generosity?
ai-an5:157.5.2_0: When an stingy person is spoken to about generosity they lose their temper ...
ai-an5:157.5.4_0: Not seeing that generosity in themselves, they don’t get the rapture and joy that generosity brings.
ai-an5:157.5.5_0: That’s why it’s inappropriate to talk to a stingy person about generosity.
ai-an5:157.6.1_0: And why is it inappropriate to talk to a witless person about wisdom?
ai-an5:157.6.2_0: When a witless person is spoken to about wisdom they lose their temper, becoming annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, and displaying annoyance, hate, and bitterness.
ai-an5:157.6.4_0: Not seeing that wisdom in themselves, they don’t get the rapture and joy that wisdom brings.
ai-an5:157.6.5_0: That’s why it’s inappropriate to talk to a witless person about wisdom.
ai-an5:157.6.6_0: It is inappropriate to speak to these five kinds of person by comparing that person with someone else.
ai-an5:157.7.1_0: It is appropriate to speak to five kinds of person by comparing that person with someone else.
ai-an5:157.7.3_0: It’s appropriate to talk to a faithful person about faith.
ai-an5:157.7.4_0: It’s appropriate to talk to an ethical person about ethical conduct.
ai-an5:157.7.5_0: It’s appropriate to talk to a learned person about learning.
ai-an5:157.7.6_0: It’s appropriate to talk to a generous person about generosity.
ai-an5:157.7.7_0: It’s appropriate to talk to a wise person about wisdom.
ai-an5:157.8.1_0: And why is it appropriate to talk to a faithful person about faith?
ai-an5:157.8.2_0: When a faithful person is spoken to about faith they don’t lose their temper, they don’t get annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, or display annoyance, hate, and bitterness.
ai-an5:157.8.4_0: Seeing that faith in themselves, they get the rapture and joy that faith brings.
ai-an5:157.8.5_0: That’s why it’s appropriate to talk to a faithful person about faith.
ai-an5:157.9.1_0: And why is it appropriate to talk to an ethical person about ethical conduct?
ai-an5:157.9.2_0: When an ethical person is spoken to about ethical conduct they don’t lose their temper ...
ai-an5:157.9.4_0: Seeing that ethical conduct in themselves, they get the rapture and joy that ethical conduct brings.
ai-an5:157.9.5_0: That’s why it’s appropriate to talk to an ethical person about ethical conduct.
ai-an5:157.10.1_0: And why is it appropriate to talk to a learned person about learning?
ai-an5:157.10.2_0: When a learned person is spoken to about learning they don’t lose their temper ...
ai-an5:157.10.4_0: Seeing that learning in themselves, they get the rapture and joy that learning brings.
ai-an5:157.10.5_0: That’s why it’s appropriate to talk to a learned person about learning.
ai-an5:157.11.1_0: And why is it appropriate to talk to a generous person about generosity?
ai-an5:157.11.2_0: When a generous person is spoken to about generosity they don’t lose their temper ...
ai-an5:157.11.4_0: Seeing that generosity in themselves, they get the rapture and joy that generosity brings.
ai-an5:157.11.5_0: That’s why it’s appropriate to talk to a generous person about generosity.
ai-an5:157.12.1_0: And why is it appropriate to talk to a wise person about wisdom?
ai-an5:157.12.2_0: When a wise person is spoken to about wisdom they don’t lose their temper, they don’t get annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, or display annoyance, hate, and bitterness.
ai-an5:157.12.4_0: Seeing that wisdom in themselves, they get the rapture and joy that wisdom brings.
ai-an5:157.12.5_0: That’s why it’s appropriate to talk to a wise person about wisdom.
ai-an5:157.12.6_0: It is appropriate to speak to these five kinds of person by comparing that person with someone else.”
ai-an5:158.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant with five qualities is overcome by timidity.
ai-an5:158.1.3_0: It’s when a mendicant is faithless, unethical, with little learning, lazy, and witless.
ai-an5:158.1.4_0: A mendicant with these five qualities is overcome by timidity.
ai-an5:158.2.1_0: A mendicant with five qualities is self-assured.
ai-an5:158.2.3_0: It’s when a mendicant is faithful, ethical, learned, energetic, and wise.
ai-an5:158.2.4_0: A mendicant with these five qualities is self-assured.”
ai-an5:159.1.2_0: at one time the Fortunate One was dwelling near Kosambī, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
ai-an5:159.1.3_0: Now, at that time Venerable Udāyī was sitting teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly of laypeople.
ai-an5:159.1.5_0: And having seen (him) he approached the Fortunate One,
ai-an5:159.1.5_2: After the meal, on his return from alms-round, he went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened.
ai-an5:159.1.6_0: “Sir, Venerable Udāyī is teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly of laypeople.”
ai-an5:159.2.1_0: “Ānanda, it’s not easy to teach Dhamma to others.
ai-an5:159.2.2_0: You should establish five things in yourself before teaching Dhamma to others.
ai-an5:159.2.4_0: You should teach Dhamma to others thinking: ‘I will teach step by step.’ ...
ai-an5:159.2.6_0: You should teach Dhamma to others thinking: ‘I will teach step by step.’ ...
ai-an5:159.2.7_0: ‘I will not teach while secretly hoping to profit.’ ...
ai-an5:159.2.8_0: ‘I will teach without hurting myself or others.’
ai-an5:159.2.9_0: It’s not easy to teach Dhamma to others.
ai-an5:159.2.10_0: You should establish these five things in yourself before teaching Dhamma to others.”
ai-an5:160.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five things are hard to get rid of once they’ve arisen.
ai-an5:160.1.3_0: Greed, hate, delusion, the feeling of being inspired to speak out, and thoughts of traveling.
ai-an5:160.1.4_0: These five things are hard to get rid of once they’ve arisen.”
ai-an5:160.1.6_0: The first sub-chapter on true teaching is finished.
ai-an5:160.2.1_0: if it is a right way;
ai-an5:160.2.2_0: There are three loves of the true teaching,
ai-an5:161.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant should use these five methods to completely get rid of resentment when it has arisen toward anyone.
ai-an5:161.1.3_0: You should develop loving-kindness for a person you resent. ...
ai-an5:161.1.4_0: you should get rid of resentment for that person.
ai-an5:161.1.5_0: You should develop compassion for a person you resent. ...
ai-an5:161.1.6_0: you should get rid of resentment for that person.
ai-an5:161.1.7_0: You should develop equanimity for a person you resent. ...
ai-an5:161.1.8_0: you should get rid of resentment for that person.
ai-an5:161.1.9_0: You should disregard a person you resent, paying no attention to them. ...
ai-an5:161.1.10_0: you should get rid of resentment for that person.
ai-an5:161.1.11_0: You should apply the concept that we are the owners of our deeds to that person:
ai-an5:161.1.12_0: ‘This venerable is the owner of their deeds and heir to their deeds. Deeds are their womb, their relative, and their refuge.
ai-an5:161.1.13_0: They shall be the heir of whatever deeds they do, whether good or bad.’
ai-an5:161.1.14_0: you should get rid of resentment for that person.
ai-an5:161.1.15_0: A mendicant should use these five methods to completely get rid of resentment when it has arisen toward anyone.”
ai-an5:162.2.1_0: “Reverends, a mendicant should use these five methods to completely get rid of resentment when it has arisen toward anyone.
ai-an5:162.2.3_0: In the case of a person whose behavior by way of body is impure, but whose behavior by way of speech is pure,
ai-an5:162.2.4_0: you should get rid of resentment for that kind of person.
ai-an5:162.2.5_0: In the case of a person whose behavior by way of speech is impure, but whose behavior by way of body is pure, ...
ai-an5:162.2.6_0: you should get rid of resentment for that kind of person.
ai-an5:162.2.7_0: In the case of a person whose behavior by way of body and speech is impure, but who gets an openness and clarity of heart from time to time, ...
ai-an5:162.2.8_0: you should get rid of resentment for that kind of person.
ai-an5:162.2.9_0: In the case of a person whose behavior by way of body and speech is impure, but who doesn’t get an openness and clarity of heart from time to time, ...
ai-an5:162.2.10_0: you should get rid of resentment for that kind of person.
ai-an5:162.2.11_0: In the case of a person whose behavior by way of body and speech is pure, and who gets an openness and clarity of heart from time to time,
ai-an5:162.2.12_0: you should get rid of resentment for that kind of person.
ai-an5:162.3.1_0: How should you get rid of resentment for a person whose behavior by way of body is impure, but whose behavior by way of speech is pure?
ai-an5:162.3.2_0: Suppose a mendicant wearing rag robes sees a rag by the side of the road. They’d hold it down with the left foot, spread it out with the right foot, tear out what was intact, and take it away with them.
ai-an5:162.3.3_0: In the same way, at that time you should ignore that person’s impure behavior by way of body and focus on their pure behavior by way of speech.
ai-an5:162.3.4_0: you should get rid of resentment for that person.
ai-an5:162.4.1_0: How should you get rid of resentment for a person whose behavior by way of speech is impure, but whose behavior by way of body is pure?
ai-an5:162.4.2_0: Suppose there was a lotus pond covered with moss and aquatic plants.
ai-an5:162.4.3_0: Then along comes a person struggling in the oppressive heat, weary, thirsty, and parched.
ai-an5:162.4.4_0: They’d plunge into the lotus pond, sweep apart the moss and aquatic plants, drink from their cupped hands, and be on their way.
ai-an5:162.4.5_0: In the same way, at that time you should ignore that person’s impure behavior by way of speech and focus on their pure behavior by way of body.
ai-an5:162.4.6_0: you should get rid of resentment for that person.
ai-an5:162.5.1_0: How should you get rid of resentment for a person whose behavior by way of body and speech is impure, but who gets an openness and clarity of heart from time to time?
ai-an5:162.5.2_0: Suppose there was a little water in a cow’s hoofprint.
ai-an5:162.5.3_0: Then along comes a person struggling in the oppressive heat, weary, thirsty, and parched.
ai-an5:162.5.5_0: ‘This little bit of water is in a cow’s hoofprint.
ai-an5:162.5.6_0: If I drink it with my cupped hands or a bowl, I’ll stir it and disturb it, making it undrinkable.
ai-an5:162.5.7_0: Why don’t I drank the cow-perd and drink water alcohol?’
ai-an5:162.5.8_0: After eating four or five lumps before eating, he would leave out and go away.
ai-an5:162.5.9_0: In the same way, at that time you should ignore that person’s impure behavior by way of speech and body,
ai-an5:162.5.10_0: Even at that time their verbal behavior is impure.
ai-an5:162.5.11_0: and focus on the fact that they get an openness and clarity of heart from time to time.
ai-an5:162.5.12_0: you should get rid of resentment for that person.
ai-an5:162.6.1_0: How should you get rid of resentment for a person whose behavior by way of body and speech is impure, and who doesn’t get an openness and clarity of heart from time to time?
ai-an5:162.6.2_0: Suppose there was a person who was sick, suffering, and gravely ill.
ai-an5:162.6.3_0: And it was a long way to a village, whether ahead or behind.
ai-an5:162.6.4_0: And they didn’t have any suitable food or medicine, or a competent carer, or someone to bring them to the neighborhood of a village.
ai-an5:162.6.5_0: Then another person traveling along the road sees them,
ai-an5:162.6.6_0: and thinks of them with nothing but compassion, kindness, and sympathy:
ai-an5:162.6.7_0: ‘Oh, if only they get suitable food and medicines, their attendants would get suitable food and medicines, and a competent carer.
ai-an5:162.6.9_0: So that they don’t come to ruin right here.’
ai-an5:162.6.10_0: In the same way, take a person whose behavior by way of body and speech is impure, but who doesn’t get an openness and clarity of heart from time to time:
ai-an5:162.6.11_0: ‘Oh, may this person give up bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind, and develop good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-an5:162.6.13_0: When your body breaks up, after death, you’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.’
ai-an5:162.6.14_0: you should get rid of resentment for that person.
ai-an5:162.7.1_0: How should you get rid of resentment for a person whose behavior by way of body and speech is pure, and who gets an openness and clarity of heart from time to time?
ai-an5:162.7.2_0: Suppose there was a lotus pond with clear, sweet, cool water, clean, with smooth banks, delightful, and shaded by many trees.
ai-an5:162.7.3_0: Then along comes a person struggling in the oppressive heat, weary, thirsty, and parched.
ai-an5:162.7.4_0: They’d plunge into the lotus pond to bathe and drink. And after emerging they’d sit or lie down right there in the shade of the trees.
ai-an5:162.8.1_0: In the same way, at that time you should focus on that person’s pure behavior by way of body and speech, and on the fact that they get an openness and clarity of heart from time to time.
ai-an5:162.8.2_0: Their verbal behavior should be focused on by way of speech.
ai-an5:162.8.3_0: At that time they focus on the fact that they get an openness and clarity of heart from time to time.
ai-an5:162.8.4_0: you should get rid of resentment for that person.
ai-an5:162.8.5_0: A person climbed by heartwood applying their mind.
ai-an5:162.9.1_0: A mendicant should use these five methods to completely get rid of resentment when it has arisen toward anyone.”
ai-an5:163.2.1_0: “Reverends, a mendicant with five qualities is fit to hold a discussion with their spiritual companions.
ai-an5:163.2.3_0: A mendicant is personally accomplished in ethics, and answers questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in ethics.
ai-an5:163.2.7_0: They’re personally accomplished in the knowledge and vision of freedom, and they answer questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in the knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an5:163.2.8_0: A mendicant with these five qualities is fit to hold a discussion with their spiritual companions.”
ai-an5:164.1.2_0: “A mendicant with five qualities is fit to share their life with their spiritual companions.
ai-an5:164.1.4_0: A mendicant is personally accomplished in ethics, and answers questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in ethics.
ai-an5:164.1.8_0: They’re personally accomplished in the knowledge and vision of freedom, and they answer questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in the knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an5:164.1.9_0: A mendicant with these five qualities is fit to share their life with their spiritual companions.”
ai-an5:165.1.1_1: “Reverends, whoever asks a question of another, does so for one or other of these five reasons.
ai-an5:165.1.3_0: Someone asks a question of another from stupidity and folly. Or they ask from wicked desires, being naturally full of desires. Or they ask in order to disparage. Or they ask wanting to understand. Or they ask with the thought,
ai-an5:165.1.4_0: ‘If I answers to me, I’ll answer them.’
ai-an5:165.1.5_0: Whoever asks a question of another, does so for one or other of these five reasons.
ai-an5:165.1.6_0: As for myself, I ask with the thought,
ai-an5:165.1.7_0: ‘If I answers a question, I’ll answer you.’”
ai-an5:166.1.2_0: “Reverends, take a mendicant who is accomplished in ethics, immersion, and wisdom. They might enter into and emerge from the cessation of perception and feeling.
ai-an5:166.1.4_0: If they don’t reach enlightenment in this very life, they’re reborn in the company of a certain host of mind-made gods, who surpass the gods that consume solid food. There they might enter into and emerge from the cessation of perception and feeling.
ai-an5:166.1.5_0: she is possible to see this.”
ai-an5:166.2.1_0: When he said this, Udāyī said to him,
ai-an5:166.2.2_0: “It’s impossible, Reverend Sāriputta, it cannot happen that that a mendicant who, surpassing the company of gods that consume solid food, is reborn in a certain host of mind-made gods.
ai-an5:166.3.1_0: But for a second ... and a third time Sāriputta repeated his statement.
ai-an5:166.3.2_0: “Reverends, take a mendicant who is accomplished in ethics, immersion, and wisdom. They might enter into and emerge from the cessation of perception and feeling.
ai-an5:166.3.4_0: If they don’t reach enlightenment in this very life, they’re reborn in the company of a certain host of mind-made gods, who surpass the gods that consume solid food. There they might enter into and emerge from the cessation of perception and feeling.
ai-an5:166.3.5_0: she is possible to see this.”
ai-an5:166.4.1_0: And for a third time, Udāyī said to him,
ai-an5:166.4.2_0: “It’s impossible, Reverend Sāriputta, it cannot happen that that a mendicant who, surpassing the company of gods that consume solid food, is reborn in a certain host of mind-made gods.
ai-an5:166.5.2_0: “Udāyī dislikes me. He agrees with me. Nor agrees with me.
ai-an5:166.5.3_0: Why don’t I go to see the Buddha?”
ai-an5:166.5.4_0: Then venerable Sāriputta approached the Fortunate One,
ai-an5:166.5.5_0: After the meal, on his return from alms-round, he addressed the mendicants:
ai-an5:166.5.6_0: “Reverends, take a mendicant who is accomplished in ethics, immersion, and wisdom. They might enter into and emerge from the cessation of perception and feeling.
ai-an5:166.5.8_0: If they don’t reach enlightenment in this very life, they’re reborn in the company of a certain host of mind-made gods, who surpass the gods that consume solid food. There they might enter into and emerge from the cessation of perception and feeling.
ai-an5:166.5.9_0: she is possible to see this.”
ai-an5:166.6.1_0: When he said this, Udāyī said to him,
ai-an5:166.6.2_0: “It’s impossible, Reverend Sāriputta, it cannot happen that that a mendicant who, surpassing the company of gods that consume solid food, is reborn in a certain host of mind-made gods.
ai-an5:166.7.1_0: But for a second ... and a third time Sāriputta repeated his statement.
ai-an5:166.7.2_0: “Reverends, take a mendicant who is accomplished in ethics, immersion, and wisdom. They might enter into and emerge from the cessation of perception and feeling.
ai-an5:166.7.4_0: If they don’t reach enlightenment in this very life, they’re reborn in the company of a certain host of mind-made gods, who surpass the gods that consume solid food. There they might enter into and emerge from the cessation of perception and feeling.
ai-an5:166.7.5_0: she is possible to see this.”
ai-an5:166.8.1_0: And for a third time, Udāyī said to him,
ai-an5:166.8.2_0: “It’s impossible, Reverend Sāriputta, it cannot happen that that a mendicant who, surpassing the company of gods that consume solid food, is reborn in a certain host of mind-made gods.
ai-an5:166.9.2_0: “Even in front of the Buddha Venerable Udāyī disagrees with me three times, and not one mendicant agrees with me.
ai-an5:166.10.1_0: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Udāyī,
ai-an5:166.10.2_0: “But Udāyī, do you believe in a mind-made body?”
ai-an5:166.10.3_0: “For those gods, sir, who are formless, made of perception.”
ai-an5:166.10.4_0: “Udāyī, what has an incompetent fool like you got to say?
ai-an5:166.10.5_0: How on earth could you imagine you’ve got something worth saying!”
ai-an5:166.11.1_0: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Ānanda,
ai-an5:166.11.2_0: “Ānanda! There’s a senior mendicant being harassed, and you just watch it happening.
ai-an5:166.11.3_0: There won’t be worth a fraction that you’ll delight in being troublesome.”
ai-an5:166.12.1_0: Then the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
ai-an5:166.12.2_0: “Mendicants, take a mendicant who is accomplished in ethics, immersion, and wisdom. They might enter into and emerge from the cessation of perception and feeling.
ai-an5:166.12.4_0: If they don’t reach enlightenment in this very life, they’re reborn in the company of a certain host of mind-made gods, who surpass the gods that consume solid food. There they might enter into and emerge from the cessation of perception and feeling.
ai-an5:166.12.5_0: she is possible to see this.”
ai-an5:166.12.6_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-an5:166.12.7_0: When he had spoken, the Holy One got up from his seat and entered his dwelling.
ai-an5:166.13.1_0: Then, not long after the Buddha had left, Venerable Ānanda went to Venerable Upavāṇa.
ai-an5:166.13.1_1: and after going, he said this to venerable Upavāṇa:
ai-an5:166.13.2_0: “Reverend Upavāṇa, they’ve been harassing other senior mendicants,
ai-an5:166.13.4_0: I wouldn’t be surprised if the Buddha makes a statement about this when he comes out of retreat later this afternoon. He might even call upon Venerable Upavāṇa himself.
ai-an5:166.13.5_0: And right now I feel timid.”
ai-an5:166.13.6_0: Then in the late afternoon, the Buddha came out of retreat and went to the assembly hall.
ai-an5:166.13.6_1: and after going, he sat down on the prepared seat.
ai-an5:166.14.1_0: “Upavāṇa, how many qualities should a senior mendicant have to be dear and beloved to their spiritual companions, respected and admired?”
ai-an5:166.14.2_0: “Sir, a senior mendicant with five qualities is dear and beloved to their spiritual companions, respected and admired.
ai-an5:166.14.4_0: It’s when a mendicant is ethical, restrained in the code of conduct, with good behavior and supporters. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.
ai-an5:166.14.6_0: They’re a good speaker. Their voice is polished, clear, articulate, and expresses the meaning.
ai-an5:166.14.7_0: they get the four absorptions—blissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind—when they want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-an5:166.14.8_0: They realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-an5:166.14.9_0: A senior mendicant with these five qualities is dear and beloved to their spiritual companions, respected and admired.”
ai-an5:166.15.2_0: A senior mendicant with these five qualities is dear and beloved to their spiritual companions, respected and admired.
ai-an5:166.15.3_0: If these five qualities weren’t found in the senior mendicant, their spiritual companions would not honor, respect, revere, venerate them.
ai-an5:166.15.4_0: But since these five qualities are found in a senior mendicant, their spiritual companions honor, respect, revere, or venerate them.”
ai-an5:166.15.5_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an5:167.1.2_0: “Reverends, a mendicant who wants to accuse another should first establish five things in themselves.
ai-an5:167.2.2_0: ‘I’ll speak at an appropriate time, not at an inappropriate one;
ai-an5:167.2.3_0: I’ll speak the truth, not falsehood;
ai-an5:167.2.5_0: I’ll speak what’s beneficial, not what’s unbeneficial;
ai-an5:167.2.6_0: I will speak lovingly, not from secret hate.
ai-an5:167.2.7_0: A mendicant who wants to accuse another should first establish these five things in themselves.
ai-an5:167.3.1_0: Take a case where I see a certain person being accused at the wrong time, not being disturbed at the right time. They’re accused falsely, not disturbed truthfully. They’re accused harshly, not disturbed gently. They’re accused harmfully, not disturbed beneficially. They’re accused with secret hate, not disturbed lovingly.
ai-an5:167.4.1_0: The mendicant who is accused improperly should be reassured in five ways.
ai-an5:167.4.2_0: ‘Venerable, you were accused at the wrong time, not at the right time. There’s no need for you to feel remorse.
ai-an5:167.4.3_0: You have been accused falsely, not truthfully; there is no need for you to have regret.
ai-an5:167.4.4_0: You have been accused harshly, not gently; there is no need for you to have regret.
ai-an5:167.4.5_0: You were accused harmfully, not beneficially. ...
ai-an5:167.4.6_0: You were accused with secret hate, not lovingly. There’s no need for you to feel remorse.’
ai-an5:167.4.7_0: A mendicant who is accused improperly should be reassured in these five ways.
ai-an5:167.5.1_0: The mendicant who makes improper accusations should be chastened in five ways.
ai-an5:167.5.2_0: ‘Reverend, you made an accusation at the wrong time, not at the right time. There’s a reason for you to feel remorse.
ai-an5:167.5.3_0: You made an accusation falsely, not truthfully. ...
ai-an5:167.5.4_0: You made an accusation harshly, not gently. ...
ai-an5:167.5.5_0: You made an accusation harmfully, not beneficially. ...
ai-an5:167.5.6_0: You made an accusation with secret hate, not lovingly. There’s a reason for you to feel remorse.’
ai-an5:167.5.7_0: The mendicant who makes improper accusations should be chastened in these five ways.
ai-an5:167.5.9_0: So that other monks won’t think to accuse others falsely.
ai-an5:167.6.1_0: Take a case where I see a certain person being accused at the right time, not being disturbed at the wrong time. They’re accused truthfully, not disturbed falsely. They’re accused gently, not disturbed harshly. They’re accused beneficially, not disturbed harmfully. They’re accused lovingly, not disturbed with secret hate.
ai-an5:167.7.1_0: The mendicant who is accused properly should be chastened in five ways.
ai-an5:167.7.2_0: ‘Venerable, you were accused at the right time, not at the wrong time. There’s a reason for you to feel remorse.
ai-an5:167.7.3_0: You have been accused truthfully, not falsely; it’s appropriate for you to have regret.
ai-an5:167.7.4_0: You were accused gently, not harshly. ...
ai-an5:167.7.5_0: You have been accused beneficially, not unbeneficially; it’s appropriate for you to have regret.
ai-an5:167.7.6_0: You were accused lovingly, not with secret hate. There’s a reason for you to feel remorse.’
ai-an5:167.7.7_0: The mendicant who is accused properly should be chastened in these five ways.
ai-an5:167.8.1_0: The mendicant who makes proper accusations should be reassured in five ways.
ai-an5:167.8.2_0: ‘Reverend, you made an accusation at the wrong time, not at the wrong time. There’s no need for you to have regret.
ai-an5:167.8.3_0: You made an accusation truthfully, not falsely. ...
ai-an5:167.8.4_0: You made an accusation gently, not harshly. ...
ai-an5:167.8.5_0: You made an accusation beneficially, not harmfully. ...
ai-an5:167.8.6_0: You made an accusation lovingly, not with secret hate. There’s no need for you to feel remorse.’
ai-an5:167.8.7_0: The mendicant who makes proper accusations should be reassured in these five ways.
ai-an5:167.8.9_0: So that another mendicant would think to make a true accusation.
ai-an5:167.9.1_0: A person who is accused should ground themselves in two things:
ai-an5:167.9.3_0: Even if others accuse me—at the right time or the wrong time, truthfully or falsely, gently or harshly, beneficially or harmfully, lovingly or with secret hate—I will still ground myself in two things:
ai-an5:167.9.6_0: that quality is found in me, I will tell them that it is.
ai-an5:167.9.7_0: ‘It’s very hard for me to see.’
ai-an5:167.9.9_0: that quality is not found in me, I will tell them that it is not.”
ai-an5:167.9.10_0: ‘This teaching is not found in me.’”
ai-an5:167.10.1_0: “Even when you speak like this, Sāriputta, there are still some foolish people here who do not respectfully take it up.”
ai-an5:167.11.1_0: “Sir, there are those faithless people who went forth from the lay life to homelessness not out of faith but to earn a livelihood.
ai-an5:167.12.1_0: Sir, there are those gentlemen who went forth from the lay life to homelessness out of faith. They’re not devious, deceitful, and sneaky. They’re not restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, and loose-tongued. They guard their sense doors and eat in moderation, and they are committed to wakefulness. They care about the ascetic life, and keenly respect the training. They’re not indulgent or slack, nor are they leaders in backsliding, neglecting seclusion. They’re energetic and determined. They’re mindful, with situational awareness, immersion, and unified minds; wise, not stupid.”
ai-an5:167.13.1_0: “Sāriputta, those faithless people who went forth from the lay life to homelessness not out of faith but to earn a livelihood ... Leave them be.
ai-an5:167.14.1_0: But those gentlemen who went forth from the lay life to homelessness out of faith ... You should speak to them.
ai-an5:167.14.2_0: Sāriputta, I advised my spiritual companions,
ai-an5:167.14.3_0: You should instruct your spiritual companions!
ai-an5:167.14.4_0: Thinking: ‘I will draw my spiritual companions away from false teachings and ground them in true teachings.’
ai-an5:168.1.2_0: “Reverends, one who lacks ethics has destroyed a vital condition for right immersion.
ai-an5:168.1.3_0: When there is no right immersion, one who lacks right immersion has destroyed a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
ai-an5:168.1.4_0: When there is no true knowledge and vision, one who lacks true knowledge and vision has destroyed a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
ai-an5:168.1.5_0: When there is no disillusionment and dispassion, one who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an5:168.1.6_0: Suppose there was a tree that lacked branches and foliage.
ai-an5:168.1.7_0: Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would not grow to fullness.
ai-an5:168.1.8_0: In the same way, an unethical person, who lacks ethics, has destroyed a vital condition for right immersion.
ai-an5:168.1.9_0: When there is no right immersion, one who lacks right immersion has destroyed a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
ai-an5:168.1.10_0: When there is no true knowledge and vision, one who lacks true knowledge and vision has destroyed a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
ai-an5:168.1.11_0: When there is no disillusionment and dispassion, one who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an5:168.2.1_0: An ethical person, who has fulfilled ethics, has fulfilled a vital condition for right immersion.
ai-an5:168.2.2_0: When there is right immersion, one who has fulfilled right immersion has fulfilled a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
ai-an5:168.2.3_0: When there is true knowledge and vision, one who has fulfilled true knowledge and vision has fulfilled a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
ai-an5:168.2.4_0: When there is disillusionment and dispassion, one who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
ai-an5:168.2.5_0: Suppose there was a tree that was complete with branches and foliage.
ai-an5:168.2.5_1: Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would grow to fullness.
ai-an5:168.2.6_0: In the same way, an ethical person, who has fulfilled ethics, has fulfilled a vital condition for right immersion.
ai-an5:168.2.7_0: When there is right immersion, one who has fulfilled right immersion has fulfilled a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
ai-an5:168.2.8_0: When there is true knowledge and vision, one who has fulfilled true knowledge and vision has fulfilled a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
ai-an5:168.2.9_0: When there is disillusionment and dispassion, one who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.”
ai-an5:169.1.1_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went to Venerable Sāriputta,
ai-an5:169.1.1_1: and after going, he exchanged greetings with him.
ai-an5:169.1.2_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-an5:169.1.2_1: He bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
ai-an5:169.2.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, how are we to define a mendicant who is quick-witted when it comes to skillful teachings, who learns well, learns much, and does not forget what they’ve learned?”
ai-an5:169.2.4_0: “Well then, Reverend Sāriputta, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an5:169.3.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, it’s when a mendicant is skilled in the meaning and the teaching in the teaching. And they’re skilled in terms of the teaching.
ai-an5:169.3.2_0: That is how to define a mendicant who is quick-witted when it comes to skillful teachings, who learns well, learns much, and does not forget what they’ve learned.”
ai-an5:169.3.4_0: How well said this was by Venerable Ānanda!
ai-an5:169.3.5_0: And we will remember Venerable Ānanda as someone who has these five qualities:
ai-an5:169.3.6_0: ‘Reverend Ānanda is skilled in the meaning, skilled in the teaching, skilled in terminology, skilled in phrasing, and skilled in sequence.’”
ai-an5:170.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
ai-an5:170.1.2_0: Then venerable Bhaddaji went to venerable Ānanda,
ai-an5:170.1.2_1: and after approaching he exchanged greetings with venerable Ānanda,
ai-an5:170.1.3_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-an5:170.1.4_0: “Reverend Bhaddaji, what is the best sight, the best sound, the best happiness, the best perception, and the best state of existence?”
ai-an5:170.2.1_0: “Reverend, there is this Brahmā, the undefeated, the champion, the universal seer, the wielder of power. When you see Brahmā, that’s the best sight.
ai-an5:170.2.2_0: There are the gods called ‘of streaming radiance’, who are drenched and steeped in pleasure.
ai-an5:170.2.3_0: Every so often they feel inspired to exclaim:
ai-an5:170.2.5_0: When you hear that, it’s the best sound.
ai-an5:170.2.6_0: There are the gods called ‘replete with glory’.
ai-an5:170.2.7_0: Since they’re truly content, they experience pleasure. This is the best happiness.
ai-an5:170.2.8_0: There are the gods reborn in the dimension of nothingness. This is the best perception.
ai-an5:170.2.9_0: There are the gods reborn in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception. This is the best state of existence.”
ai-an5:170.2.10_0: “So, Venerable Bhaddaji, do you agree with what most people say about this?”
ai-an5:170.3.3_0: “Well then, Reverend Bhaddaji, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an5:170.4.1_0: “What you see when the defilements end in the present life is the best sight.
ai-an5:170.4.2_0: What you hear when the defilements end in the present life is the best sound.
ai-an5:170.4.3_0: The happiness you feel when the defilements end in the present life is the best happiness.
ai-an5:170.4.4_0: What you perceive when the defilements end in the present life is the best perception.
ai-an5:170.4.5_0: The state of existence in which the defilements end in the present life is the best state of existence.”
ai-an5:170.4.7_0: The second sub-chapter on property is finished.
ai-an5:171.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-an5:171.2.1_0: “A lay follower with five qualities is overcome by timidity.
ai-an5:171.2.3_0: They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, and use alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
ai-an5:171.2.4_0: A lay follower with these five qualities is overcome by timidity.
ai-an5:171.3.1_0: A lay follower with five qualities is self-assured.
ai-an5:171.3.3_0: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or use alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
ai-an5:171.3.4_0: A lay follower with these five qualities is self-assured.”
ai-an5:172.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a lay follower living at home with these five qualities is not self-assured.
ai-an5:172.1.3_0: They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, and use alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
ai-an5:172.1.4_0: A lay follower living at home with these five qualities is not self-assured.
ai-an5:172.2.1_0: A lay follower living at home with these five qualities is self-assured.
ai-an5:172.2.3_0: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or use alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
ai-an5:172.2.4_0: A lay follower living at home with these five qualities is self-assured.”
ai-an5:173.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a lay follower with five qualities is cast down to hell.
ai-an5:173.1.3_0: They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, and use alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
ai-an5:173.1.4_0: A lay follower with these five qualities is cast down to hell.
ai-an5:173.2.1_0: A lay follower with five qualities is raised up to heaven.
ai-an5:173.2.3_0: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or use alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
ai-an5:173.2.4_0: A lay follower with these five qualities is raised up to heaven.”
ai-an5:174.1.1_0: Then he went to the Buddha,
ai-an5:174.1.1_2: While sitting on one side the Fortunate One said this to the householder Anāthapiṇḍika:
ai-an5:174.2.1_0: “Householder, unless these five dangers and threats are given up, one is said to be unethical, and is reborn in hell.
ai-an5:174.2.3_0: Killing living creatures, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, and using alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
ai-an5:174.2.4_0: Once these five dangers and threats are given up, one is said to be unethical, and is reborn in hell.
ai-an5:174.3.1_0: Once these five dangers and threats are given up, one is said to be ethical, and is reborn in heaven.
ai-an5:174.3.3_0: Killing living creatures, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, and using alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
ai-an5:174.3.4_0: Once these five dangers and threats are given up, one is said to be ethical, and is reborn in heaven.
ai-an5:174.4.1_0: Anyone who kills living creatures creates dangers and threats both in the present life and in lives to come, and experiences mental pain and sadness. Anyone who refrains from killing living creatures creates no dangers and threats either in the present life or in lives to come, and doesn’t experience mental pain and sadness.
ai-an5:174.4.2_0: So that danger and threat is quelled for anyone who refrains from killing living creatures.
ai-an5:174.8.1_0: Anyone who uses alcoholic drinks that cause negligence creates dangers and threats both in the present life and in lives to come, and experiences mental pain and sadness. Anyone who refrains from using alcoholic drinks that cause negligence creates no dangers and threats either in the present life or in lives to come, and doesn’t experience mental pain and sadness.
ai-an5:174.8.2_0: So that danger and threat is quelled for anyone who refrains from using alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
ai-an5:174.10.1_0: Unless they give up these five threats,
ai-an5:174.10.3_0: when their body breaks up, that witless person
ai-an5:174.11.1_0: A person in the world doesn’t kill living creatures,
ai-an5:174.11.3_0: fine or coarse, beautiful or ugly:
ai-an5:174.11.4_0: does not go to another’s wife.
ai-an5:174.12.3_0: when their body breaks up, that wise person
ai-an5:174.12.4_0: is reborn in a good place.”
ai-an5:175.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a lay follower with five qualities is an outcaste, a stain, and a reject among lay followers.
ai-an5:175.1.5_0: They practice noisy, superstitious rites, believing in omens rather than deeds.
ai-an5:175.1.6_0: They seek outside of the Buddhist community for those worthy of religious donations.
ai-an5:175.1.8_0: A lay follower with these five qualities is an outcaste, a stain, and a reject among lay followers.
ai-an5:175.2.1_0: A lay follower with five qualities is a gem, a pink lotus, and a white lotus among lay followers.
ai-an5:175.2.5_0: They don’t practice noisy, superstititious rites, and believe in deeds rather than omens.
ai-an5:175.2.6_0: They don’t seek outside of the Buddhist community for those worthy of religious donations.
ai-an5:175.2.7_0: And they serve the Buddhist community first.
ai-an5:175.2.8_0: A lay follower with these five qualities is a gem, a pink lotus, and a white lotus among lay followers.”
ai-an5:176.1.1_0: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika, escorted by around five hundred lay followers, went to the Buddha.
ai-an5:176.1.1_2: While sitting on one side the Fortunate One said this to the householder Anāthapiṇḍika:
ai-an5:176.2.1_0: “Householders, you have supplied the mendicant Saṅgha with robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
ai-an5:176.2.2_0: But you should not be content with just this much.
ai-an5:176.2.3_0: ‘We have supplied the mendicant Saṅgha with robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.’
ai-an5:176.2.4_0: So you should train like this:
ai-an5:176.2.5_0: ‘How can we, from time to time, enter and dwell in the rapture of seclusion?’
ai-an5:176.3.1_0: When he said this, Venerable Sāriputta said to the Buddha:
ai-an5:176.3.3_0: How well said this was by the Buddha!
ai-an5:176.3.4_0: ‘Householders, you have supplied the mendicant Saṅgha with robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
ai-an5:176.3.5_0: But you should not be content with just this much.
ai-an5:176.3.6_0: We have supplied the mendicant Saṅgha with robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
ai-an5:176.3.7_0: So you should train like this:
ai-an5:176.3.8_0: “How can we, from time to time, enter and dwell in the rapture of seclusion?”
ai-an5:176.3.10_0: At a time when a noble disciple enters and dwells in the rapture of seclusion, five things aren’t present in him.
ai-an5:176.3.11_0: The pain and sadness connected with sensual pleasures.
ai-an5:176.3.12_0: The pleasure and happiness connected with sensual pleasures.
