ai-an5:176.3.13_0: The pain and sadness connected with the unskillful.
ai-an5:176.3.14_0: The pleasure and happiness connected with the unskillful.
ai-an5:176.3.15_0: The pain and sadness connected with the skillful.
ai-an5:176.3.16_0: At a time when a noble disciple enters and dwells in the rapture of seclusion, these five things aren’t present in him.”
ai-an5:176.4.2_0: At a time when a noble disciple enters and dwells in the rapture of seclusion, five things aren’t present in him.
ai-an5:176.4.3_0: The pain and sadness connected with sensual pleasures.
ai-an5:176.4.4_0: The pleasure and happiness connected with sensual pleasures.
ai-an5:176.4.5_0: The pain and sadness connected with the unskillful.
ai-an5:176.4.6_0: The pleasure and happiness connected with the unskillful.
ai-an5:176.4.7_0: The pain and sadness connected with the skillful.
ai-an5:176.4.8_0: At a time when a noble disciple enters and dwells in the rapture of seclusion, these five things aren’t present in him.”
ai-an5:176.4.9_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an5:177.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five trades have no duties.
ai-an5:177.1.3_0: Trade in weapons, living creatures, meat, intoxicants, and poisons.
ai-an5:177.1.4_0: A lay follower should not engage in these five trades.”
ai-an5:178.1.2_0: Have you ever seen or heard
ai-an5:178.1.3_0: of a person who has given up killing living creatures,
ai-an5:178.1.4_0: and then the kings have them arrested for that, and execute, imprison, or banish them, or do what the case requires?”
ai-an5:178.1.7_0: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.
ai-an5:178.1.8_0: of a person who has given up killing living creatures,
ai-an5:178.1.9_0: and then the kings have them arrested for that, and execute, imprison, or banish them, or do what the case requires.’
ai-an5:178.1.10_0: Rather, they split the bad deeds
ai-an5:178.1.11_0: ‘While under a man, a woman or a man.’
ai-an5:178.1.12_0: Then the kings have them arrested for killing, and execute, imprison, or banish them, or do what the case requires.
ai-an5:178.1.13_0: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”
ai-an5:178.2.2_0: Have you ever seen or heard
ai-an5:178.2.3_0: of a person who has given up stealing,
ai-an5:178.2.4_0: and then the kings have them arrested for that ...?”
ai-an5:178.2.7_0: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.
ai-an5:178.2.8_0: of a person who has given up stealing,
ai-an5:178.2.9_0: and then the kings have them arrested for that ...
ai-an5:178.2.10_0: Rather, they split the bad deeds
ai-an5:178.2.11_0: ‘This person took something from a village or wilderness, with the intention to commit theft.’
ai-an5:178.2.12_0: Then the kings have them arrested for stealing ...
ai-an5:178.2.13_0: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”
ai-an5:178.3.2_0: Have you ever seen or heard
ai-an5:178.3.3_0: of a person who has given up sexual misconduct,
ai-an5:178.3.4_0: and then the kings have them arrested for that ...?”
ai-an5:178.3.7_0: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.
ai-an5:178.3.8_0: of a person who has given up sexual misconduct,
ai-an5:178.3.9_0: and then the kings have them arrested for that ...
ai-an5:178.3.10_0: Rather, they split the bad deeds
ai-an5:178.3.11_0: ‘This person had sexual relations with women or maidens under someone else’s protection.’
ai-an5:178.3.12_0: Then the kings have them arrested for that ...
ai-an5:178.3.13_0: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”
ai-an5:178.4.2_0: Have you ever seen or heard
ai-an5:178.4.3_0: of a person who has given up lying,
ai-an5:178.4.4_0: and then the kings have them arrested for that ...?”
ai-an5:178.4.7_0: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.
ai-an5:178.4.8_0: of a person who has given up lying,
ai-an5:178.4.9_0: and then the kings have them arrested for that ...
ai-an5:178.4.10_0: Rather, they split the bad deeds
ai-an5:178.4.11_0: ‘This person has ruined a householder or householder’s child by lying.’
ai-an5:178.4.12_0: Then the kings have them arrested for that ...
ai-an5:178.4.13_0: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”
ai-an5:178.5.2_0: Have you ever seen or heard
ai-an5:178.5.3_0: ‘This person gives up alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
ai-an5:178.5.4_0: and then the kings have them arrested for that ...?”
ai-an5:178.5.7_0: I too have never seen or heard of such a thing.
ai-an5:178.5.8_0: ‘This person gives up alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
ai-an5:178.5.9_0: and then the kings have them arrested for that ...
ai-an5:178.5.10_0: Rather, they split the bad deeds
ai-an5:178.5.11_0: ‘While under the influence of alcoholic drinks that cause negligence, this person murdered a woman or a man.
ai-an5:178.5.12_0: Or they steal from sexual misconduct.
ai-an5:178.5.13_0: Or they had sexual relations with women or maidens under someone else’s protection.
ai-an5:178.5.14_0: Or they ruined a householder or householder’s child by lying.’
ai-an5:178.5.15_0: Then the kings have them arrested for being under the influence of alcoholic drinks that cause negligence, and execute, imprison, or banish them, or do what the case requires.
ai-an5:178.5.16_0: Have you ever seen or heard of such a case?”
ai-an5:179.1.1_0: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika, escorted by around five hundred lay followers, went to the Buddha.
ai-an5:179.1.2_0: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Sāriputta:
ai-an5:179.1.3_0: “You should know this, Sāriputta, about those white-clothed laypeople whose actions are restrained in the five precepts, and who get four blissful meditations in the present life belonging to the higher mind when they want, without trouble or difficulty. They may, if they wish, declare of themselves:
ai-an5:179.1.4_0: ‘I’ve finished with rebirth in hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. I’ve finished with all places of loss, bad places, the underworld. I am a stream-enterer! I’m not liable to be reborn in the underworld, and am bound for awakening.’
ai-an5:179.2.1_0: And what are the five precepts in which their actions are restrained?
ai-an5:179.2.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or use alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
ai-an5:179.2.3_0: These are the five precepts in which their actions are restrained.
ai-an5:179.3.1_0: And what are the four blissful meditations in the present life belonging to the higher mind that they get when they want, without trouble or difficulty?
ai-an5:179.3.2_0: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha:
ai-an5:179.3.3_0: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
ai-an5:179.3.4_0: This is the first blissful meditation in the present life belonging to the higher mind, which they achieve in order to purify the unpurified mind and cleanse the unclean mind.
ai-an5:179.4.1_0: Furthermore, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the teaching:
ai-an5:179.4.2_0: ‘The teaching is well explained by the Buddha—visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.’
ai-an5:179.4.3_0: This is the second blissful meditation ...
ai-an5:179.5.1_0: Furthermore, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Saṅgha:
ai-an5:179.5.2_0: ‘The Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples is practicing the way that’s good, direct, methodical, and proper. It consists of the four pairs, the eight individuals. This is the Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples that is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.’
ai-an5:179.5.3_0: This is the third blissful meditation ...
ai-an5:179.6.1_0: Furthermore, a noble disciple’s ethical conduct is loved by the noble ones, unbroken, impeccable, spotless, and unmarred, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to immersion.
ai-an5:179.6.2_0: This is the fourth blissful meditation in the present life belonging to the higher mind, which they achieve in order to purify the unpurified mind and cleanse the unclean mind.
ai-an5:179.6.3_0: These are the four blissful meditations in the present life belonging to the higher mind that they get when they want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-an5:179.7.1_0: You should know this, Sāriputta, about those white-clothed laypeople whose actions are restrained in the five precepts, and who get four blissful meditations in the present life belonging to the higher mind when they want, without trouble or difficulty. They may, if they wish, declare of themselves:
ai-an5:179.7.2_0: ‘I’ve finished with rebirth in hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. I’ve finished with all places of loss, bad places, the underworld. I am a stream-enterer! I’m not liable to be reborn in the underworld, and am bound for awakening.’

ai-an5:180.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants.
ai-an5:180.1.2_0: While traveling along a road the Buddha saw a large sal grove in a certain spot.
ai-an5:180.1.3_0: Having left the road, he went to the sal grove,
ai-an5:180.1.3_1: After going, she smiled the rice in a certain spot.

ai-an5:180.2.3_0: Isn’t smiling with the Realized Ones.”

ai-an5:180.2.5_0: “What is the cause, what is the reason why the Buddha smiled?

ai-an5:180.3.1_0: “Once upon a time, Ānanda, there was a city in this spot that was successful and prosperous and full of people.
ai-an5:180.3.2_0: But Ānanda the Buddha Kassapa lived supported by the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.
ai-an5:180.3.3_0: He had a lay follower called Gavesī who had not fulfilled all the precepts.
ai-an5:180.3.4_0: And the five hundred lay followers who were taught and advised by Gavesī also had not fulfilled all the precepts.
ai-an5:180.3.6_0: ‘I’m the helper, leader, and adviser of these five hundred lay followers, yet neither I nor they have fulfilled the precepts.
ai-an5:180.3.7_0: There is nothing equal to him.
ai-an5:180.4.1_0: Then Gavesī went to those five hundred lay followers
ai-an5:180.4.1_1: and after going, he said this to the group-of-five hundred lay followers:
ai-an5:180.4.2_0: ‘From this day forth may the venerables remember me as one who has fulfilled the precepts.’
ai-an5:180.4.3_0: Then those five hundred lay followers thought:
ai-an5:180.4.4_0: ‘Venerable Gavesī is our helper, leader, and adviser,
ai-an5:180.4.5_0: and now he will fulfill the precepts.
ai-an5:180.4.6_0: Why don’t we do the same?’

ai-an5:180.4.7_1: and after approaching, I said this to the lay follower Gavesī:
ai-an5:180.4.8_0: ‘From this day forth may Venerable Gavesī remember these five hundred lay followers as having fulfilled the precepts.’

ai-an5:180.7.1_0: Then Gavesī went to the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.
ai-an5:180.7.1_1: and after approaching, he said this to the Fortunate One Kassapa:
ai-an5:180.7.2_0: ‘Sir, may I receive the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha’s presence?’
ai-an5:180.7.3_0: And the lay follower Gavesī received the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha Kassapa’s presence.
ai-an5:180.7.4_0: Not long after his ordination, the mendicant Gavesī, living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute, realized the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. He lived having achieved with his own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-an5:180.7.5_0: He understood: ‘Rebirth is ended; the spiritual journey has been completed; what had to be done has been done; there is no return to any state of existence.’
ai-an5:180.7.6_0: And the mendicant Gavesī became one of the perfected.
ai-an5:180.8.1_0: Then those five hundred lay followers thought:
ai-an5:180.8.2_0: ‘Venerable Gavesī is our helper, leader, and adviser,
ai-an5:180.8.3_0: Soon I’ve shaved off my hair and beard, dressed in ocher robes, and went forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-an5:180.8.4_0: Why don’t we do the same?’
ai-an5:180.8.5_0: Then those five hundred lay followers went to the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.
ai-an5:180.8.5_1: and after approaching, they said this to the Fortunate One Kassapa:
ai-an5:180.8.6_0: ‘Sir, we wish to receive the going forth in your presence; we wish to receive the full ordination.’
ai-an5:180.8.7_0: Those five hundred lay followers of Buddha Kassapa received the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha Kassapa’s presence.
ai-an5:180.9.2_0: ‘I get the supreme bliss of freedom whenever I want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-an5:180.9.3_0: Oh, may these five hundred mendicants do the same!’

They lived having achieved with their own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.

ai-an5:180.10.1_0: And so, Ānanda, those five hundred mendicants headed by Gavesī, trying to go higher and higher, better and better, realized the supreme bliss of freedom.
ai-an5:180.10.2_0: So you should train like this:
ai-an5:180.10.3_0: ‘Trying to go higher and higher, better and better, we will realize the supreme bliss of freedom.’

ai-an5:181.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five kinds of wilderness dwellers.
ai-an5:181.1.3_0: A person may be wilderness dweller because of stupidity and folly. Or because of wicked desires, being naturally full of desires. Or because of madness and mental disorder. Or because it is praised by the Buddhas and their disciples. Or for the sake of having few wishes, for the sake of contentment, self-effacement, seclusion, and simplicity.
ai-an5:181.1.4_0: These are the five kinds of wilderness dwellers.
ai-an5:181.1.5_0: But the person who dwells in the wilderness for the sake of having few wishes is the foremost, best, chief, highest, and finest of the five.
ai-an5:181.2.1_0: From a cow comes milk, from milk comes curds, from curds come butter, from butter comes ghee, and from ghee comes cream of ghee. And the cream of ghee is said to be the best of these.
ai-an5:181.2.2_0: In the same way, the person who dwells in the wilderness for the sake of having few wishes is the foremost, best, chief, highest, and finest of the five.”
ai-an5:182.1.1_0: “Mendicants there are these five kinds of people who wear rag robes.
ai-an5:182.1.3_0: A person may wear rag-robes are rag-robe wearers ...
ai-an5:182.1.4_0: These are the five kinds of people who wear rag robes.”
ai-an5:183.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five kinds of people who dwell at the root of a tree.
ai-an5:183.1.3_0: A person may dwell in a tree because of stupidity and folly. ...
ai-an5:183.1.4_0: These are the five kinds of tree.”
ai-an5:184.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five kinds of people who dwell in a charnel ground.
ai-an5:184.1.3_0: A person may dwell in a charnel ground because of stupidity ... bad desires ... madness ... because it is praised by the Buddhas ... or for the sake of having few wishes ...
ai-an5:184.1.4_0: These are the five kinds of people.”
ai-an5:185.1.1_0: “There are these five kinds of people who dwell in the open air. ...”
ai-an5:186.1.1_0: “There are these five kinds of people who never lie down. ...”
ai-an5:186.1.2_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an5:187.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five kinds of people who sleep in accordance with the rule. ...”
ai-an5:188.1.1_0: “There are these five kinds of people who eat in one sitting per day. ...”
ai-an5:189.1.1_0: “There are these five kinds of later-food-eater. ...”
ai-an5:190.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five kinds of people who eat only from the almsbowl.
ai-an5:190.1.3_0: A person who has wicked desires, being naturally full of desires ...
ai-an5:190.1.4_0: These are the five kinds of people who eat only from the almsbowl.
ai-an5:190.1.5_0: But the person who eats only from the almsbowl for the sake of having few wishes is the foremost, best, chief, highest, and finest of the five.
ai-an5:190.2.1_0: From a cow comes milk, from milk comes curds, from curds come butter, from butter comes ghee, and from ghee comes cream of ghee. And the cream of ghee is said to be the best of these.
ai-an5:190.2.2_0: In the same way, the person who eats only from the almsbowl for the sake of having few wishes is the foremost, best, chief, highest, and finest of the five.”
ai-an5:190.2.4_0: The fourth sub-chapter on wilderness is finished.
