ai-an5:191.1.1_0: “Mendicants, these five traditions of the brahmins are seen these days among dogs, but not among brahmins.
ai-an5:191.1.3_0: In the past brahmins had sex only with brahmin women, not with men.
ai-an5:191.1.4_0: These days brahmins have sex with both brahmin women and others.
ai-an5:191.1.5_0: But these days dogs have sex only with female dogs, not with other species.
ai-an5:191.1.6_0: This is the first tradition of the brahmins seen these days among dogs, but not among brahmins.
ai-an5:191.2.1_0: In the past brahmins had sex only with brahmin women in the fertile half of the month that starts with menstruation, not at other times.
ai-an5:191.2.2_0: These days brahmins have sex with brahmin women and others.
ai-an5:191.2.3_0: But these days dogs have sex only with female dogs when they are in heat, not at other times.
ai-an5:191.2.4_0: This is the second tradition of the brahmins seen these days among dogs, but not among brahmins.
ai-an5:191.3.1_0: In the past brahmins neither buy nor sell brahmin women. They live together whether they’re attracted to each other and want their family line to continue.
ai-an5:191.3.2_0: These days brahmins both buy and sell brahmin women. They live together whether they love each other or not and they want their family line to continue.
ai-an5:191.3.3_0: But these days dogs neither buy nor sell female dogs. They live together because they’re attracted to each other and want their family line to continue.
ai-an5:191.3.4_0: This is the third tradition of the brahmins seen these days among dogs, but not among brahmins.
ai-an5:191.4.1_0: In the past brahmins did not store up money, grain, silver, or gold.
ai-an5:191.4.2_0: These days brahmins do store up money, grain, silver, and gold.
ai-an5:191.4.3_0: But these days dogs store up money, grain, silver, and gold.
ai-an5:191.4.4_0: This is the fourth tradition of the brahmins seen these days among dogs, but not among brahmins.
ai-an5:191.5.1_0: In the past brahmins went looking for almsfood for dinner in the evening, and for breakfast in the morning.
ai-an5:191.5.2_0: These days brahmins eat as much as they like until their bellies are full, and then left.
ai-an5:191.5.3_0: But these days dogs go looking for dinner in the evening, and for breakfast in the morning.
ai-an5:191.5.4_0: This is the fifth tradition of the brahmins seen these days among dogs, but not among brahmins.
ai-an5:191.5.5_0: These five traditions of the brahmins are seen these days among dogs, but not among brahmins.”
ai-an5:192.1.1_0: Then Doṇa the brahmin went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
ai-an5:192.1.2_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-an5:192.1.2_1: Doṇa the brahmin said to the Buddha:
ai-an5:192.2.2_0: that you don’t bow down to old brahmins, stand up for them, or offer them a seat.
ai-an5:192.2.3_0: And this is indeed the case,
ai-an5:192.2.4_0: for Master Gotama does not bow to old brahmins, elderly and senior, who are advanced in years and have reached the final stage of life; nor does he rise in their presence or offer them a seat.
ai-an5:192.2.6_0: “Doṇa, do you too claim to be a brahmin?”
ai-an5:192.2.7_0: “Master Gotama, if anyone should be rightly called
ai-an5:192.2.9_0: For I am well born on both my mother’s and father’s side, of pure descent, irrefutable and impeccable in questions of ancestry back to the seventh paternal generation. I recite and remember the hymns, and have mastered the three Vedas, together with their vocabularies, ritual, phonology and etymology, and the testament as fifth. I know philology and grammar, and am well versed in cosmology and the marks of a great man.’
ai-an5:192.2.10_0: I’m well born on both his mother’s and father’s sides,
ai-an5:192.2.11_0: For I am well born on both my mother’s and father’s side, of pure descent, irrefutable and impeccable in questions of ancestry back to the seventh paternal generation. I recite and remember the hymns, and have mastered the three Vedas, together with their vocabularies, ritual, phonology and etymology, and the testament as fifth. I know philology and grammar, and am well versed in cosmology and the marks of a great man.”
ai-an5:192.3.1_0: “Doṇa, the ancient brahmin hermits were Aṭṭhaka, Vāmaka, Vāmadeva, Vessāmitta, Yamadaggi, Aṅgīrasa, Bhāradvāja, Vāseṭṭha, Kassapa, and Bhagu. They were the authors and propagators of the hymns, whose hymnal was sung and propagated and compiled in ancient times. These days, brahmins continue to sing and chant it. They continue chanting what was chanted, reciting what was recited, and teaching what was taught.
ai-an5:192.3.2_0: Those seers described five kinds of brahmins.
ai-an5:192.3.3_0: Devadaha, Devadaha, and Brahmadeva’s wife, the fifth teeth, and the fifth.
ai-an5:192.3.4_0: Which one of these are you, Doṇa?”
ai-an5:192.4.1_0: “Master Gotama, we don’t know about these five kinds of brahmins. We just know the word ‘brahmin’.
ai-an5:192.4.2_0: Master Gotama, please teach me this matter so I can learn about these five brahmins.”
ai-an5:192.4.3_0: “Well then, brahmin, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
ai-an5:192.5.1_0: “Doṇa, how is a brahmin equal to Brahmā?
ai-an5:192.5.2_0: It’s when a brahmin is well born on both the mother’s and the father’s sides ...
ai-an5:192.5.3_0: For I am well born on both my mother’s and father’s side, of pure descent, irrefutable and impeccable in questions of ancestry back to the seventh paternal generation.
ai-an5:192.5.4_0: For forty-eight years he leads the virginal spiritual life studying the hymns.
ai-an5:192.5.5_0: Then he seeks a fee for his teacher, but only by legitimate means, not illegitimate.
ai-an5:192.6.1_0: In this context, Doṇa, what is legitimate?
ai-an5:192.6.2_0: Not by farming, trade, raising cattle, archery, government service, or one of the professions, but solely by living on alms, not scorning the alms bowl.
ai-an5:192.6.3_0: Having offered the fee to his teacher, he shaves off his hair and beard, dresses in ocher robes, and goes forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-an5:192.6.4_0: In this way they meditate spreading a heart full of love to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth. In the same way above, below, across, everywhere, all around, they spread a heart full of love to the whole world—abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.
ai-an5:192.6.5_0: They meditate spreading a heart full of compassion ...
ai-an5:192.6.8_0: Having developed these four Brahmā meditations, when the body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a Brahmā realm.
ai-an5:192.6.9_0: That’s how a brahmin is equal to Brahmā.
ai-an5:192.7.1_0: And how is a brahmin equal to a god?
ai-an5:192.7.2_0: It’s when a brahmin is well born on both the mother’s and the father’s sides ...
ai-an5:192.7.3_0: For I am well born on both my mother’s and father’s side, of pure descent, irrefutable and impeccable in questions of ancestry back to the seventh paternal generation.
ai-an5:192.7.4_0: For forty-eight years he leads the virginal spiritual life studying the hymns.
ai-an5:192.7.5_0: Then he seeks a fee for his teacher, but only by legitimate means, not illegitimate.
ai-an5:192.7.6_0: In this context, Doṇa, what is legitimate?
ai-an5:192.7.7_0: Not by farming, trade, raising cattle, archery, government service, or one of the professions, but solely by living on alms, not scorning the alms bowl.
ai-an5:192.7.8_0: Having offered the fee to his teacher, he seeks a wife, but only by legitimate means, not illegitimate.
ai-an5:192.8.1_0: In this context, Doṇa, what is legitimate?
ai-an5:192.8.2_0: Not by buying or selling, he only accepts a brahmin woman by the pouring of water.
ai-an5:192.8.3_0: He has sex only with a brahmin woman. He does not have sex with a woman from a caste of aristocrats, merchants, workers, outcastes, hunters, bamboo workers, chariot-makers, or waste-collectors. Nor does he have sex with women who are pregnant, breastfeeding, or outside the fertile half of the month that starts with menstruation.
ai-an5:192.8.4_0: And why does the brahmin not have sex with a pregnant woman?
ai-an5:192.8.5_0: If a brahmin had sex with a pregnant woman, the boy or girl would be born in too much filth.
ai-an5:192.8.6_0: That’s why the brahmin doesn’t have sex with a pregnant woman.
ai-an5:192.8.7_0: And why does the brahmin not have sex with a breastfeeding woman?
ai-an5:192.8.8_0: If a brahmin had sex with a breastfeeding woman or man called Soṇa.
ai-an5:192.8.9_0: That’s why the brahmin doesn’t have sex with a breastfeeding woman.
ai-an5:192.8.10_0: And why does the brahmin not have sex outside the fertile half of the month that starts with menstruation? Because his brahmin wife is not there for sensual pleasure, fun, and enjoyment, but only for procreation.
ai-an5:192.8.11_0: Having ensured his progeny through sex, he shaves off his hair and beard, dresses in ocher robes, and goes forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-an5:192.8.12_0: Once I had gone forth, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, I entered and remained in the first absorption ... second absorption ... third absorption.
ai-an5:192.8.13_0: Having developed these four absorptions, when the body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
ai-an5:192.8.14_0: That’s how a brahmin is equal to god.
ai-an5:192.9.1_0: And how does a brahmin toe the line?
ai-an5:192.9.2_0: It’s when a brahmin is well born on both the mother’s and the father’s sides ...
ai-an5:192.9.3_0: For I am well born on both my mother’s and father’s side, of pure descent, irrefutable and impeccable in questions of ancestry back to the seventh paternal generation.
ai-an5:192.9.4_0: For forty-eight years he leads the virginal spiritual life studying the hymns.
ai-an5:192.9.5_0: Then he seeks a fee for his teacher, but only by legitimate means, not illegitimate.
ai-an5:192.9.6_0: In this context, Doṇa, what is legitimate?
ai-an5:192.9.7_0: Not by farming, trade, raising cattle, archery, government service, or one of the professions, but solely by living on alms, not scorning the alms bowl.
ai-an5:192.9.8_0: Having offered the fee to his teacher, he seeks a wife, but only by legitimate means, not illegitimate.
ai-an5:192.10.1_0: In this context, Doṇa, what is legitimate?
ai-an5:192.10.2_0: Not by buying or selling, he only accepts a brahmin woman by the pouring of water.
ai-an5:192.10.3_0: He has sex only with a brahmin woman. He does not have sex with a woman from a caste of aristocrats, merchants, workers, outcastes, hunters, bamboo workers, chariot-makers, or waste-collectors. Nor does he have sex with women who are pregnant, breastfeeding, or outside the fertile half of the month that starts with menstruation.
ai-an5:192.10.4_0: And why does the brahmin not have sex with a pregnant woman?
ai-an5:192.10.5_0: If a brahmin had sex with a pregnant woman, the boy or girl would be born in too much filth.
ai-an5:192.10.6_0: That’s why the brahmin doesn’t have sex with a pregnant woman.
ai-an5:192.10.7_0: And why does the brahmin not have sex with a breastfeeding woman?
ai-an5:192.10.8_0: If a brahmin had sex with a breastfeeding woman or man called Soṇa.
ai-an5:192.10.9_0: That’s why the brahmin doesn’t have sex with a breastfeeding woman.
ai-an5:192.10.10_0: And why does the brahmin not have sex outside the fertile half of the month that starts with menstruation? Because his brahmin wife is not there for sensual pleasure, fun, and enjoyment, but only for procreation.
ai-an5:192.10.11_0: Having ensured his progeny through sex, his child makes him happy. Because of this attachment he stays in his family property, and does not go forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-an5:192.10.12_0: As far as the line of the ancient brahmins extends, he crosses over it.
ai-an5:192.10.13_0: That’s why he’s called a brahmin who crosses the line.
ai-an5:192.10.14_0: That’s how a brahmin toes the line.
ai-an5:192.11.1_0: And how does a brahmin cross the line?
ai-an5:192.11.2_0: It’s when a brahmin is well born on both the mother’s and the father’s sides ...
ai-an5:192.11.3_0: For I am well born on both my mother’s and father’s side, of pure descent, irrefutable and impeccable in questions of ancestry back to the seventh paternal generation.
ai-an5:192.11.4_0: For forty-eight years he leads the virginal spiritual life studying the hymns.
ai-an5:192.11.5_0: Then he seeks a fee for his teacher, but only by legitimate means, not illegitimate.
ai-an5:192.12.1_0: In this context, Doṇa, what is legitimate?
ai-an5:192.12.2_0: Not by farming, trade, raising cattle, archery, government service, or one of the professions, but solely by living on alms, not scorning the alms bowl.
ai-an5:192.12.3_0: Having offered the fee to his teacher, he seeks a boy who seeks a wife, even though he wants to converse with him, for the brahmin who is unobstructed.
ai-an5:192.12.4_0: He has sex with a brahmin woman, as well as with a woman from a caste of aristocrats, merchants, workers, outcastes, hunters, bamboo workers, chariot-makers, or waste-collectors. And he has sex with women who are pregnant, breastfeeding, or outside the fertile half of the month that starts with menstruation.
ai-an5:192.12.5_0: And why does the brahmin women have sex outside the fertile half of the month that starts with menstruation? Because his brahmin wife is proclamation for sensual pleasures.
ai-an5:192.12.6_0: As far as the line of the ancient brahmins extends, he crosses over it.
ai-an5:192.12.7_0: That’s why he’s called a brahmin who crosses the line.
ai-an5:192.12.8_0: That’s how a brahmin crosses the line.
ai-an5:192.13.1_0: And how is a brahmin a brahmin outcaste?
ai-an5:192.13.2_0: It’s when a brahmin is well born on both the mother’s and the father’s sides ...
ai-an5:192.13.3_0: For I am well born on both my mother’s and father’s side, of pure descent, irrefutable and impeccable in questions of ancestry back to the seventh paternal generation.
ai-an5:192.13.4_0: For forty-eight years he leads the virginal spiritual life studying the hymns.
ai-an5:192.13.5_0: Then he seeks a fee for his teacher, but only by legitimate means, not illegitimate.
ai-an5:192.13.6_0: By farming, trade, raising cattle, archery, government service, or one of the professions, not solely by living on alms, not scorning the alms bowl.
ai-an5:192.14.1_0: Having offered the fee to his teacher, he seeks a boy who seeks a wife, even though he wants to converse with him, for the brahmin who is unobstructed.
ai-an5:192.14.2_0: He has sex with a brahmin woman, as well as with a woman from a caste of aristocrats, merchants, workers, outcastes, hunters, bamboo workers, chariot-makers, or waste-collectors. And he has sex with women who are pregnant, breastfeeding, or outside the fertile half of the month that starts with menstruation.
ai-an5:192.14.3_0: And why does the brahmin women have sex outside the fertile half of the month that starts with menstruation? Because his brahmin wife is proclamation for sensual pleasures.
ai-an5:192.14.4_0: He earns a living by any kind of work.
ai-an5:192.14.6_0: ‘My good man, why is it that you claim to be a brahmin, but you earn a living by any kind of work?’
ai-an5:192.14.8_0: ‘It’s like a fire that burns both pure and filthy substances, but doesn’t become corrupted by them.
ai-an5:192.14.9_0: In the same way, my good man, if a brahmin earns a living by any kind of work, he is not corrupted by that.’
ai-an5:192.14.10_0: A brahmin is called a brahmin outcaste because he earns a living by any kind of work.
ai-an5:192.14.11_0: That’s how a brahmin is an outcaste.
ai-an5:192.15.1_0: There are those ancient brahmin hermits who say:
ai-an5:192.15.2_0: Those hermits described five kinds of brahmins.
ai-an5:192.15.3_0: Devadaha, Devadaha, and Brahmadeva’s wife, the fifth teeth, and the fifth.
ai-an5:192.15.4_0: Which one of these are you, Doṇa?”
ai-an5:192.16.1_0: “This being so, Master Gotama, I don’t even qualify as a brahmin outcaste.
ai-an5:192.16.2_1: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-an5:193.1.1_0: Then Saṅgārava the brahmin went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
ai-an5:193.1.2_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-an5:193.1.3_0: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why sometimes even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced?
ai-an5:193.1.4_0: And why is it that sometimes even hymns that are long-unpracticed spring to mind, let alone those that are practiced?”
ai-an5:193.2.1_0: “Brahmin, there’s a time when your heart is overcome and mired in sensual desire and you don’t truly understand the escape from sensual desire that has arisen. At that time you don’t truly know or see your own good, the good of another, or the good of both. Even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.2.2_0: Suppose there was a bowl of water that was mixed with dye such as red lac, turmeric, indigo, or rose madder.
ai-an5:193.2.3_0: Even a person with good eyesight checking their own reflection wouldn’t truly know it or see it.
ai-an5:193.2.4_0: In the same way, when your heart is overcome and mired in sensual desire ... Even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.2.4_1: At that time they don’t truly understand the benefit of both. Even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.3.1_0: Furthermore, when your heart is overcome and mired in ill will ... Even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.3.1_1: At that time they don’t truly understand the benefit of both. Even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.3.2_0: Suppose there was a bowl of water that’s heated by a fire, boiling and bubbling.
ai-an5:193.3.3_0: Even a person with good eyesight checking their own reflection wouldn’t truly know it or see it.
ai-an5:193.3.4_0: In the same way, when your heart is overcome and mired in ill will ... Even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.3.4_1: At that time they don’t truly understand the benefit of both. Even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.4.1_0: Furthermore, when your heart is overcome and mired in dullness and drowsiness ... Even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.4.1_1: At that time they don’t truly understand the benefit of both. Even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.4.2_0: Suppose there was a bowl of water overgrown with moss and aquatic plants.
ai-an5:193.4.3_0: Even a person with good eyesight checking their own reflection wouldn’t truly know it or see it.
ai-an5:193.4.4_0: In the same way, when your heart is overcome and mired in dullness and drowsiness ... Even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.4.4_1: At that time they don’t truly understand the benefit of both. Even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.5.1_0: Furthermore, when your heart is overcome and mired in restlessness and remorse ... Even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.5.1_1: At that time they don’t truly understand the benefit of both. Even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.5.2_0: Suppose there was a bowl of water stirred by the wind, churning, swirling, and rippling.
ai-an5:193.5.3_0: Even a person with good eyesight checking their own reflection wouldn’t truly know it or see it.
ai-an5:193.5.4_0: In the same way, when your heart is overcome and mired in restlessness and remorse ... Even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.5.4_1: At that time they don’t truly understand the benefit of both. Even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.6.1_0: Furthermore, when your heart is overcome and mired in doubt ... Even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.6.1_1: At that time they don’t truly understand the benefit of both. Even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.6.2_0: Suppose there was a bowl of water that was cloudy, murky, and muddy, hidden in the darkness.
ai-an5:193.6.3_0: Even a person with good eyesight checking their own reflection wouldn’t truly know it or see it.
ai-an5:193.6.4_0: In the same way, there’s a time when your heart is overcome and mired in doubt and you don’t truly understand the escape from doubt that has arisen. At that time you don’t truly know or see your own good, the good of another, or the good of both.
ai-an5:193.6.4_1: At that time they don’t truly understand the benefit of both. Even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.7.1_0: There’s a time when your heart is not overcome and mired in sensual desire and you truly understand the escape from sensual desire that has arisen. At that time you truly know and see your own good, the good of another, and the good of both. Even hymns that are long-unpracticed spring to mind, let alone those that are practiced.
ai-an5:193.7.2_0: Suppose there was a bowl of water that’s not yellow, red, wither, magenta, playing in pies, or rose madder.
ai-an5:193.7.3_0: A person with good eyesight checking their own reflection would truly know it and see it.
ai-an5:193.7.4_0: In the same way, when your heart is not overcome and mired in sensual desire ... Even hymns that are long-unpracticed spring to mind, let alone those that are practiced.
ai-an5:193.8.1_0: Furthermore, when your heart is not overcome and mired in ill will ... Even hymns that are long-unpracticed spring to mind, let alone those that are practiced.
ai-an5:193.8.2_0: Suppose there was a bowl of water that’s not heated by a fire, boiling and bubbling.
ai-an5:193.8.3_0: A person with good eyesight checking their own reflection would truly know it and see it.
ai-an5:193.8.4_0: In the same way, when your heart is not overcome and mired in ill will ... Even hymns that are long-unpracticed spring to mind, let alone those that are practiced.
ai-an5:193.9.1_0: Furthermore, when your heart is not overcome and mired in dullness and drowsiness ... Even hymns that are long-unpracticed spring to mind, let alone those that are practiced.
ai-an5:193.9.2_0: Suppose there is a bowl of water that is not overgrown with moss and aquatic plants.
ai-an5:193.9.3_0: A person with good eyesight checking their own reflection would truly know it and see it.
ai-an5:193.9.4_0: In the same way, when your heart is not overcome and mired in dullness and drowsiness ... Even hymns that are long-unpracticed spring to mind, let alone those that are practiced.
ai-an5:193.10.1_0: Furthermore, when your heart is not overcome and mired in restlessness and remorse ... Even hymns that are long-unpracticed spring to mind, let alone those that are practiced.
ai-an5:193.10.2_0: Suppose there is a bowl of water that is not scared, drunk, chewed, and clubbled.
ai-an5:193.10.3_0: A person with good eyesight checking their own reflection would truly know it and see it.
ai-an5:193.10.4_0: In the same way, when your heart is not overcome and mired in restlessness and remorse ... Even hymns that are long-unpracticed spring to mind, let alone those that are practiced.
ai-an5:193.11.1_0: Furthermore, when your heart is not overcome and mired in doubt ... Even hymns that are long-unpracticed spring to mind, let alone those that are practiced.
ai-an5:193.11.2_0: Suppose there was a bowl of water that’s transparent, clear, and unclouded, brought into the light.
ai-an5:193.11.3_0: A person with good eyesight checking their own reflection would truly know it and see it.
ai-an5:193.11.4_0: In the same way, there’s a time when your heart is not overcome and mired in doubt and you truly understand the escape from doubt that has arisen. At that time you truly know and see your own good, the good of another, and the good of both.
ai-an5:193.11.4_1: At that time they truly understand the teachings and practiced.
ai-an5:193.12.1_0: This is the cause, brahmin, this is the reason why sometimes even hymns that are long-practiced don’t spring to mind, let alone those that are not practiced.
ai-an5:193.12.2_0: And, brahmin, this is the cause, this is the reason why sometimes even hymns that are long-practiced spring to mind, let alone those that are practiced.”
ai-an5:193.13.1_1: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-an5:194.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
ai-an5:194.1.2_0: Now at that time the brahmin Kāraṇapālī was working for the Licchavis.
ai-an5:194.1.3_0: He saw the brahmin Piṅgiyānī coming off in the distance
ai-an5:194.2.1_0: “So, Piṅgiyānī, where are you coming from in the middle of the day?”
ai-an5:194.2.2_0: “I’m coming, my good man, from the presence of the ascetic Gotama.”
ai-an5:194.2.3_0: “What do you think of the ascetic Gotama’s lucidity of wisdom? Do you think he’s astute?”
ai-an5:194.2.4_0: “Who am I to know who the ascetic Gotama’s lucidity of wisdom?
ai-an5:194.2.5_0: You’d really have to be on the same level to judge his lucidity of wisdom.”
ai-an5:194.2.6_0: “Master Piṅgiyānī praises the ascetic Gotama with magnificent praise indeed.”
ai-an5:194.2.7_0: “Who am I to praise the ascetic Gotama?
ai-an5:194.2.8_0: He is praised by the praised as the first among gods and humans.”
ai-an5:194.2.9_0: “But for what reason are you so devoted to the ascetic Gotama?”
ai-an5:194.3.1_0: “Suppose a person was completely satisfied by the best tasting food. They wouldn’t be attracted to anything that tasted inferior.
ai-an5:194.3.2_0: In the same way, when Master Gotama hears the teaching they’ve heard
ai-an5:194.3.3_0: whatever it may be, whether statements, songs, discussions, or amazing stories—
ai-an5:194.3.4_0: then you’re not attracted to the doctrines of the various ascetics and brahmins.
ai-an5:194.4.1_0: Suppose a person who was weak with hunger was to obtain a honey-cake.
ai-an5:194.4.2_0: Wherever they taste it, they would enjoy a sweet, delicious flavor.
ai-an5:194.4.3_0: In the same way, when Master Gotama hears the teaching they’ve heard
ai-an5:194.4.4_0: whatever it may be, whether statements, songs, discussions, or amazing stories—
ai-an5:194.4.5_0: then you get a sense of uplift, a confidence of the heart.
ai-an5:194.5.1_0: Suppose a person were to obtain a piece of sandalwood,
ai-an5:194.5.4_0: whether at the root, the middle, or the top—
ai-an5:194.5.6_0: In the same way, when Master Gotama hears the teaching they’ve heard
ai-an5:194.5.7_0: whatever it may be, whether statements, songs, discussions, or amazing stories—
ai-an5:194.6.1_0: Suppose there was a person who was sick, suffering, gravely ill.
ai-an5:194.6.2_0: A good doctor would cure them on the spot.
ai-an5:194.6.3_0: In the same way, when Master Gotama hears the teaching they’ve heard
ai-an5:194.6.4_0: whatever it may be, whether statements, songs, discussions, or amazing stories—
ai-an5:194.6.5_0: then you make an end of sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.
ai-an5:194.7.1_0: Suppose there was a lotus pond with clear, sweet, cool water, clean, with smooth banks, delightful.
ai-an5:194.7.2_0: Then along comes a person struggling in the oppressive heat, weary, thirsty, and parched.
ai-an5:194.7.3_0: They’d plunge into the lotus pond to bathe and drink. And all their stress, weariness, and heat exhaustion would die down.
ai-an5:194.7.4_0: In the same way, when Master Gotama hears the teaching they’ve heard
ai-an5:194.7.5_0: whatever it may be, whether statements, songs, discussions, or amazing stories—
ai-an5:194.7.6_0: then all your stress, weariness, and exhaustion die down.”
ai-an5:194.8.1_0: When this was said, the brahmin Kāraṇapālī got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, knelt on his right knee, raised his joined palms toward the Buddha, and expressed this heartfelt sentiment three times:
ai-an5:194.9.1_0: “Reverence to that Fortunate One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha
ai-an5:194.10.1_0: Reverence to him, the Fortunate One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha
ai-an5:194.11.1_0: Homage to that Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha!
ai-an5:194.12.2_0: Just as one might set upright what had been overturned, or reveal what was hidden, or show the way to one who was lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness
ai-an5:194.12.2_1: so that one with eyes might see what’s there—
ai-an5:194.12.2_2: just so has the Dhamma been explained by the Piṅgiyānī in many ways.
ai-an5:194.12.3_0: I go for refuge to Master Gotama, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.
ai-an5:194.12.4_0: From this day forth, may Master Piṅgiyānī remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-an5:195.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
ai-an5:195.1.2_0: Now at that time around five hundred Licchavis were visiting the Buddha.
ai-an5:195.1.3_0: Some of the Licchavis were in blue, of blue color, clad in blue, adorned with blue. And some were similarly colored in yellow, red, or white.
ai-an5:195.1.4_0: But the Buddha outshone them all in beauty and glory.
ai-an5:195.2.1_0: Then the brahmin Piṅgīyānī got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his joined palms toward the Buddha, and said,
ai-an5:195.2.2_0: “I feel inspired to speak, Blessed One! I feel inspired to speak, Holy One!”
ai-an5:195.2.3_0: “Then speak as you feel inspired,” said the Buddha.
ai-an5:195.2.4_0: Then Piṅgiyānī extolled the Buddha in his presence with fitting verses:
ai-an5:195.3.4_0: bright as the sun in the sky!”
ai-an5:195.4.1_0: Then those Licchavis clothed Piṅgiyānī with five hundred upper robes.
ai-an5:195.4.2_0: And Piṅgiyānī clothed the Buddha with them.
ai-an5:195.5.1_0: Then the Buddha said to the Licchavis,
ai-an5:195.5.2_0: “Licchavis, the appearance of five treasures is rare in the world.
ai-an5:195.5.4_0: A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.
ai-an5:195.5.5_0: A person who explains the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One.
ai-an5:195.5.6_0: A person who understands the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One.
ai-an5:195.5.7_0: A person who practices in line with the teaching.
ai-an5:195.5.8_0: A person who is grateful and thankful.
ai-an5:195.5.9_0: The appearance of these five treasures is rare in the world.”
ai-an5:196.1.1_0: “Mendicants, before his awakening five great dreams appeared to the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, when he was still not awake but intent on awakening.
ai-an5:196.1.3_0: This great earth was his bed. Himalaya, king of mountains, was his pillow. His left hand was laid down in the eastern sea. And both his feet were laid down in the western sea.
ai-an5:196.1.4_0: This is the first great dream that appeared to the Realized One before his awakening.
ai-an5:196.2.1_0: Next, a kind of grass called ‘the crosser’ grew up from his navel and stood pressing against the cloudy sky.
ai-an5:196.2.2_0: This is the second great dream that appeared to the Realized One before his awakening.
ai-an5:196.3.1_0: Next, white caterpillars with black heads crawled up from his feet and covered his knees.
ai-an5:196.3.2_0: This is the third great dream that appeared to the Realized One before his awakening.
ai-an5:196.4.1_0: Next, four birds of different colors came from the four directions. They fell at his feet, turning pure white.
ai-an5:196.4.2_0: This is the fourth great dream that appeared to the Realized One before his awakening.
ai-an5:196.5.1_0: Next, he walked back and forth on top of a huge mountain of filth while remaining unsoiled.
ai-an5:196.5.2_0: This is the fifth great dream that appeared to the Realized One before his awakening.
ai-an5:196.6.1_0: Now, as to when, before his awakening, the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha was still not awake but intent on awakening. This great earth was his bed. Himalaya, king of mountains, was his pillow. His left hand was laid down in the eastern sea. And both his feet were laid down in the southern sea.
ai-an5:196.6.2_0: by the Realised One, monks, to awakened, awakened to the supreme perfect awakening.
ai-an5:196.6.3_0: This was the first great dream that appeared to him while he was still not awakened.
ai-an5:196.7.1_0: As to when a kind of grass called ‘the crosser’ grew up from his navel and stood pressing against the cloudy sky.
ai-an5:196.7.2_0: This was fulfilled when, after the Buddha had awakened to the noble eightfold path, it was well proclaimed wherever there are gods and humans.
ai-an5:196.7.3_0: This was the second great dream that appeared to him while he was still not awakened.
ai-an5:196.8.1_0: As to when white caterpillars with black heads crawled up from his feet and covered his knees.
ai-an5:196.8.2_0: This was fulfilled when many white-clothed laypeople went for refuge to him for life.
ai-an5:196.8.3_0: This was the third great dream that appeared to him while he was still not awakened.
ai-an5:196.9.1_0: As to when four birds of different colors came from the four directions. They fell at his feet, turning pure white.
ai-an5:196.9.2_0: This was fulfilled when members of the four castes—aristocrats, brahmins, merchants, and workers—went forth from the lay life to homelessness in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One and realized supreme freedom.
ai-an5:196.9.3_0: This was the fourth great dream that appeared to him while he was still not awakened.
ai-an5:196.10.1_0: As to when he walked back and forth on top of a huge mountain of filth while remaining unsoiled.
ai-an5:196.10.2_0: This was fulfilled when the Realized One received robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick. And he used them untied, uninfatuated, unattached, seeing the drawbacks, and understanding the escape.
ai-an5:196.10.3_0: This was the fifth great dream that appeared to him while he was still not awakened.
ai-an5:196.11.1_0: Before his awakening these five great dreams appeared to the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, when he was still not awake but intent on awakening.”
ai-an5:196.11.2_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an5:197.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five obstacles to rain, which the forecasters don’t know, and which their vision does not traverse.
ai-an5:197.1.3_0: In the upper atmosphere the fire element flares up,
ai-an5:197.1.5_0: This is the first obstacle to rain, which the forecasters don’t know, and which their vision does not traverse.
ai-an5:197.2.1_0: Furthermore, in the upper atmosphere the air element flares up,
ai-an5:197.2.3_0: This is the second obstacle to rain ...
ai-an5:197.3.1_0: Furthermore, Rāhu, lord of demons, receives water in his hand and tosses it in the ocean.
ai-an5:197.3.2_0: This is the third obstacle to rain ...
ai-an5:197.4.1_0: Furthermore, the gods of the rain clouds become negligent.
ai-an5:197.4.2_0: This is the fourth obstacle to rain ...
ai-an5:197.5.2_0: This is the fifth obstacle to rain, which the forecasters don’t know, and which their vision does not traverse.
ai-an5:197.5.3_0: These five obstacles to rain, which the forecasters don’t know, and which their vision does not traverse.”
ai-an5:198.1.1_0: “Mendicants, speech that has five factors is well spoken, not poorly spoken. It’s blameless and is not criticized by sensible people.
ai-an5:198.1.3_0: It is speech that is timely, true, gentle, beneficial, and loving.
ai-an5:198.1.4_0: Speech with these five factors is well spoken, not poorly spoken. It’s blameless and is not criticized by sensible people.”
ai-an5:199.1.1_0: “When ethical renunciates come to a family, the people make much merit for five reasons.
ai-an5:199.1.3_0: When ethical renunciates come to their family, the people get caught up in their family. At that time the family is practicing a path leading to peace.
ai-an5:199.2.1_0: When ethical renunciates come to their family, the people rise from their seats, bow down, and offer them a seat. At that time the family is practicing a path leading to a birth in an eminent family.
ai-an5:199.3.1_0: When ethical renunciates come to their family, the people get rid of the stain of stinginess. At that time the family is practicing a path leading to being illustrious.
ai-an5:199.4.1_0: When ethical renunciates come to their family, the people share what they have as best they can. At that time the family is practicing a path leading to great wealth.
ai-an5:199.5.1_0: When ethical renunciates come to their family, the people ask questions and listen to the teachings. At that time the family is practicing a path leading to great wisdom.
ai-an5:199.5.2_0: When ethical renunciates come to a family, the people make much merit for these five reasons.”
ai-an5:200.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five elements of escape.
ai-an5:200.1.3_0: Take a case where a mendicant focuses on sensual pleasures, but their mind isn’t eager, confident, settled, and decided about them.
ai-an5:200.1.4_0: But when they focus on renunciation, their mind is eager ...
ai-an5:200.1.5_0: Their mind is in a good state, well developed, well risen, well freed, and well detached from sensual pleasures.
ai-an5:200.1.6_0: They’re freed from the distressing and feverish defilements that arise because of sensual pleasures, so they don’t experience that kind of feeling.
ai-an5:200.1.7_0: This is how the escape from sensual pleasures is explained.
ai-an5:200.2.1_0: Take another case where a mendicant focuses on ill will, but their mind isn’t eager ...
ai-an5:200.2.2_0: But when they focus on good will, their mind is eager ...
ai-an5:200.2.3_0: Their mind is in a good state ... well detached from ill will.
ai-an5:200.2.4_0: They’re freed from the distressing and feverish defilements that arise because of ill will, so they don’t experience that kind of feeling.
ai-an5:200.2.5_0: This is how the escape from ill will is explained.
ai-an5:200.3.1_0: Take another case where a mendicant focuses on harming, but their mind isn’t eager ...
ai-an5:200.3.2_0: But when they focus on compassion, their mind is eager ...
ai-an5:200.3.3_0: Their mind is in a good state ... well detached from harming.
ai-an5:200.3.4_0: They’re freed from the distressing and feverish defilements that arise because of harming, so they don’t experience that kind of feeling.
ai-an5:200.3.5_0: This is how the escape from thoughts is explained.
ai-an5:200.4.1_0: Take another case where a mendicant focuses on form, but their mind isn’t eager ...
ai-an5:200.4.2_0: But when they focus on the formless, their mind is eager ...
ai-an5:200.4.3_0: Their mind is in a good state ... well detached from forms.
ai-an5:200.4.4_0: They’re freed from the distressing and feverish defilements that arise because of form, so they don’t experience that kind of feeling.
ai-an5:200.4.5_0: This is how the escape from forms is explained.
ai-an5:200.5.1_0: Take a case where a mendicant focuses on identity, but their mind isn’t eager, confident, settled, and decided about it.
ai-an5:200.5.2_0: But when they focus on the ending of identity, their mind is eager, confident, settled, and decided about it.
ai-an5:200.5.3_0: Their mind is in a good state, well developed, well risen, well freed, and well detached from identity.
ai-an5:200.5.4_0: They’re freed from the distressing and feverish defilements that arise because of identity, so they don’t experience that kind of feeling.
ai-an5:200.5.5_0: This is how the escape from identity is explained.
ai-an5:200.6.1_0: Delight in sensual pleasures, ill will, harming, form, and identity don’t linger within them.
ai-an5:200.6.2_0: That’s why they’re called a mendicant who is without underlying tendencies, who has cut off craving, untied the fetters, and by rightly comprehending conceit has made an end of suffering.
ai-an5:200.6.3_0: These are the five elements of escape.”
ai-an5:200.6.5_0: The fifth sub-chapter on Brahmins is finished.
ai-an5:200.7.5_0: The fourth group of four were completed.
ai-an5:201.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kimbilā in the Freshwater Mangrove Wood.
ai-an5:201.1.2_0: Then Venerable Kimbila went up to the Buddha.
ai-an5:201.1.2_2: While sitting on one side venerable Kimbila said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-an5:201.1.3_0: “What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why the true teaching does not last long after the final extinguishment of the Realized One?”
ai-an5:201.1.4_0: “Kimbila, it’s when the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen lack respect and reverence for the Teacher, the teaching, the Saṅgha, the training, and each other after the final extinguishment of the Realized One.
ai-an5:201.1.5_0: This is the cause, this is the reason why the true teaching does not last long after the final extinguishment of the Realized One.”
ai-an5:201.2.1_0: “What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why the true teaching does last long after the final extinguishment of the Realized One?”
ai-an5:201.2.2_0: “Kimbila, it’s when the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen maintain respect and reverence for the Teacher, the teaching, the Saṅgha, the training, and each other after the final extinguishment of the Realized One.
ai-an5:201.2.3_0: This is the cause, this is the reason why the true teaching does last long after the final extinguishment of the Realized One.”
ai-an5:202.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five benefits of listening to the teaching.
ai-an5:202.1.3_0: You learn new things, clarify what you’ve learned, get over uncertainty, correct your views, and inspire confidence in your mind.
ai-an5:202.1.4_0: These are the five benefits of listening to the teaching.”
ai-an5:203.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a fine royal thoroughbred with five factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and is considered a factor of kingship.
ai-an5:203.2.2_0: Integrity, speed, gentleness, patience, and sweetness.
ai-an5:203.2.3_0: A fine royal thoroughbred with these five factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and is considered a factor of kingship.
ai-an5:203.2.4_0: In the same way, a mendicant with five qualities is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of veneration with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.
ai-an5:203.3.2_0: Integrity, speed, gentleness, patience, and sweetness.
ai-an5:203.3.3_0: A mendicant with these five qualities is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of veneration with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.”
ai-an5:204.1.3_0: Faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom.
ai-an5:205.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five kinds of emotional barrenness.
ai-an5:205.1.3_0: Firstly, a mendicant has doubts about the Teacher. They’re uncertain, undecided, and lacking confidence.
ai-an5:205.1.4_0: This being so, their mind doesn’t incline toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving.
ai-an5:205.1.5_0: This is the first kind of emotional barrenness.
ai-an5:205.2.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has doubts about the teaching ...
ai-an5:205.2.4_0: A mendicant is angry and upset with their spiritual companions, resentful and closed off.
ai-an5:205.2.5_0: This being so, their mind doesn’t incline toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving.
ai-an5:205.2.6_0: This is the fifth kind of emotional barrenness.
ai-an5:205.2.7_0: These are the five kinds of emotional barrenness.”
ai-an5:206.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five emotional shackles.
ai-an5:206.1.3_0: Firstly, a mendicant isn’t free of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for sensual pleasures.
ai-an5:206.1.4_0: This being so, their mind doesn’t incline toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving.
ai-an5:206.1.5_0: This is the first emotional shackle.
ai-an5:206.2.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant isn’t free of greed for the body ...
ai-an5:206.2.2_0: They’re not free of greed for form ...
ai-an5:206.2.3_0: They eat as much as they like until their belly is full, then indulge in the pleasures of sleeping, lying, and drowsing ...
ai-an5:206.2.4_0: They lead the spiritual life wishing to be reborn in one of the orders of gods:
ai-an5:206.2.4_1: ‘By this precept or observance or mortification or spiritual life, may I become one of the gods!’
ai-an5:206.2.5_0: Any mendicant who lives the spiritual life wishing to be reborn in one of the orders of gods:
ai-an5:206.2.5_1: ‘By this precept or observance or mortification or spiritual life, may I not incline towards the gods of emotion.’
ai-an5:206.2.6_0: This is the fifth emotional shackle.
ai-an5:206.2.7_0: These are the five emotional shackles.”
ai-an5:206.2.8_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an5:207.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five benefits of porridge.
ai-an5:207.1.3_0: It wards off hunger, quenches thirst, settles the wind, cleans the bladder, and helps digestion.
ai-an5:207.1.4_0: These are the five benefits of porridge.”
ai-an5:208.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of not using chew sticks.
ai-an5:208.1.3_0: It’s not good for your eyes, you get bad breath, your taste-buds aren’t cleaned, bile and phlegm cover your food, and you lose your appetite.
ai-an5:208.1.4_0: These are the five drawbacks of not using chew sticks.
ai-an5:208.2.1_0: There are these five benefits of brushing your teeth:
ai-an5:208.2.3_0: It’s good for your eyes, you don’t get bad breath, your taste-buds are cleaned, bile and phlegm don’t cover your food, and food agrees with you.
ai-an5:208.2.4_0: These are the five benefits of using chew sticks.”
ai-an5:209.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks in reciting with a drawn-out singing sound.
ai-an5:209.1.3_0: You relish the sound of your own voice. Others relish the sound of your voice. Householders complain:
ai-an5:209.1.4_0: ‘These ascetics, followers of the Sakyan, sing just like us!’ When you’re enjoying the melody, your immersion breaks up. Those who come after follow your example.
ai-an5:209.1.5_0: These are the five drawbacks in reciting with a drawn-out singing sound.”
ai-an5:210.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of falling asleep unmindful and unaware.
ai-an5:210.1.3_0: you don’t sleep well; you wake up feeling miserable; you have nightmares; the gods don’t guard you; and you emit semen.
ai-an5:210.1.4_0: These are the five drawbacks of falling asleep unmindful and unaware.
ai-an5:210.2.1_0: And there are these five benefits in going to sleep mindful and heedful:
ai-an5:210.2.3_0: You sleep at ease and wake happily. You don’t have bad dreams. The deities protect you. And you don’t emit semen.
ai-an5:210.2.4_0: These are the five benefits of falling asleep mindful and aware.”
ai-an5:210.2.6_0: The first sub-chapter on what is finished.
ai-an5:210.3.1_0: it’s the right time for the teaching.
ai-an5:210.3.3_0: and when bound by bonds, he should,
ai-an5:211.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant who abuses and insults their spiritual companions, speaking ill of the noble ones, can expect these five drawbacks.
ai-an5:211.1.3_0: They’re expelled, cut off, shut out; or they commit a corrupt offense; or they contract a severe illness. They feel lost when they die. And when their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an5:211.1.4_0: A mendicant who abuses and insults their spiritual companions, speaking ill of the noble ones, can expect these five drawbacks.”
ai-an5:212.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant who starts arguments, quarrels, fights, debates, and disciplinary issues in the Saṅgha can expect five drawbacks.
ai-an5:212.1.3_0: They don’t achieve the unachieved. What they have achieved falls away. They get a bad reputation. They feel lost when they die. And when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an5:212.1.4_0: A mendicant who starts arguments, quarrels, fights, debates, and disciplinary issues in the Saṅgha can expect these five drawbacks.”
ai-an5:213.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks for an unethical person because of their failure in ethics.
ai-an5:213.1.3_0: Firstly, an unethical person loses substantial wealth on account of negligence.
ai-an5:213.2.1_0: Furthermore, an unethical person gets a bad reputation.
ai-an5:213.3.1_0: Furthermore, an unethical person enters any kind of assembly timid and embarrassed, whether it’s an assembly of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or ascetics.
ai-an5:213.4.1_0: Furthermore, an unethical person feels lost when they die.
ai-an5:213.5.1_0: Furthermore, an unethical person, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an5:213.5.3_0: These are the five drawbacks for an unethical person because of their failure in ethics.
ai-an5:213.6.1_0: There are these five benefits for an ethical person because of their accomplishment in ethics.
ai-an5:213.6.3_0: Firstly, an ethical person gains substantial wealth on account of diligence.
ai-an5:213.7.1_0: Furthermore, an ethical person gets a good reputation.
ai-an5:213.8.1_0: Furthermore, an ethical person enters any kind of assembly bold and self-assured, whether it’s an assembly of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or ascetics.
ai-an5:213.9.1_0: Furthermore, an ethical person dies not feeling lost.
ai-an5:213.10.1_0: Furthermore, when an ethical person’s body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
ai-an5:213.10.3_0: These are the five benefits for an ethical person because of their accomplishment in ethics.”
ai-an5:214.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of a person.
ai-an5:214.1.3_0: They use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, and nonsensical. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an5:214.1.4_0: These are the five drawbacks of a person.
ai-an5:214.2.1_0: There are these five benefits for a person who talks thoughtfully.
ai-an5:214.2.3_0: They don’t use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, and nonsensical. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
ai-an5:214.2.4_0: These are the five benefits for a person who talks thoughtfully.”
ai-an5:215.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of intolerance.
ai-an5:215.1.3_0: Most people find you unlikable and unloveable. You have lots of enmity and many faults. You feel lost when you die. And when your body breaks up, after death, you’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an5:215.1.4_0: These are the five drawbacks to intolerance.
ai-an5:215.2.1_0: There are these five benefits of tolerance.
ai-an5:215.2.3_0: Most people find you likable and lot. You don’t have lots of enmity and many faults. You don’t feel lost when you die. And when your body breaks up, after death, you’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
ai-an5:215.2.4_0: These are the five benefits of tolerance.”
ai-an5:216.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of intolerance.
ai-an5:216.1.3_0: Most people find you unlikable and unlovable. You’re cruel and remorseful. You feel lost when you die. And when your body breaks up, after death, you’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an5:216.1.4_0: These are the five drawbacks to intolerance.
ai-an5:216.2.1_0: There are these five benefits of tolerance.
ai-an5:216.2.3_0: Most people find you likable and lovable. You’re neither cruel nor remorseful. You don’t feel lost when you die. And when your body breaks up, after death, you’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
ai-an5:216.2.4_0: These are the five benefits of tolerance.”
ai-an5:216.2.5_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an5:217.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of uninspiring conduct.
ai-an5:217.1.4_0: After examination, sensible people criticize you.
ai-an5:217.1.6_0: They feel lost when they die.
ai-an5:217.1.7_0: And when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-an5:217.1.8_0: These are the five drawbacks of uninspiring conduct.
ai-an5:217.2.1_0: There are these five benefits of inspiring conduct.
ai-an5:217.2.4_0: After examination, sensible people praise you.
ai-an5:217.2.7_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
ai-an5:217.2.8_0: These are the five benefits of inspiring conduct.”
ai-an5:218.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of uninspiring conduct.
ai-an5:218.1.3_0: You don’t inspire confidence in those without it. You cause some with confidence to change their minds. You don’t follow the Teacher’s instructions. Those who come after you follow your example. And your mind doesn’t become clear.
ai-an5:218.1.4_0: These are the five drawbacks of uninspiring conduct.
ai-an5:218.2.1_0: There are these five benefits of inspiring conduct.
ai-an5:218.2.3_0: You inspire confidence in those without it. You increase confidence in those who have it. You follow the Teacher’s instructions. Those who come after you follow your example. And your mind becomes clear.
ai-an5:218.2.4_0: These are the five benefits of inspiring conduct.”
ai-an5:219.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of a fire.
ai-an5:219.1.3_0: It’s bad for your eyes. It’s bad for your complexion. It makes you weak. It draws in groups. And it encourages unworthy talk.
ai-an5:219.1.4_0: These are the five drawbacks of a fire.”
ai-an5:220.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of Madhurā.
ai-an5:220.1.3_0: The ground is uneven and dusty, the dogs are fierce, the native spirits are vicious, and it’s hard to get almsfood.
ai-an5:220.1.4_0: These are the five drawbacks of Madhurā.”
ai-an5:220.1.6_0: The second sub-chapter on abuses is finished.
ai-an5:220.2.3_0: Once again there are two kinds of stone,
ai-an5:221.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks for someone who likes long and aimless wandering.
ai-an5:221.1.3_0: You don’t learn new things. You don’t clarify what you’ve learned. You lack confidence in some things you have learned. You contract a severe illness. You don’t have any friends.
ai-an5:221.1.4_0: These are the five drawbacks for someone who likes long and aimless wandering.
ai-an5:221.2.1_0: There are these five benefits of a reasonable amount of wandering.
ai-an5:221.2.3_0: You learn new things. You clarify what you’ve learned. You have confidence in some things you have learned. You don’t contract severe illness. You have friends.
ai-an5:221.2.4_0: These are the five benefits of a reasonable amount of wandering.”
ai-an5:222.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks for someone who likes long and aimless wandering.
ai-an5:222.1.3_0: You don’t achieve the unachieved. What you have achieved falls away. You lose confidence in some things you’ve achieved. You contract a severe illness. You don’t have any friends.
ai-an5:222.1.4_0: These are the five drawbacks for someone who likes long and aimless wandering.
ai-an5:222.2.1_0: There are these five benefits of a reasonable amount of wandering.
ai-an5:222.2.3_0: You achieve the unachieved. What you have achieved doesn’t fall away. You’re confident in some things you’ve achieved. You don’t contract severe illness. You have friends.
ai-an5:222.2.4_0: These are the five benefits of a reasonable amount of wandering.”
ai-an5:223.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of overstaying.
ai-an5:223.1.3_0: You have a lot of stuff and store it up. You have a lot of medicine and store it up. You have a lot of duties and responsibilities, and become capable in whatever needs to be done. You mix closely with laypeople and renunciates, socializing inappropriately like a layperson. And when you leave that monastery, you miss it.
ai-an5:223.1.4_0: These are the five drawbacks of overstaying.
ai-an5:223.2.1_0: There are these five benefits of staying for a reasonable length of time.
ai-an5:223.2.3_0: You don’t have a lot of stuff and store it up. You don’t have a lot of medicine and store it up. You don’t have a lot of duties and responsibilities, or become capable in whatever needs to be done. You don’t mix closely with laypeople and renunciates, socializing inappropriately like a layperson. And when you leave that monastery, you don’t miss it.
ai-an5:223.2.4_0: These are the five benefits of staying for a reasonable length of time.”
ai-an5:224.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of overstaying.
ai-an5:224.1.3_0: You’re stingy with dwellings, families, material possessions, praise, and the teaching.
ai-an5:224.1.4_0: These are the five drawbacks of overstaying.
ai-an5:224.2.1_0: There are these five benefits of staying for a reasonable length of time.
ai-an5:224.2.3_0: You’re not stingy with dwellings, families, material possessions, praise, and the teaching.
ai-an5:224.2.4_0: These are the five benefits of staying for a reasonable length of time.”
ai-an5:225.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of visiting families.
ai-an5:225.1.3_0: You fall into an offense for wandering without leave. You fall into an offense for sitting in a private place with someone of the opposite sex. You fall into an offense for sitting in a hidden place with someone of the opposite sex. You fall into an offense for teaching more than five or six sentences to someone of the opposite sex. You have a lot of sensual thoughts.
ai-an5:225.1.4_0: These are the five drawbacks of visiting families.”
ai-an5:226.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a mendicant who visits families for too long, mixing closely with them.
ai-an5:226.1.3_0: You often see members of the opposite sex.
ai-an5:226.1.5_0: Being so close, you become intimate.
ai-an5:226.1.6_0: And being intimate, lust overcame them.
ai-an5:226.1.7_1: they will lead the spiritual life dissatisfied, or commit one of the corrupt offenses, or resign the training and return to a lesser life.
ai-an5:226.1.8_0: These are the five drawbacks for a mendicant who visits families for too long, mixing closely with them.”
ai-an5:226.1.9_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an5:227.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of riches.
ai-an5:227.1.3_0: Fire, water, kings, thieves, and unloved heirs all take a share.
ai-an5:227.1.4_0: These are the five drawbacks of riches.
ai-an5:227.2.1_0: There are these five benefits of riches.
ai-an5:227.2.3_0: Riches enable you to bring pleasure and joy to yourself; your mother and father; your children, partners, bondservants, workers, and staff; and your friends and colleagues; and to keep them all happy. And they enable you to establish an uplifting religious donation for ascetics and brahmins that’s conducive to heaven, ripens in happiness, and leads to heaven.
ai-an5:227.2.4_0: These are the five benefits of riches.”
ai-an5:228.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks for a family who takes their meals late in the day.
ai-an5:228.1.3_0: When guests visit, they are not served on time.
ai-an5:228.1.4_0: The deities who accept spirit-offerings are not served on time.
ai-an5:228.1.5_0: Ascetics and brahmins who eat in one part of the day, abstaining from eating at night, and from food at the wrong time are not served on time.
ai-an5:228.1.6_0: Bondservants, workers, and staff do their duties (to others).
ai-an5:228.1.7_0: A meal eaten during the proper and not nutritious.
ai-an5:228.1.8_0: These are the five drawbacks for a family who takes their meals late in the day.
ai-an5:228.2.1_0: There are these five benefits for a family who takes their meals at a proper time.
ai-an5:228.2.3_0: When guests visit, they are served on time.
ai-an5:228.2.4_0: The deities who accept spirit-offerings are served on time.
ai-an5:228.2.5_0: Ascetics and brahmins who eat in one part of the day, abstaining from eating at night, and from food at the wrong time are served on time.
ai-an5:228.2.6_0: Bondservants, workers, and staff do their duties attentively.
ai-an5:228.2.7_0: A meal eaten during the proper period is nutritious.
ai-an5:228.2.8_0: These are the five benefits for a family who takes their meals at a proper time.”
ai-an5:229.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of a black snake.
ai-an5:229.1.3_0: It’s filthy, stinking, cowardly, frightening, and treacherous.
ai-an5:229.1.4_0: These are the five drawbacks of a black snake.
ai-an5:229.2.1_0: In the same way there are five drawbacks of a female.
ai-an5:229.2.3_0: It’s filthy, stinking, cowardly, frightening, and treacherous.
ai-an5:229.2.4_0: These are the five drawbacks of a female.”
ai-an5:230.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of a black snake.
ai-an5:230.1.3_0: It’s irritable, hostile, venomous, fork-tongued, and treacherous.
ai-an5:230.1.4_0: These are the five drawbacks of a black snake.
ai-an5:230.2.1_0: In the same way there are five drawbacks of a female.
ai-an5:230.2.3_0: It’s irritable, hostile, venomous, fork-tongued, and treacherous.
ai-an5:230.2.10_0: These are the five drawbacks of a female.”
ai-an5:230.2.12_0: The third sub-chapter on walking-paths is finished.
ai-an5:231.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a resident mendicant with five qualities is not admirable.
ai-an5:231.1.3_0: They’re not accomplished in being well-presented and doing their duties.
ai-an5:231.1.4_0: They’re not very learned and don’t remember what they’ve learned.
ai-an5:231.1.5_0: They’re not self-effacing and don’t enjoy self-effacement.
ai-an5:231.1.6_0: He is not a good speaker, but is not well-known.
ai-an5:231.1.8_0: A resident mendicant with these five qualities is not admirable.
ai-an5:231.2.1_0: A resident mendicant with these five qualities is admirable.
ai-an5:231.2.3_0: They’re accomplished in being well-presented and doing their duties.
ai-an5:231.2.4_0: They’re very learned and remember what they’ve learned.
ai-an5:231.2.6_0: He is well-spoken and has a good voice.
ai-an5:231.2.8_0: A resident mendicant with these five qualities is admirable.”
ai-an5:232.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a resident mendicant with five qualities is dear and beloved to their spiritual companions, respected and admired.
ai-an5:232.1.3_0: He is virtuous and restrained by the Monastic Code. His conduct is good, he associates with the right people, and he sees danger in minor faults. And he undertakes and trains in the training rules.
ai-an5:232.1.4_0: They’re very learned, remembering and keeping what they’ve learned. These teachings are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased, describing a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure. They are very learned in such teachings, remembering them, reinforcing them by recitation, mentally scrutinizing them, and comprehending them theoretically.
ai-an5:232.1.5_0: They’re a good speaker. Their voice is polished, clear, articulate, and expresses the meaning.
ai-an5:232.1.6_0: they get the four absorptions—blissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind—when they want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-an5:232.1.7_0: They realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
ai-an5:232.1.8_0: A resident mendicant with these five qualities is dear and beloved to their spiritual companions, respected and admired.”
ai-an5:233.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a resident mendicant with five qualities beautifies the monastery.
ai-an5:233.1.3_0: They’re ethical, restrained in the code of conduct, with good behavior and supporters. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.
ai-an5:233.1.5_0: They’re a good speaker. Their voice is polished, clear, articulate, and expresses the meaning.
ai-an5:233.1.6_0: They’re able to instruct, inspired, and gladden them with a teaching.
ai-an5:233.1.7_0: they get the four absorptions—blissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind—when they want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-an5:233.1.8_0: A resident mendicant with these five qualities beautifies the monastery.”
ai-an5:234.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a resident mendicant with five qualities is very helpful to the monastery.
ai-an5:234.1.3_0: They’re ethical, restrained in the code of conduct, with good behavior and supporters. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.
ai-an5:234.1.5_0: They repair what is decayed and damaged.
ai-an5:234.1.6_0: When a large mendicant Saṅgha is arriving with mendicants from abroad, they go to the lay people and announce:
ai-an5:234.1.7_0: ‘A large mendicant Saṅgha is arriving with mendicants from abroad. Make merit! Now is the time to make merit!’
ai-an5:234.1.8_0: they get the four absorptions—blissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind—when they want, without trouble or difficulty.
ai-an5:234.1.9_0: A resident mendicant with these five qualities is very helpful to the monastery.”
ai-an5:235.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a resident mendicant with five qualities shows compassion to the lay people.
ai-an5:235.1.3_0: They encourage them in higher ethics.
ai-an5:235.1.5_0: When they are sick, they go to them and prompt their mindfulness, saying:
ai-an5:235.1.6_0: ‘Establish your mindfulness, good sirs, in what is worthy.’
ai-an5:235.1.7_0: When a large mendicant Saṅgha is arriving with mendicants from abroad, they go to the lay people and announce:
ai-an5:235.1.8_0: ‘A large mendicant Saṅgha is arriving with mendicants from abroad. Make merit! Now is the time to make merit!’
ai-an5:235.1.9_0: And they eat whatever food they give them, coarse or fine, not wasting a gift given in faith.
ai-an5:235.1.10_0: A resident mendicant with these five qualities shows compassion to the lay people.”
ai-an5:236.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a resident mendicant with five qualities is cast down to hell.
ai-an5:236.1.3_0: Without examining or scrutinizing, they praise those deserving of criticism
ai-an5:236.1.4_0: and criticizes those deserving of praise.
ai-an5:236.1.5_0: She arouses faith in things that are dubious,
ai-an5:236.1.6_0: and doesn’t arouse faith in things that are inspiring.
ai-an5:236.1.7_0: And they waste a gift given in faith.
ai-an5:236.1.8_0: A resident mendicant with these five qualities is cast down to hell.
ai-an5:236.2.1_0: A resident mendicant with five qualities is raised up to heaven.
ai-an5:236.2.3_0: After examining and scrutinizing, they criticize those deserving of criticism
ai-an5:236.2.4_0: and praises those deserving of praise.
ai-an5:236.2.5_0: She doesn’t arouse faith in things that are dubious,
ai-an5:236.2.6_0: and does arouse faith in things that are inspiring.
ai-an5:236.2.7_0: And they don’t waste a gift given in faith.
ai-an5:236.2.8_0: A resident mendicant with these five qualities is raised up to heaven.”
ai-an5:236.2.9_0: The sixth offering to an individual.
ai-an5:237.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a resident mendicant with five qualities is cast down to hell.
ai-an5:237.1.3_0: Without examining or scrutinizing, they praise those deserving of criticism
ai-an5:237.1.4_0: and criticizes those deserving of praise.
ai-an5:237.1.5_0: They’re stingy and avaricious regarding monasteries.
ai-an5:237.1.6_0: They’re stingy and avaricious regarding families.
ai-an5:237.1.7_0: And they waste a gift given in faith.
ai-an5:237.1.8_0: A resident mendicant with these five qualities is cast down to hell.
ai-an5:237.2.1_0: A resident mendicant with five qualities is raised up to heaven.
ai-an5:237.2.3_0: After examining and scrutinizing, they criticize those deserving of criticism
ai-an5:237.2.4_0: and praises those deserving of praise.
ai-an5:237.2.5_0: They’re not stingy and avaricious regarding monasteries.
ai-an5:237.2.6_0: They’re not stingy and avaricious regarding families.
ai-an5:237.2.7_0: And they don’t waste a gift given in faith.
ai-an5:237.2.8_0: A resident mendicant with these five qualities is raised up to heaven.”
